original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they will certainly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la de ltar gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la de ltar gnas pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing on their own stage🔽are unassailable on their own stage.

original: rang gi sa la thub pa med pa yin te zhes bya bas ni de ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub tu nges par mngon par 'tshang rgya ba ste /🔽bdud @173a * //
analyzed: rang gi sa la thub pa med pa yin te zhes bya bas ni de ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub tu nges par mngon par 'tshang rgya ba ste / bdud @173a * //
translated: This shows that they will certainly fully awaken to unsurpassed awakening,

original: dang mu stegs can la sogs pas gzhan du bsgyur mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang mu stegs can la sogs pas gzhan du bsgyur mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and that they cannot be turned away from that by Māra, non-Buddhists, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings standing like that on the irreversible stage have the knowledge of being unassailable.

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa la thub pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa la thub pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason for being unassailable on one’s own stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i ye shes chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs pa de mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non cing mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i ye shes chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs pa de mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non cing mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of that bodhisattva, which realizes that all phenomena are empty of their own marks, is not overcome or robbed by adverse factors.🔽Subhūti, if Māra, the evil one, were to come to the presence of an irreversible bodhisattva great being in the form of a buddha,

original: rab 'byor gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to
translated: up to “I have prophesied unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,”

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rang gi sa la thub pa med pa dang / mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i don de nyid bdud kyis bslur mi tshugs pa'i tshig rnams kyis gsal bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rang gi sa la thub pa med pa dang / mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i don de nyid bdud kyis bslur mi tshugs pa'i tshig rnams kyis gsal bar bstan pa'o //
translated: this clarifies the meaning of that irreversible bodhisattva having the wisdom that cannot be overcome or robbed on his own ground with words that cannot be deceived by Māra.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag la yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag la yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni
translated: “It is thus: I have those qualities that, when possessed, cause a bodhisattva mahāsattva to be prophesied for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bdud kyis bslur mi tshugs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bdud kyis bslur mi tshugs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why Māra cannot deceive him.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs shing /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs shing /
translated: He has realized that ultimately all phenomena are empty by nature.🔽And he has the signs and indications that are the marks of being a bodhisattva who is irreversible.

original: kun rdzob tu yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par mngon pa'i rtags dang mtshan ma gong du bshad pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' de la yod pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par lung bstan to
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par mngon pa'i rtags dang mtshan ma gong du bshad pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' de la yod pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par lung bstan to
translated: Because of that, he is prophesied to be certain to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rab 'byor gal te bdud sdig to can nam bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig ces bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis kyang phyir mi🔽ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rang gi sa la thub pa med cing mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i don de nyid bdud kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lung bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo sde sun phyung bas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te bdud sdig to can nam bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig ces bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis kyang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rang gi sa la thub pa med cing mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i don de nyid bdud kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lung bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo sde sun phyung bas /
translated: The passage beginning Subhuti, if a person, whether a Mara or someone inspired by a Mara, should come along and say to a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva and ending one should know that Bodhisattva-Mahasattva to be irreversible from full Awakening shows that an irreversible Bodhisattva is not defeated and does not lose his own level, and that he has the knowledge of that.

original: @173b mi tshugs pa'i tshig rnams kyis gsal bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @173b mi tshugs pa'i tshig rnams kyis gsal bar bstan pa'o //
translated: This very meaning is clarified by the words of the irreversible Bodhisattva's invulnerability to Mara's predictions of his becoming a Disciple or a Solitary Buddha, and to his repudiation of the Mahayana scriptures.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag ni de la yod do zhes bya bas ni de ltar bdud kyis bslur mi tshugs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' de la phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang / mtshan ma gong du bshad pa rnams yod pas /
analyzed: gang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag ni de la yod do zhes bya bas ni de ltar bdud kyis bslur mi tshugs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste / byang chub sems dpa' de la phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang / mtshan ma gong du bshad pa rnams yod pas /
translated: The phrase because those aspects, those modes, and those signs exist for the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being indicates the reason why Mara cannot deceive him.

original: bdud kyis bslur mi tshugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdud kyis bslur mi tshugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because those signs and indications of irreversibility that were explained above exist for that Bodhisattva, Mara cannot deceive him.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir bdag kyang yongs su gtong la /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir bdag kyang yongs su gtong la /
translated: he gives himself up for the sake of upholding the true Dharma.

original: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod cing yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba nas de dag gi dam pa'i chos kyang yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir lus dang srog kyang
analyzed: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod cing yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba nas de dag gi dam pa'i chos kyang yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir lus dang srog kyang
translated: Even if it means losing their lives, they will not give up on them, and so on, up to they will uphold their holy Dharma.🔽🔽This shows that for the sake of upholding the holy Dharma, they will not give up on sentient beings even if it means losing their bodies and lives.

original: mi phangs par byed na /
analyzed: mi phangs par byed na /
translated: From “Even if their lives are at stake, they do not give up” up to “I think they will uphold the true Dharma” shows that for the sake of upholding the true Dharma, they do not begrudge their bodies and lives.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan pa'o //🔽de la chos gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan pa'o // de la chos gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: From “If they do not begrudge their bodies and lives for the sake of the true Dharma” up to “they are irreversible” shows that they are irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod pa'i chos de dag gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor chos de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod pa'i chos de dag gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor chos de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: From “What are the dharmas for the sake of which bodhisattva great beings give up their own bodies and lives, even if their lives are at stake?” up to “Subhūti, for the sake of that dharma, bodhisattva great beings give up their own bodies and lives, even if their lives are at stake” shows that they are irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni srog gi phyir yang dam pa'i chos mi gtong ba de gang yin pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni srog gi phyir yang dam pa'i chos mi gtong ba de gang yin pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage up to “I will not give up the true teaching even to save my life” teaches the object of the bodhisattva’s nonrejection of the true teaching even to save his life.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lta bur don zab mo /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lta bur don zab mo /
translated: The profound meaning, such as the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad stong par ston pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong par ston pa /
translated: which teaches the emptiness of all things,

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba /
translated: which is difficult for the whole world to believe,

original: mi blun po rnams kyis thos na /
analyzed: mi blun po rnams kyis thos na /
translated: when the foolish hear it,

original: 'di ni chos ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni chos ma yin /
translated: they say, “This is not the Dharma,

original: 'dul ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'dul ba ma yin /
translated: this is not the Vinaya,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ma yin no zhes /
translated: this is not the Buddha’s teaching!”

original: skur ba 'debs shing dan du zer ba de lta bu'i chos zab mo yongs su gzung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' srog dang yang bsngo'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skur ba 'debs shing dan du zer ba de lta bu'i chos zab mo yongs su gzung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' srog dang yang bsngo'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and they slander it and revile it. For the sake of preserving such a profound teaching, the bodhisattva would give up his life.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar bslab par bya ste zhes bya ba nas don gyi dbang 'di mthong bas dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir @174a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar bslab par bya ste zhes bya ba nas don gyi dbang 'di mthong bas dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir @174a * //
translated: Seeing this meaning, for the sake of upholding the true Dharma,

original: bdag kyang yongs su gtong la /
analyzed: bdag kyang yongs su gtong la /
translated: I would give up even myself,🔽and even if my life were to end, I would persist.

original: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de nges par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de nges par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: This shows that the irreversible bodhisattva will definitely attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: chos de yang bdag gi chos yin par nges par 'gyur ro snyam nas srog gi phyir yang dam pa'i chos mi gtong na phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos de yang bdag gi chos yin par nges par 'gyur ro snyam nas srog gi phyir yang dam pa'i chos mi gtong na phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: and that since even for the sake of one's life one does not abandon the true Dharma, one should know that one is an irreversible bodhisattva.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston pa la nem nur med ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston pa la nem nur med ces bya ba nas /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being, has no doubts about the Tathagata, the Arhat, the fully Enlightened One teaching the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar gzungs rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ci bshad pa rnams kyi don dang tshig rnams shes rab kyis rtogs shing /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar gzungs rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ci bshad pa rnams kyi don dang tshig rnams shes rab kyis rtogs shing /
translated: And why?🔽Because he has attained the dhāraṇīs.🔽This shows the quality of not wasting the true Dharma, because the irreversible Bodhisattva, by means of his wisdom, understands the meanings and the words of whatever Dharma the Lord teaches,

original: dran pas mi brjed pa'i gzungs thob pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos ji ltar gzung bar chud za bar mi byed pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dran pas mi brjed pa'i gzungs thob pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos ji ltar gzung bar chud za bar mi byed pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: and because he has attained the dhāraṇī of memory which does not forget.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas yongs su 'dzin pa'i gzungs rab tu thob pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo rnams chud mi za'o zhes🔽bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas yongs su 'dzin pa'i gzungs rab tu thob pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo rnams chud mi za'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: ...the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having attained the dhāraṇī of retention, does not waste the sūtras spoken by the Tathāgata.

original: gzungs gang dang gang rnams thob pas /
analyzed: gzungs gang dang gang rnams thob pas /
translated: This teaches which dhāraṇīs, when attained,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdo rnams chud mi za bar 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdo rnams chud mi za bar 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
translated: cause the sūtras spoken by the Tathāgata not to be wasted.

original: mi zad pa'i za ma tog gi gzungs zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad la thogs pa med par 'jug cing /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i za ma tog gi gzungs zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad la thogs pa med par 'jug cing /
translated: The dhāraṇī called the inexhaustible casket is the bodhisattva's wisdom that engages all phenomena without obstruction.

original: the tshom 'dri ba dang rtogs pa grangs med byung yang /
analyzed: the tshom 'dri ba dang rtogs pa grangs med byung yang /
translated: Even if countless doubts and realizations arise,

original: lan 'debs pa la zad mi shes pa dang / dran pa rnam pa mang po tshe rabs du mar yang mi brjed pa la mi zad pa'i gzungs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa la zad mi shes pa dang / dran pa rnam pa mang po tshe rabs du mar yang mi brjed pa la mi zad pa'i gzungs zhes bya ste /
translated: the answers are inexhaustible, and the many kinds of mindfulness are not forgotten even in many lifetimes. This is called the inexhaustible dhāraṇī.

original: shes rab dang dran pa de gnyis kyis chos bshad do cog gi don dang tshig rnams gzungs su bzung ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang dran pa de gnyis kyis chos bshad do cog gi don dang tshig rnams gzungs su bzung ste /
translated: By means of these two, wisdom and mindfulness, all the meanings and words of the Dharma teachings are retained in memory.

original: snod blugs pa dang 'dra bar mi zad pa'i za ma tog ces bya'o //
analyzed: snod blugs pa dang 'dra bar mi zad pa'i za ma tog ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the inexhaustible casket because it is like a casket that is never empty.

original: za ma tog ces bya ba'i ni nor bu rin po che la sogs pa rgyan dang / nor rin po che gces pa rnams gzhug pa'i snod la bya'o //
analyzed: za ma tog ces bya ba'i ni nor bu rin po che la sogs pa rgyan dang / nor rin po che gces pa rnams gzhug pa'i snod la bya'o //
translated: A casket is a container for precious jewels and other valuable ornaments.

original: za ma tog de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab @174b dang ; dran pa gnyis kyang dam pa'i chos rin po che rnams kyi snod dang / gzungs zad mi shes shing chud mi za ba yin pa'i phyir mi zad pa'i za ma tog gi gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: za ma tog de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab @174b dang ; dran pa gnyis kyang dam pa'i chos rin po che rnams kyi snod dang / gzungs zad mi shes shing chud mi za ba yin pa'i phyir mi zad pa'i za ma tog gi gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva’s wisdom and mindfulness are like a casket because they are the container for the precious jewels of the sacred Dharma and because they are the inexhaustible and undiminishing memory of the Dharma.

original: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
translated: The seal of the ocean is called the seal of the ocean because it is like the ocean.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang dran pa'i gzungs kyang rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar zab cing gting dpag dka' ba la rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya'o //🔽padmo rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang dran pa'i gzungs kyang rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar zab cing gting dpag dka' ba la rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya'o // padmo rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The “seal of the ocean” is the bodhisattva’s wisdom and the dhāraṇī of mindfulness, which are as deep as the ocean and difficult to fathom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa dang 'dra ba'i gzungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa dang 'dra ba'i gzungs te /
translated: The “array of lotuses” is the dhāraṇī that is like the bodhisattva’s knowledge.

original: sems can gyi don du thabs kyis 'khor ba na rnam pa sna tshogs su spyod cing gnas kyang /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du thabs kyis 'khor ba na rnam pa sna tshogs su spyod cing gnas kyang /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, one skillfully engages in and abides in the various aspects of saṃsāra.

original: 'khor ba'i nyes pas mi gos par gnas te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes pas mi gos par gnas te /
translated: One abides without being tainted by the faults of saṃsāra.

original: padma chu'i nang na gnas kyang /
analyzed: padma chu'i nang na gnas kyang /
translated: Although a lotus grows in water,

translated: The Lord: As the Suchness of form is, so is form deep.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: As the Suchness of the knowledge of all modes is, so is the knowledge of all modes deep.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin tsam du zad de /
translated: All dharmas are in the end Suchness only.

original: de bzhin nyid de yang mtshan ma'i sgo nas dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de yang mtshan ma'i sgo nas dmigs su med do //
translated: And that Suchness cannot be apprehended by objective perception.

original: dmigs pa can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is deep because it is not the domain of objective perception.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti asks, “Blessed One, what is the suchness of form?”🔽and so on up to, “Blessed One, what is the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ji lta bu lags @176b zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta bu yin pa zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ji lta bu lags @176b zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta bu yin pa zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: in order to initiate a discussion of the suchness of form and so on in detail.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de la gzugs kyang med /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de la gzugs kyang med /
translated: “Subhūti, the suchness of form is such that form does not exist in it,

original: gzugs las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med de /
analyzed: gzugs las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med de /
translated: and suchness does not exist apart from form.🔽The suchness of form is like that.”

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni de lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid de la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni de lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid de la /
translated: and so on up to, “Subhūti, the suchness of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is such that unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening does not exist in it,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang med /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang med /
translated: and suchness does not exist apart from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni de lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni de lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu
translated: Unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is like that.

original: yin pa zhib tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yin pa zhib tu bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage explains in detail what the suchness of all phenomena is like.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: Suchness is the dharmatā of phenomena, the nature of emptiness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin /
translated: It does not exist as a thing such as form.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i dngos por yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i dngos por yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It also does not exist as a thing other than form.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ltar thabs mkhas pas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs las kyang bzlog /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ltar thabs mkhas pas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs las kyang bzlog /
translated: The request, “Blessed One, in this way, with skillful means, irreversible bodhisattva great beings are turned away from form

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las kyang bzlog /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las kyang bzlog /
translated: and nirvāṇa is taught,” continues up to “they are turned away from the unshared qualities of a buddha and

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan /
translated: And nirvana is also taught.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / thun mong dang thun mong ma lags pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i 'dzin pa thams cad las kyang bzlog /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / thun mong dang thun mong ma lags pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i 'dzin pa thams cad las kyang bzlog /
translated: It is also a reversal from all the apprehensions of the mundane, the supramundane, the shared, the unshared, the contaminated, and the uncontaminated.🔽And nirvana is also taught.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan pa de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan pa de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
translated: Up to “It is amazing” is as follows: Since all phenomena, such as imputed forms and so on, are not ultimately established as existent things,🔽the teaching that “forms and so on are profound” is a reversal from attachment to forms and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zab bo zhes bstan pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa las bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la bzlog pa yin la de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub ste
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zab bo zhes bstan pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa las bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la bzlog pa yin la de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub ste
translated: Thus all phenomena, such as forms and so on, are not ultimately established as existent things.

original: / stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zab mo bstan pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: / stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zab mo bstan pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yin te /

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa zab bo zhes bstan pa tsam gyis gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa las kyang bzlog /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa zab bo zhes bstan pa tsam gyis gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa las kyang bzlog /

original: mya ngan @177a * //
analyzed: mya ngan @177a * //
translated: Nirvana is taught.

original: las 'das pa yang bstan pa'i thabs mkhas pa de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dmigs pa can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa bstan pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: byang chub yid la bya ba dang ldan par gnas pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ji skad bshad pa bzhin du spyod par sems shing rtsol ba yang phan yon de ltar che

translated: How much more so for one who is endowed with the thought of enlightenment?

analyzed: na 'du 'dzi spangs te su dang yang ma 'dres par gcig pu dben par 'dug cing bsgoms na lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that if the benefit is so great for one who lives in a busy place and who thinks and strives to practice as explained in the Perfection of Wisdom, then what need is there to speak of one who, having given up busy places, lives alone in solitude, unassociated with anyone?🔽Subhuti, it is just as if a man who is lustful, who is full of thoughts of lust,🔽who is thinking of a woman,🔽who is longing for a woman,

original: ni byang chub @177b sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa bskal pa mang por sgrib pa byang zhing 'khor ba las thar bar 'gyur ba'i dpe skyes pa bud med la chags pa'i rtog pa mang po 'byung ba las blangs te bstan pa
analyzed: ni byang chub @177b sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa bskal pa mang por sgrib pa byang zhing 'khor ba las thar bar 'gyur ba'i dpe skyes pa bud med la chags pa'i rtog pa mang po 'byung ba las blangs te bstan pa
translated: This is the explanation of the analogy of the many thoughts of attachment to women that arise in a man, which is taken up to show that the bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom for many eons will clear away the obscurations and be liberated from samsara.

original: ste / skyes pa bud med la chags pa nub gcig la sems kyi rtog pa mang po ji snyed cig 'byung ba de snyed kyi bskal par byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i 'khor ba spangs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o
analyzed: ste / skyes pa bud med la chags pa nub gcig la sems kyi rtog pa mang po ji snyed cig 'byung ba de snyed kyi bskal par byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i 'khor ba spangs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o
translated: The benefit of abandoning samsara for as many eons as there are thoughts that arise in a man attached to a woman in a single night is taught.

original: // gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ji skad du bstan pa 'di la slob pa dang zhes bya ba nas grangs dang cha dang bgrang ba dang dpe dang rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol
analyzed: // gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ji skad du bstan pa 'di la slob pa dang zhes bya ba nas grangs dang cha dang bgrang ba dang dpe dang rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol
translated: Those who train in this profound perfection of wisdom as it has been taught... up to... do not approach it in terms of number, part, enumeration, or example.

original: tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las ji skad bstan pa bzhin du slob cing nyams su len pa dang bla na med pa'i byang chub la sgrib pa'i skyon rnams spong ba phan yon che bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las ji skad bstan pa bzhin du slob cing nyams su len pa dang bla na med pa'i byang chub la sgrib pa'i skyon rnams spong ba phan yon che bar bstan pa ste /
translated: It is shown that the benefits of practicing the profound transcendent perfections as they are taught here are very great, for they enable one to train in them and put them into practice and to eliminate the defects that obscure the attainment of unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des nyin zhag gcig la dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig bsags pa de la gzugs shig yod du zin na /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des nyin zhag gcig la dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig bsags pa de la gzugs shig yod du zin na /
translated: If the roots of virtue accumulated in a single day and night by a bodhisattva who practices in this way were to take on physical form,

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyang yongs su gang bar gyur kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba snga ma de /
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyang yongs su gang bar gyur kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba snga ma de /
translated: they would fill worlds as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i lhag ma la 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i lhag ma la 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des /
translated: And compared to that, the remaining roots of virtue would fill as many worlds as the former roots of virtue would have filled.

original: brgya'i char yang mi chog pa nas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char yang mi chog cing /
analyzed: brgya'i char yang mi chog pa nas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char yang mi chog cing /
translated: And those remaining roots of virtue would not even equal a hundredth part of the former roots of virtue, not even a thousandth or a hundred thousandth part, not even a millionth or a billionth part, not even a ten millionth or a trillionth part, not even a hundred thousand quintillionth part of them.

original: grangs dang cha dang bgrang ba dang dpe dang rgyur yang byar mi rung ba tsam du dge ba'i rtsa ba mang du 'phel ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: grangs dang cha dang bgrang ba dang dpe dang rgyur yang byar mi rung ba tsam du dge ba'i rtsa ba mang du 'phel ba bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that the roots of virtue increase to such an extent that they cannot be compared, measured, counted, or exemplified.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon chog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog dang / dkon mchog gsum la sbyin pa byin na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon chog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog dang / dkon mchog gsum la sbyin pa byin na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: if they give gifts to the Three Jewels—the Buddha Jewel, the Dharma Jewel, and the Saṅgha Jewel—for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, and so forth,🔽up to

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽The method by which they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood is the method of the bodhisattva great beings.”

original: tshul gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshul lo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab

translated: With this passage, the profound perfection of wisdom is explained.

translated: This shows that the merit of those who strive in the teaching of this perfection of wisdom is greater.🔽The result of the giving of material things is the attainment of great wealth, but

analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin pas ci la yang mi dmigs te /

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin /
translated: It is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: bsod nams mang du 'phel ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'gyur ba yin pas kun brtags pa yin pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin las /
analyzed: bsod nams mang du 'phel ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'gyur ba yin pas kun brtags pa yin pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin las /
translated: Since it is a cause and condition for the increase of merit, it is an imputation. Therefore, Subhūti, having understood that from the nature of the purity of the three spheres,

analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i bsod nams ji ltar 'phel bar 'gyur zhes rab 'byor gyis gal gzung ste zhus pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis pa ni yang dag par lta ba bskyed pa'am /
translated: The Blessed One, non-performance cannot generate right view,

analyzed: skyon ma mchis par yang dag par 'jug par mi nus so zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis kyang /
translated: cannot enter into the faultless, up to cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: gong du smos pa'i gal bzung ba de ni zhib tu bshad de gsol pa'o //
translated: With this, he explained in detail the implication that was mentioned above.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is so,

analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rab 'byor gyis gal bzung ba de rigs par gal bzung ste zhus pa bstan
translated: it is just as you have said, up to cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. With this, he taught that Subhūti's implication was a correct implication.

analyzed: pa'o // rab 'byor de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod @180a * //
translated: Subhūti, in that regard, the generosity of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom is also unconditioned, appearing as emptiness, up to “they are well trained in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.”

original: pa'i sbyin pa de yang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ste stong pa nyid du snang ngo zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rab 'byor gyis gal bzung ste zhus🔽pa'i lan btab pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i sbyin pa de yang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ste stong pa nyid du snang ngo zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rab 'byor gyis gal bzung ste zhus pa'i lan btab pa ste /
translated: This is the reply to the question Subhūti asked by way of a hypothetical.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bas stong pa nyid bco brgyad kyi don shin tu bslabs par 'gyur ba'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa spyad do cog kyang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas ci yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bas stong pa nyid bco brgyad kyi don shin tu bslabs par 'gyur ba'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa spyad do cog kyang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas ci yang mi dmigs te /
translated: Because they are not separated from the perfection of wisdom, they practice generosity and so forth, which are completely pure of the three spheres, without observing anything at all, because they are well trained in the meaning of the eighteen emptinesses.

original: stong pa nyid dang gsog dang / gsob dang / snying po med par mthong bar 'gyur bas don dam par bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang gsog dang / gsob dang / snying po med par mthong bar 'gyur bas don dam par bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ba'am /

analyzed: yang dag par lta ba skyed pa la sogs pa gang gis bya ba yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: There is also no activity whatsoever, such as generating the correct view.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stong pa nyid de dag la gnas shing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stong pa nyid de dag la gnas shing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, that bodhisattva mahāsattva, abiding in those emptinesses...🔽...in that way, merit increases immeasurably, incalculably, and boundlessly.

original: de lta de ltar grangs med dpag tu med tshad med pa'i bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar don dam par 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas ci yang mngon par 'du bya ba med du zin kyang /
analyzed: de lta de ltar grangs med dpag tu med tshad med pa'i bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar don dam par 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas ci yang mngon par 'du bya ba med du zin kyang /
translated: Thus, although ultimately there is nothing to be produced at all due to the complete purity of the three spheres,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bas chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med par yang lhun gyis grub pa nyid du bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa mi 'phel pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bas chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med par yang lhun gyis grub pa nyid du bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa mi 'phel pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that by not being separated from the perfection of wisdom, the accumulation of merit without measure, number, or bound, which is not non-existent, increases spontaneously without conceptualization or analysis through the blessing of the basic element of phenomena and the power of former aspirations.

original: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das grangs ma mchis pa dang dpag tu ma mchis pa dang / tshad ma mchis pa la byed brag ni ci mchis /
analyzed: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das grangs ma mchis pa dang dpag tu ma mchis pa dang / tshad ma mchis pa la byed brag ni ci mchis /
translated: Subhūti asks, “Blessed One, what is the difference between immeasurable, uncountable, and boundless?”

original: khyad par ni ci mchis zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med par grangs dang dpag pa dang / tshad kyis thog tu phebs par byar mi rung ba'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni ci mchis zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med par grangs dang dpag pa dang / tshad kyis thog tu phebs par byar mi rung ba'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is because he is raising the issue that ultimately, all phenomena are not suitable to be brought to a conclusion with number, measure, or bound, and so he asks.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni gang 'dus byas kyi khams sam 'dus ma byas kyi khams su bgrang bar yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni gang 'dus byas kyi khams sam 'dus ma byas kyi khams su bgrang bar yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: This means that ultimately all phenomena are empty of inherent nature.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi grangs su rtsi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi grangs su rtsi'o //
translated: “These are counted as compounded,🔽these are counted as uncompounded.”

original: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi grangs su rtsi'o zhes bya bar tshig gis bgrang zhing nges par thog tu mi phebs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi grangs su rtsi'o zhes bya bar tshig gis bgrang zhing nges par thog tu mi phebs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to count and determine them with words.

original: rab 'byor dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni 'das @180b pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la tshad mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas dus gsum gyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba'o zhes ye shes kyis dpag tu med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni 'das @180b pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la tshad mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas dus gsum gyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba'o zhes ye shes kyis dpag tu med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, ‘immeasurable’ means that a measure is not apprehended for past, future, and present phenomena.” This teaches that ultimately all phenomena are empty of inherent nature, and that the nature of phenomena of the three times is immeasurable with wisdom, in the sense that “the nature of phenomena is like this.”

original: rab 'byor tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la gzhal bar mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas srang grangs la sogs pas gzhal bas thog tu dbab tu med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab 'byor tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la gzhal bar mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas srang grangs la sogs pas gzhal bas thog tu dbab tu med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that because all phenomena are empty by nature, they cannot be measured by weighing scales, counting, and so forth.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs gang gis gzugs kyang grangs ma mchis /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs gang gis gzugs kyang grangs ma mchis /
translated: He asks, “Blessed One, is there a way of enumerating such that form is also uncountable,

analyzed: dpag tu ma mchis /

analyzed: tshad ma mchis par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rnam grangs mchis sam zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa yang grangs ma mchis dpag tu ma mchis tshad ma mchis par 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs de lta bu mchis sam zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bsod nams 'phel
translated: and immeasurable?” and so on up to “is there a way of enumerating such that consciousness is also uncountable, unfathomable, and immeasurable?”

analyzed: ba la grangs dang / dpag pa dang / tshad med pa bzhin du phung po lnga yang don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: In the same way that the increase in merit is uncountable, unfathomable, and immeasurable, the five aggregates also do not ultimately exist as things.

analyzed: grangs dang / dpag pa dang / tshad med par bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: Subhūti's request to open the chapter on the explanation of number, measure, and boundlessness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa yang grangs med dpag tu med /

translated: Thus, intending that all phenomena are empty by nature, he declared that there is such a method of the five aggregates being innumerable, boundless, and immeasurable.

analyzed: gzugs kyang grangs ma mchis dpag tu ma mchis tshad ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa yang grangs ma mchis /

analyzed: dpag tu ma mchis tshad ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pas grangs dang dpag pa dang tshad med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus
translated: The passage up to “they would be immeasurable, incalculable, and limitless” is Subhūti’s question in order to explain in detail the meaning of number, measure, and limitlessness of the five aggregates such as form, because they are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: grangs med dpag tu med tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa yang stong pa ste /
translated: incalculable, immeasurable, and limitless, up to consciousness is also empty,🔽incalculable, immeasurable, and limitless.”

original: grangs med dpag tu med tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni @181a * //
analyzed: grangs med dpag tu med tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni @181a * //
translated: The passage up to “incalculable, immeasurable, and limitless”

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la grangs dang dpag pa dang tshad med pa yang phung po lnga char rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir grangs dang dpag pa dang tshad med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: teaches that the five aggregates such as form are also without number, measure, and limit, because the five aggregates are empty of intrinsic nature.

analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das gzugs 'ba' zhig stong zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig stong du bas kyi /
translated: Subhūti asks, “Blessed One, is only form empty, up to is only consciousness empty?🔽Or are all phenomena empty?”

analyzed: ci chos thams cad stong pa ma lags sam zhes bya bas ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti’s question, which raises the topic of the explanation of the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, what do you think? Have I not explained that all phenomena are empty?”

translated: This means that just as the five aggregates are empty, I have explained that all phenomena are empty.

analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes gsungs te zhes bya ba nas bcom ldan 'das de bas na chos de dag las don dam par yi ge tha dang du bgyi ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos
translated: The Lord has said, The Tathagata has declared all dharmas to be empty, up to Therefore, Blessed One, one does not apprehend any dharma as ultimate, either as a letter or as something to be expressed.🔽By this,

analyzed: thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //

translated: By this, in order to make the entire assembly believe in the meaning that Subhuti has requested, it is said that it is so.

original: rab 'byor mi zad pa zhes bya ba'am zhes bya ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod du med pa las de bzhin gshegs pas brjod de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mi zad pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa stong pa
analyzed: rab 'byor mi zad pa zhes bya ba'am zhes bya ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod du med pa las de bzhin gshegs pas brjod de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mi zad pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa stong pa
translated: “Subhūti, this ‘inexhaustibility,’ ‘immeasurability,’ up to ‘nirvāṇa’ is described by the Tathāgata in terms of the inexpressible” indicates the synonyms of emptiness, such as inexhaustibility and immeasurability,

original: nyid kyi rnam grangs rnams don dam par brjod du med pa yin yang /
analyzed: nyid kyi rnam grangs rnams don dam par brjod du med pa yin yang /

translated: However, through the great compassion of the Tathāgata, in order to guide and lead sentient beings, he describes inexhaustibility, immeasurability, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and nonapplication,

analyzed: ming dang tshig gis bstan du med do zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams kyis 'grib par 'gyur ba yang med do zhes mdor bstan pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa ma mchis par 'gyur
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of generosity would not increase or decrease, and, Blessed One, the unshared qualities of a buddha would not increase or decrease.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar gyur na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas bcom ldan 'das de ltar gyur na sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ma mchis par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar
translated: The Blessed One, if that were the case, the perfection of generosity would not exist, and so on up to the Blessed One, if that were the case, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha would not exist.🔽With this, Subhūti says that if all phenomena were

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyang med par 'gyur ro zhes rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'o //

analyzed: chos de dag ma mchis na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang ma mchis par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis de ltar gal bzung ste gsol pa yang 'khor rnams de lta bu'i the tshom skye ba bsal @182b ba dang / don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing brjod du med kyang kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas spyad cing yongs su bsngos na 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ba'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhuti, having taken this as a basis, asked this question in order to dispel the doubts of the assembly, and in order to open up the opportunity for a detailed explanation of the meaning that ultimately all phenomena are empty of intrinsic nature and inexpressible, but that if one practices and dedicates with skillful means on the conventional level, the result will not be nonexistent.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord said:🔽Subhuti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /

original: brjod du med pa'i don la ni 'phel ba'am /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i don la ni 'phel ba'am /
translated: In the meaning that is inexpressible, there is no increase or decrease.

original: rab 'byor gal te thabs mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba nas de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ji lta ba bzhin du yongs
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te thabs mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba nas de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ji lta ba bzhin du yongs
translated: “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom with skillful means, from here up to “and that is also dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening just as it is,”

analyzed: brjod du med kyang kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Although inexpressible, conventionally, with skillful means, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,🔽the six perfections are also ultimately unreal, so one should understand that they are just names.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang don dam par dngos po med pas 'di dag ni ming tsam du zad do zhes bya bar khong du chud pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rlom sems kyang mi skye la /

translated: Thus, the conceit of increasing through the six perfections does not arise.

original: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan
translated: If, on the conventional level, one dedicates those roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment with skillful means, one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: pa'o // de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta ba de bzhin du yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsngo ba yongs su dag par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pa'o // de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta ba de bzhin du yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsngo ba yongs su dag par bstan pa ste /
translated: That is also the dedication that is just like unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. This teaches the purity of dedication.

analyzed: dngos por dmigs shing mngon par chags pa med par yongs su bsngo'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one dedicates without observing and becoming attached to things.

translated: The question Bhagavan, what is unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment? refers to the suchness of all phenomena and unsurpassed enlightenment, which are not ultimately different in nature.

original: gcig par bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gcig par bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: The question Blessed One, what is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening? is asked in order to open the section on the teaching of oneness, since the suchness of all phenomena and unsurpassed awakening are not ultimately different in nature.

translated: The Blessed One replied:🔽Subhūti, the suchness of all phenomena is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: gang yin pa rtogs pa de nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin gyi /
translated: This teaches that the realization of the emptiness of the nature of all phenomena is itself unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: de la gud na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: The request, Bhagavan, what is the suchness of all phenomena that is unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment? refers to the suchness of all phenomena that was mentioned above.

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes mdor bshad pa chos thams cad ces bya ba gang dang gang yin pa 'khor rnams la zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: Subhūti asks, Bhagavan, what are all those phenomena whose suchness is unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment? original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
translated: The Bhagavan replied,

original: byang chub bo //
analyzed: byang chub bo //
translated: Subhuti, the suchness of form is unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment, and the suchness of omniscience is unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad ces bya ba gang dang gang yin pa gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad ces bya ba gang dang gang yin pa gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa
translated: The suchness of nirvana is the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams re re nas smos te /
analyzed: nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams re re nas smos te /
translated: This passage explains that all phenomena, from form up to nirvana, are individually mentioned.

original: chos de dag thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin gyi /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin gyi /
translated: The suchness of the emptiness of the nature of all those phenomena is the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de las gud na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba'i dngos po gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de las gud na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba'i dngos po gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Apart from that, there is no thing called unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ni 'phel ba yang med do yongs su 'grib pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / tha mi dad pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag cing mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa yin pas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyis rgyas par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ni 'phel ba yang med do yongs su 'grib pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / tha mi dad pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag cing mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa yin pas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyis rgyas par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: This means that the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, which is not different from the suchness of all phenomena, is naturally completely pure and fully accomplished as unchanging.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis nyams par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis nyams par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: Therefore, it neither expands through the factor of purification nor diminishes through the factor of affliction.

original: / rab 'byor de la ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba rgyun mi 'chad par rtag tu rnam par spyod de /
analyzed: / rab 'byor de la ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba rgyun mi 'chad par rtag tu rnam par spyod de /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is not separated from the perfection of wisdom always and continuously practices in this way.

original: chos gang la yang 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa @183b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dang mthun par spyod pa ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin
analyzed: chos gang la yang 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa @183b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dang mthun par spyod pa ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin
translated: He does not see any dharma as increasing or decreasing.

original: nyid dang tha mi dad pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par spyod cing gnas pas /
analyzed: nyid dang tha mi dad pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par spyod cing gnas pas /
translated: This is the bodhisattva skilled in means practicing the perfection of wisdom in accordance with its meaning, who always and continuously practices and abides in the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, which is not different from the suchness of all dharmas.

original: chos gang la yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod par mi lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos gang la yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod par mi lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not see any dharma as increasing or decreasing.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na brjod du med pa'i don ni 'phel ba med cing yongs su 'grib pa med pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na brjod du med pa'i don ni 'phel ba med cing yongs su 'grib pa med pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, thus the meaning that cannot be expressed is without increase and without decrease, from here

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la 'phel ba yang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la 'phel ba yang med do //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are without increase

original: yongs su 'grib pa yang med do //
analyzed: yongs su 'grib pa yang med do //
translated: and without decrease.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'phel ba med pa dang / yongs su 'grib pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brjod du med pa'i don la 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'phel ba med pa dang / yongs su 'grib pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brjod du med pa'i don la 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan nas /
translated: Subhuti, in this way, the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva should practice the perfection of wisdom by way of non-increase and non-decrease.

original: de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are empty by nature,

original: brjod du med pas 'phel ba med pa dang / yongs su 'grib pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes rab 'byor la rjes su gdams te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pas 'phel ba med pa dang / yongs su 'grib pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes rab 'byor la rjes su gdams te bstan pa'o //
translated: and because they are inexpressible, if one practices the perfection of wisdom by way of non-increase and non-decrease, one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.🔽He thus instructed Subhuti and taught him.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
translated: He said, Bhagavān, is it so?

original: sems dang po bskyed pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral
translated: The question Is it by arousing the first thought that the bodhisattva mahāsattva fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening? and so on, is asked in the context of teaching that if one is not separated from the perfection of wisdom

original: zhing thabs mkhas pas yongs su bsngos na /
analyzed: zhing thabs mkhas pas yongs su bsngos na /
translated: and skillfully dedicates,🔽one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i skabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu thabs ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba zhus
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i skabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu thabs ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba zhus
translated: It is asked how one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by what means.

original: pa ste / sems bskyed pa gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zhus kyang 'khor rnams la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don zab mo bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ste / sems bskyed pa gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zhus kyang 'khor rnams la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don zab mo bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Although it is asked by which thought one will fully awaken, it is in order to open the opportunity to explain the profound meaning of dependent origination to the retinue.

original: de la sems dang po bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo'i tshe dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la bya'o //🔽sems phyi ma bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying por rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sgrib pa thams cad yongs su spangs nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i sems @184a * //
analyzed: de la sems dang po bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo'i tshe dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la bya'o // sems phyi ma bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying por rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sgrib pa thams cad yongs su spangs nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i sems @184a * //
translated: The first generation of mind is the first generation of the mind of enlightenment in the state of an ordinary being.

original: nyid ni skyon dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyid ni skyon dang bral ba'o //
translated: The subsequent generation of mind is the mind of manifest perfect buddhahood, which is free from faults, having abandoned all obscurations by means of the vajra like concentration at the heart of enlightenment.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la sogs pas thogs par byas pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la sogs pas thogs par byas pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams so //
translated: The form, etc., of ordinary beings is obstructed form, etc., because it is obstructed by walls, etc.

original: med pa la kun du brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig 'di kun rdzob tu dmigs pa'i dbang du gyur pa so sor nges pa'i dmigs pa la gzhan dbang du gyur pa de rnams ni de kho na nyid kyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: med pa la kun du brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig 'di kun rdzob tu dmigs pa'i dbang du gyur pa so sor nges pa'i dmigs pa la gzhan dbang du gyur pa de rnams ni de kho na nyid kyis stong pa ste /
translated: The imagined is that which is imagined in the non-existent, etc. That which is imagined in the relative, which is the specific object of perception, is empty of reality.

original: gang gi phyir med pa la kun du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa la kun du brtags pa'o //
translated: because it is imagined in what is non-existent.🔽Non-existent is twofold: that which is non-existent as cause and that which is non-existent as result.

original: med pa ni gnyis te 'di rnams kyis kun du brtags pa ni zhes de ltar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ni gnyis te 'di rnams kyis kun du brtags pa ni zhes de ltar brjod pa'o //
translated: The non-existent as cause is the non-existence of the duality in the imagination of the unreal.

original: thogs pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i rtsig pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sgrib pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i rtsig pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sgrib pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The non-existent as result is the non-existence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject in the imagination of the unreal.

original: gnyis su med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The non-existent is imagined in both of these.

original: gang gi phyir ma byung bar kun du 'byung ba ste yang dag pa'i bdag nyid kyis yang dag par byung ba ma yin no //🔽bla na yod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi drod dang rtse mo la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi cha rnams so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma byung bar kun du 'byung ba ste yang dag pa'i bdag nyid kyis yang dag par byung ba ma yin no //🔽bla na yod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi drod dang rtse mo la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi cha rnams so //

original: sems bla na yod pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla na yod pa yang don dam pa bla na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems bla na yod pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla na yod pa yang don dam pa bla na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind that is superior is called “the reality just as it is.”

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rlom sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rlom sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The superior is not the ultimate, because it is free from the conceit of the nature of emptiness.🔽The mind that is unsurpassable is free from the elaboration of reality, because all times of the essence-less cyclic existences are free from distinctions.

original: bla na med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba snying po med pa'i dus thams cad khyad par dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na nyid du sbros pa med pa yin te gang gi phyir sems phra mo tsam yang dmigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir sems🔽phra mo tsam yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste der ni med ces bya ba'i ngag gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba snying po med pa'i dus thams cad khyad par dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na nyid du sbros pa med pa yin te gang gi phyir sems phra mo tsam yang dmigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir sems phra mo tsam yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste der ni med ces bya ba'i ngag gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Because even the mere subtle mind is not an object of observation, therefore,🔽the mind is not even an object of observation of the mere subtle mind.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: The mind that is not in equipoise is the afflicted mind,

original: bshad par gyur pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad par gyur pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the explained.

original: mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings la des mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings la des mnyam pa ste /
translated: The phrase “uneven” means that the uneven is even in the realm of phenomena.

original: don dam par de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they enter into reality in an ultimate sense.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni gang zhig kun rdzob tu mnyam par ma bzhag par ro //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni gang zhig kun rdzob tu mnyam par ma bzhag par ro //
translated: The phrase “not in meditative equipoise” means that they are not in meditative equipoise in a conventional sense.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ram de nyid kyi phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ram de nyid kyi phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
translated: They are not in meditative equipoise because they are diverse.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa rnams zhes @184b bya ba ni dge ba rnams te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa rnams zhes @184b bya ba ni dge ba rnams te /
translated: The phrase “those in meditative equipoise” means those who are virtuous.

original: dge ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are endowed with virtuous meditative absorption.

original: mnyam pa dang mnyam pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la rab tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mnyam pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la rab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase “even in their evenness” means that they are established in the evenness of all phenomena.

original: de'i dmigs pa dang mthar thug pa nyid kyis mnyam par 'jug cing zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa dang mthar thug pa nyid kyis mnyam par 'jug cing zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are in meditative equipoise because they are focused on that and have reached its culmination.

original: de bzhin du de dag ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: They are like space in that they are similar to space.

original: rnam par grol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcings pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcings pa'o //
translated: “Liberated ones” are ordinary beings who are bound by afflictions.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
