analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Naturally liberated” means free from stains by nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid du dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid du dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: For that very reason, they have the nature of non-existence in reality.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang don de nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang don de nyid do //
translated: The meaning is the same as the reading “natureless nature.”

original: rnam par grol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams la rnam par grol ba dang ldan pa'i phyir don dam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid de de'i phyir rnam par grol ba nyid do ;
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams la rnam par grol ba dang ldan pa'i phyir don dam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid de de'i phyir rnam par grol ba nyid do ;
translated: “Liberated ones” means that because the noble ones possess liberation, they are non-existent due to not being observed by the ultimate suchness wisdom of the Tathāgata. For that reason, they are liberated.

original: / de ltar na kun rdzob tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo don dam par de bzhin gshegs pas de rnams thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mkhyen pa zhes so sor nye bar bstan nas thams
analyzed: / de ltar na kun rdzob tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo don dam par de bzhin gshegs pas de rnams thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mkhyen pa zhes so sor nye bar bstan nas thams
translated: Thus, in terms of the relative, the Tathāgata knows the essence of all phenomena, such as those that are corruptible and those that are not, as being ultimately empty by nature.🔽

original: cad khyad par med par de kho na nyid gcig pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mkhyen pa zhes bstan par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: cad khyad par med par de kho na nyid gcig pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mkhyen pa zhes bstan par mdzad pa ni /
translated: Thus, having taught individually that the Tathāgata knows the nature of all those things that are conventionally with-outflows, without-outflows, etc., ultimately, by way of their nature of emptiness, he teaches that they are all without distinction, the nature of the one reality, the nature of emptiness.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the mind is not seen, etc.

original: sems bltar med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems nyid kyi phyir sems zhes bya ba ni kun brtags brjod pa yin te de yang de'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems bltar med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems nyid kyi phyir sems zhes bya ba ni kun brtags brjod pa yin te de yang de'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind is called “mind” because of its nature of mind. The imagined is expressed. That is not existent by way of its own nature.

original: de bas na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because of non-existence means because of non-existence as existent.

original: ma byung ba'i phyir ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba'i phyir ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not arise, because they are not produced by causes and conditions.

original: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ni sgyu ma'i glang po ltar mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ni sgyu ma'i glang po ltar mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not fully accomplished, because they are not real, like an illusory elephant.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid mthong ba rnams kyi mig la snang bar gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid mthong ba rnams kyi mig la snang bar gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, they do not appear to the eyes of those who see reality.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni bshad zin pa gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni bshad zin pa gsum gyi'o //
translated: All refers to the three already mentioned.

original: chos dang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin dag la shes rab kyi spyan nyid la khongs su bsdu ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos dang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin dag la shes rab kyi spyan nyid la khongs su bsdu ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the Dharma and Buddha-giving are included in the eye of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par ston pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang 'jig rten @185a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par ston pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang 'jig rten @185a * //
translated: Similarly, because all the mental activities of all sentient beings are truly revealed by the nature of emptiness, the Tathāgatas and the world🔽The heat, peak, and forbearance called the signs of the world

original: ba'i snga ltas drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin lhag mthong dang bcas pa 'thob pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i snga ltas drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin lhag mthong dang bcas pa 'thob pa la bya'o //
translated: are to be understood as the attainment of the samādhi called the seeing of reality together with insight.

original: rigs kyi sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la stobs lnga bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rigs kyi sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la stobs lnga bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: The level of potential is the level of engagement through belief, when one cultivates the five powers.

original: 'jig rten chos kyi mchog thob pas 'phags pa'i rigs su 'gyur ba'i phyir rigs kyi sa zhes bya'o //🔽brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nas yas bgrangs na /
analyzed: 'jig rten chos kyi mchog thob pas 'phags pa'i rigs su 'gyur ba'i phyir rigs kyi sa zhes bya'o // brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nas yas bgrangs na /
translated: The stage of lineage is so called because when one cultivates the five powers on the stage of action in faith, one enters the lineage of the noble ones by attaining the supreme mundane state.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa grangs brgyad pa la 'bab pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya'o //🔽mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa grangs brgyad pa la 'bab pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya'o // mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mthong ste /
translated: The stage of the eighth is so called because when one counts from the state of the arhat, the state of entry to the result of stream-entry is the eighth.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mthong ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mthong ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of seeing is so called because one sees supramundane dharmas by attaining the result of stream-entry, and because one abides on the path of seeing.

original: bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pas /
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pas /
translated: The stage of thinning is so called because one abides on the stage of the once-returner.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems srab mor byas pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya'o //🔽'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems srab mor byas pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya'o // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pas /
translated: The stage of the Once-Returner is called the stage of thinning out, because it thins out the desire for sense-pleasures and malice.🔽The stage of the Non-Returner is called the stage of separation from desire, because, dwelling in that stage,

original: 'dod chags dang gnod sems rab tu spangs pas phyir mo 'ong ba'i sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gnod sems rab tu spangs pas phyir mo 'ong ba'i sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: one is separated from desire and malice.

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom par gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: The stage of the Arhat is called the stage of completion, because, when one becomes an Arhat,

original: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te /🔽bya ba byas khur bor bas /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te / bya ba byas khur bor bas /
translated: one abandons all the defilements of the three realms,🔽and, having done what had to be done, having laid down the burden,

original: de phan chad phung po gzhan mi len par shes pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i sa la byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phan chad phung po gzhan mi len par shes pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i sa la byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: one knows that one will not take up another set of aggregates.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i gang zag shes rab rnon po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don gzhan gyis ma bstan par bdag rang gis rtogs pa la rang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i gang zag shes rab rnon po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don gzhan gyis ma bstan par bdag rang gis rtogs pa la rang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The “stage of the pratyekabuddha” refers to the stage of the pratyekabuddha, which is the realization by a person of the Hinayana of the meaning of dependent origination, without being taught by another, through sharp wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la bya'o //
translated: The “stage of the bodhisattva” refers to the ten stages of the bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od ces bya ba me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od ces bya ba me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa la bya'o //
translated: The “stage of the buddha” refers to the stage of the buddha called Universal Light, which is endowed with such qualities as the mirror-like wisdom, the wisdom of equality, the wisdom of individual realization, and the wisdom of successful activity.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu la slob pa ni sems dang po bskyed pas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ma yin zhes bya @185b ba nas bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu la slob pa ni sems dang po bskyed pas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ma yin zhes bya @185b ba nas bcom ldan 'das
translated: In that regard, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains on the ten grounds is not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by the first generation of the mind, and so on, up to the Bhagavān

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i don bcom
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i don bcom
translated: says, “Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s full awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is profound.”

original: ldan 'das kyis mjug bsdus nas bstan pa dang / rab 'byor gyis kyang tshig dang don de dag bzlas te gsol nas /
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis mjug bsdus nas bstan pa dang / rab 'byor gyis kyang tshig dang don de dag bzlas te gsol nas /
translated: With that, the Bhagavān summarized the meaning of what was explained above, and Subhūti repeated the words and their meaning and requested,🔽“Bhagavān, the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s full awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is profound.”

original: de lta bu'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de thabs ma mkhas pa dmigs pa can rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir zab bo zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de thabs ma mkhas pa dmigs pa can rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir zab bo zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: Such dependent origination is profound because those who are unskilled in means and are referential cannot understand it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems //🔽sems gang 'gags pa de phyir skye bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems // sems gang 'gags pa de phyir skye bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?🔽In the passage beginning with “The mind that has ceased, does it arise again?” and so on, he spoke in order to teach the meaning that ultimately all phenomena are naturally nirvāṇa.

original: sems gang 'gags pa de phyir skye bar 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems dngos po med cing rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa de dngos po yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes byas ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems gang 'gags pa de phyir skye bar 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems dngos po med cing rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa de dngos po yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes byas ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “The mind that has ceased, does it arise again?” is that ultimately the mind is not a thing and is naturally nirvāṇa, and that it does not become a thing that exists.

original: sems gang bskyed pa 'gags pa'i chos can yin nam zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu sems bskyed pa de yang don dam par dngos po med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems gang bskyed pa 'gags pa'i chos can yin nam zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu sems bskyed pa de yang don dam par dngos po med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The question “Is the mind that is generated a phenomenon that ceases?” means that the mind that is generated conventionally is ultimately not a thing.

original: gang 'gags pa'i chos can de 'gag par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa de la ni /
analyzed: gang 'gags pa'i chos can de 'gag par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa de la ni /
translated: The question “Does that which is a phenomenon that ceases cease?” means that ultimately it is not a thing, and that nirvana is natural.

original: phyis 'gag par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyis 'gag par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that later on, it does not cease.

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye 'gag med pa de ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin las mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub bo'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye 'gag med pa de ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin las mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub bo'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The question “Does it remain just as suchness is?” means that in that way, it is unborn and unceasing, and it is fully established as not changing from the nature of suchness.

original: rab 'byor gal te de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'gyur na rtag par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can rtag par lta ba rnams dang mi 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'gyur na rtag par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can rtag par lta ba rnams dang mi 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, if suchness were to abide just as it is, would it not be permanent? This is asked to show that it is not the same as the eternalist views of the tīrthikas.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba mu stegs can ni dngos po yod pa las rtag par lta'i /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba mu stegs can ni dngos po yod pa las rtag par lta'i /
translated: Subhūti replied, Blessed One, it would not be so. The tīrthikas view an existent thing as permanent.

original: 'dir ni dngos po med pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba la de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa zhes byas ba nas mu stegs can gyis rtag par lta ba 'dra bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos po med pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba la de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa zhes byas ba nas mu stegs can gyis rtag par lta ba 'dra bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: Here, it is said that suchness abiding just as it is is not different from non-existence, and it is said that it is not the same as the eternalist view of the tīrthikas.

original: de bzhin nyid zab bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid zab bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Suchness is profound.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur bar @186a * //🔽yongs su grub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur bar @186a * // yongs su grub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: In that way, it is not permanent.🔽 It is not fully established, and it is not permanent.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin pa de ni dmigs pa can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin pa de ni dmigs pa can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because it is not the domain of those with reference points, it is taught as profound.

original: sems de yang de bzhin nam zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid zab pa bzhin du sems de yang zab pa yin nam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: sems de yang de bzhin nam zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid zab pa bzhin du sems de yang zab pa yin nam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: The question is whether that mind is as profound as suchness is profound.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi sems skye zhing 'gag pa can de ni de ltar zab pa ma yin no zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi sems skye zhing 'gag pa can de ni de ltar zab pa ma yin no zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: He replies, “Blessed One, it is not.” The conventional mind that arises and ceases is not that profound.

original: de bzhin nyid las sems gud na yod dam zhes bya ba ni don dam pa las dgongs te dris pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las sems gud na yod dam zhes bya ba ni don dam pa las dgongs te dris pa'o //
translated: “Is the mind other than suchness?” The question is whether the ultimate is intended.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni don dam par de bzhin nyid las sems gud na yod pa yang ma yin no zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni don dam par de bzhin nyid las sems gud na yod pa yang ma yin no zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: He replies, “Blessed One, it is not.” Ultimately, the mind is not other than suchness.

original: sems la de bzhin nyid yod dam zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la sems yod dam zhes bya ba ni de ltar de bzhin nyid las sems gud na yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sems la de bzhin nyid yod dam zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la sems yod dam zhes bya ba ni de ltar de bzhin nyid las sems gud na yod pa ma yin na /
translated: “Is suchness in the mind?” and “Is the mind in suchness?” If the mind is not other than suchness,

original: de gnyis gzhi dang brten pa'i tshul du gnas sam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis gzhi dang brten pa'i tshul du gnas sam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: Are they present in the manner of a basis and something based on it?”

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid las sems gud na yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid las sems gud na yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: “Blessed One, they are not,” means that since those two are of one taste in the nature of emptiness, mind is not present apart from suchness.

original: dngos po can gnyis gcig la gcig gzhi dang brten pa'i tshul du gnas pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po can gnyis gcig la gcig gzhi dang brten pa'i tshul du gnas pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It shows that things that are dual are not present in the manner of a basis and something based on it.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngam zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems dang de bzhin nyid gnyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngam zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems dang de bzhin nyid gnyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: “Blessed One, I do not see suchness and suchness,” means that in that way mind and suchness are of one taste in emptiness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du tha mi dad pas dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyis su dbyer med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du tha mi dad pas dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyis su dbyer med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: It shows that since they are not different in the nature of suchness, the two—that which is observed and that which observes—are inseparable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: gang de ltar spyod pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa'i chos zab mo rtogs pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar spyod pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa'i chos zab mo rtogs pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that one who realizes the profound Dharma of non-arising and non-cessation is practicing the perfection of wisdom.🔽One who practices like that, what is he practicing?

original: gang de ltar spyod pa de gang la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dngos por 'dzin pa las bzlog pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar spyod pa de gang la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dngos por 'dzin pa las bzlog pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
translated: This asks about the one who practices the perfection of wisdom, in order to turn them away from grasping at entities.🔽One who practices like that does not practice anything.

original: gang de ltar spyod pa de ni ci la mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye 'gag med par rtogs pa de ni dngos por mngon par chags pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar spyod pa de ni ci la mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye 'gag med par rtogs pa de ni dngos por mngon par chags pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that one who realizes non-arising and non-cessation like that has no attachment to entities.

original: de ci'i slad @186b du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad @186b du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Blessed One, it is because bodhisattva mahasattva

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas pa la yongs su rgyu ba de dag mi 'jug mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ci la yang mi spyod pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas pa la yongs su rgyu ba de dag mi 'jug mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ci la yang mi spyod pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: “Those movements do not occur or arise in one who abides in suchness” indicates the reason why one does not engage in anything.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing de bzhin nyid la gnas pa la ni dngos por dmigs shing rnam par rtog pa'i sems rgyu ba mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing de bzhin nyid la gnas pa la ni dngos por dmigs shing rnam par rtog pa'i sems rgyu ba mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that for one who practices the perfection of wisdom and abides in suchness, the movement of a mind that observes and conceptualizes things does not occur.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid gang du yang yongs su rgyu ba ma mchis te de nyid la yang gang yang rgyu ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyu ba mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid gang du yang yongs su rgyu ba ma mchis te de nyid la yang gang yang rgyu ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyu ba mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: “Blessed One, suchness does not move anywhere, and nothing moves within it” indicates the reason why the movement of mind does not occur.

original: don dam par sems kyang de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyang de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: Ultimately, mind also has the nature of suchness.

original: chos gang la yang rtog cing rgyu ba med la de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis de la yang chos gang yang rgyu ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yang rtog cing rgyu ba med la de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis de la yang chos gang yang rgyu ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: There is no movement of any dharma whatsoever in that, because of the nature of suchness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de gang la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni ci la yang mi spyod dam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de gang la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni ci la yang mi spyod dam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom, what does he practice?”🔽He said, “He practices the ultimate, where there is no movement of duality.”

original: gsol pa de ni gang la gnyis kyi rgyu ba ma mchis pa'i don dam pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni ci la yang mi spyod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gsol pa de ni gang la gnyis kyi rgyu ba ma mchis pa'i don dam pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni ci la yang mi spyod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that he does not practice anything at all.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i don dam pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i don dam pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he practices the ultimate, which is the absence of the concepts of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gang don dam pa la spyod pa de yongs su rgyu ba la spyod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang don dam pa la spyod pa de yongs su rgyu ba la spyod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is one who practices the ultimate not practicing in terms of mental activity?

original: de mtshan ma la spyod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam pa la spyod na rtogs pa dang mtshan ma la spyod par mi 'gyur ram zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: de mtshan ma la spyod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam pa la spyod na rtogs pa dang mtshan ma la spyod par mi 'gyur ram zhes dris pa'o //
translated: Is one who practices the ultimate not practicing in terms of signs?”🔽Subhūti replied, “Blessed One, it is not so.”

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la spyod ces bya ba yang tha snyad du brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la spyod ces bya ba yang tha snyad du brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: “ Practicing the ultimate” is merely an expression in conventional terms.

original: yang dag par na spyod pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa med do zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na spyod pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa med do zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: In reality, there is no perception of practice and no apprehension of signs.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: des mtshan mar 'du shes pa rnam par bshig pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni de ltar yongs su rgyu bar spyod pa dang / mtshan mar spyod pa ma yin na mtshan mar 'du shes pa sun phung ste bshig pa yin nam zhes @187a * //🔽dris pa'o // gsol pa /
analyzed: des mtshan mar 'du shes pa rnam par bshig pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni de ltar yongs su rgyu bar spyod pa dang / mtshan mar spyod pa ma yin na mtshan mar 'du shes pa sun phung ste bshig pa yin nam zhes @187a * // dris pa'o // gsol pa /
translated: Does that destroy the perception of signs? means If one does not engage in such discursive activity and does not engage in signs, does that destroy, that is, eliminate, the perception of signs?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas mtshan ma'i 'du shes gzhig tu yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas mtshan ma'i 'du shes gzhig tu yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He said, Bhagavan, it does not. The meaning is that ultimately all phenomena are empty by nature, so there is not even any destruction of the perception of signs.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said,

original: rab 'byor 'o na ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnam par bshig pa yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar mtshan ma'i 'du shes gzhig tu med na gzhung las mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnam par spangs so zhes bya ba
analyzed: rab 'byor 'o na ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnam par bshig pa yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar mtshan ma'i 'du shes gzhig tu med na gzhung las mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnam par spangs so zhes bya ba
translated: Subhūti, then how does a bodhisattva mahāsattva destroy the perception of signs? means If the perception of signs is not to be destroyed in that way, then in the scriptures it says, 'The perception of signs is abandoned.'

original: ji ltar spangs pa yin no zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar spangs pa yin no zhes dris pa'o //
translated: How is it abandoned?

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni 'di ltar mtshan ma rnam par bshig par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni 'di ltar mtshan ma rnam par bshig par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom does not apply himself thus: 'I will destroy the sign, or I will destroy signlessness'.

original: mtshan ma med pa rnam par bshig par bya'o snyam du mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma med par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par spang ngo snyam du yang mi sems pa nyid mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnam par gzhig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa rnam par bshig par bya'o snyam du mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma med par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par spang ngo snyam du yang mi sems pa nyid mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnam par gzhig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The idea of a sign is destroyed by the very fact that he does not think 'I will destroy the sign' or 'I will destroy signlessness'.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa ni zhes bya ba nas chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du rig pa'i slad du ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa ni zhes bya ba nas chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du rig pa'i slad du ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni
translated: “Bhagavān, bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing this perfection of wisdom, from ‘they do not apprehend any dharma’ up to ‘they do not apprehend any dharma’—

original: de ltar don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa med du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa med du zin kyang /
translated: in that way, although they realize that ultimately all dharmas are empty of their own marks, they do not have any conceptualization or apprehension of marks.

original: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pas yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang yang rgya la /🔽chos gang yang dngos po'am /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pas yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang yang rgya la / chos gang yang dngos po'am /
translated: Nevertheless, they complete the ten tathāgata powers and so on with skillful means in the conventional and manifestly and completely awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽They do not see any dharma as an existent or

original: dngos por med par yang mi lta'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos por med par yang mi lta'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: as a nonexistent.”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de la gnas nas zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing ting nge 'dzin gsum la gnas te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de la gnas nas zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing ting nge 'dzin gsum la gnas te /
translated: Having stood in the emptiness of the own-mark up to Subhuti, thus does the Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the three concentrations and mature beings.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don dam par chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong par rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don dam par chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong par rtogs par byas nas /
translated: This shows the skill in means by which, having realized that ultimately all dharmas are empty of the own-mark,

original: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas @187b sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas @187b sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: he stands in the three concentrations which are the doors to liberation and, conventionally, matures beings by skill in means.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the forty-second chapter of the One Hundred Thousand Perfection of Wisdom, the chapter on the three concentrations.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong du chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la gnas te /
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong du chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la gnas te /
translated: In the above, having abided in the emptiness of all phenomena by way of their own characteristics,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa bstan pa'i skabs nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa bstan pa'i skabs nas /
translated: the occasion of teaching the skillful means of ripening sentient beings by way of the three meditative stabilizations of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness🔽was opened.

original: chos zab mo bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la the tshom dris pa ste /
analyzed: chos zab mo bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la the tshom dris pa ste /
translated: In order to open the occasion of teaching the profound doctrine, Śāriputra asked Subhūti about his doubts.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la la /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: rmi lam du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms par zhugs na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lam zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms par zhugs na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lam zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: This is a question to Subhūti in order to open up the section on the teaching that all phenomena are like a dream.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gal te nyin par bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gal te nyin par bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel na /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, if it increases through cultivation during the day,🔽it increases even without cultivation in a dream.

original: rmi lam ma bsgoms pas kyang rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: rmi lam ma bsgoms pas kyang rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: This is because ultimately all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe /
translated: When one is not asleep,

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur na rmi lam na bsgoms pa lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur na rmi lam na bsgoms pa lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Also, if the cultivation of the three meditative stabilizations does not cause the bodhisattva to increase in the collections of merit and wisdom, how much less so if he cultivates them in a dream.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms pa'i mthus sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yang kun rdzob tu rmi lam dang 'dra bar bstan pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms pa'i mthus sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yang kun rdzob tu rmi lam dang 'dra bar bstan pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The teaching that the cultivation of the three meditative stabilizations matures sentient beings and so forth is merely a conventional teaching that they are like a dream.

original: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ultimately they do not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rmi lam dang nyin par ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rmi lam dang nyin par ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, dreams and the daytime are nonconceptual. This teaches the reason that all phenomena are like a dream.

original: don dam par gnyid kyis ma log pa na spyad pa dang rmi lam na spyod pa gnyi ga yang dngos po med par 'dra bas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @188a * //
analyzed: don dam par gnyid kyis ma log pa na spyad pa dang rmi lam na spyod pa gnyi ga yang dngos po med par 'dra bas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @188a * //
translated: In ultimate truth, when one is not asleep, and when one is asleep, both the practice and the practice in a dream are the same in being unreal, and so are not objects of conceptualization.

original: po nyin par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yod na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rmi lam na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yang yod
analyzed: po nyin par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yod na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rmi lam na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yang yod
translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, if a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom during the day, then the bodhisattva great being’s cultivation of the perfection of wisdom would also exist in a dream.

original: par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i don gong du bshad pa de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i don gong du bshad pa de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage clarifies the meaning of the above explanation that all phenomena are like a dream.

original: rmi lam na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /🔽gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rmi lam na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du / gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe /
translated: Just as the accumulation of merit and wisdom increases through cultivating the perfection of wisdom in a dream,🔽so too🔽through cultivating the perfection of wisdom when not asleep,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas kyang don dam par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas kyang don dam par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the accumulation of merit and wisdom does not increase ultimately.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du las shig byas nas las de la sogs pa'am /🔽'bri bar 'gyur ba yod dam zhes bya ba ni de ltar gnyid kyis ma log pa dang / rmi lam gnyis su mtshungs na kun rdzob tu yang mtshungs pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du las shig byas nas las de la sogs pa'am / 'bri bar 'gyur ba yod dam zhes bya ba ni de ltar gnyid kyis ma log pa dang / rmi lam gnyis su mtshungs na kun rdzob tu yang mtshungs pa'i rigs na /
translated: The Venerable Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, if a bodhisattva great being performs an action in a dream, is that action accumulated or not?”🔽If it is the same in both waking and dreaming, then it should be the same in terms of the conventional.

original: rmi lam du las dge ba'am /
analyzed: rmi lam du las dge ba'am /
translated: But if it is not the same in terms of the conventional,🔽then it should not be the same in terms of the ultimate.

original: mi dge ba byas na dge ba byas pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs par 'gyur ba dang / mi dge ba byas pas bsod nams 'bri bar 'gyur ba yod dam zhes sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba byas na dge ba byas pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs par 'gyur ba dang / mi dge ba byas pas bsod nams 'bri bar 'gyur ba yod dam zhes sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: Śāriputra asks Subhūti, “Is it the case that when one does what is nonvirtuous, the accumulation of merit from doing what is virtuous is exhausted, and when one does what is nonvirtuous, the merit is diminished?”

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur gsungs na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur gsungs na /
translated: If the Blessed One has said that all phenomena are like a dream,🔽then there is no accumulation or diminution of anything.

original: de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor gyis don dam pa'i phyogs la brten nas /
analyzed: de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor gyis don dam pa'i phyogs la brten nas /
translated: This is what Subhūti says, relying on the perspective of ultimate truth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar dngos po med do zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar dngos po med do zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The Blessed One has also said that all phenomena are like a dream and do not exist.

original: rmi lam na las legs nyes byas pa la /
analyzed: rmi lam na las legs nyes byas pa la /
translated: Therefore, in a dream, when one does good or bad actions,🔽there is no accumulation or diminution of virtue.

original: dge ba sogs pa'am 'bri ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba sogs pa'am 'bri ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rmi lam gyi chos gang yang sogs pa'am 'bri ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du las legs nyes byas pa la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi chos gang yang sogs pa'am 'bri ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du las legs nyes byas pa la /
translated: Because in a dream, no phenomenon whatsoever that is accumulated or diminished can be observed.

original: dge ba la sogs pa dang dge ba 'bri ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa dang dge ba 'bri ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the reason why virtue, etc., are not diminished.

original: rmi lam gyi chos ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi chos ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: The phenomena of dreams are unreal.

original: dngos po med pa la sogs pa'am 'bri ba mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la sogs pa'am 'bri ba mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is impossible for something unreal, etc., to be diminished.🔽If one thinks about it when awake, is there an increase or decrease of that, etc.?

original: gal te sad nas rnam par rtog na de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni sh'a ti'i bus kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas rmi lam na las legs nyes byas pa de dag @188b gnyid las sad pa'i tshe dran nas de la
analyzed: gal te sad nas rnam par rtog na de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni sh'a ti'i bus kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas rmi lam na las legs nyes byas pa de dag @188b gnyid las sad pa'i tshe dran nas de la
translated: This means that Śāriputra, based on conventional truth, asked whether the good and bad karma created in a dream is remembered when one wakes up from sleep,

original: rjes su yi rang zhing rnam par rtog na de la dge ba la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ram zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang zhing rnam par rtog na de la dge ba la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ram zhes dris pa'o //
translated: and if one rejoices in that and thinks about it, is there an increase or decrease of virtue, etc.?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa nyin par srog bcad pa dang / rmi lam na srog bcad pa de la 'di snyam du bdag gis bsad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa nyin par srog bcad pa dang / rmi lam na srog bcad pa de la 'di snyam du bdag gis bsad do //
translated: Subhūti said, If one kills in the daytime and kills in a dream, thinking 'I have killed,'

original: de bdag gis bsad pa legs so zhes sad de rnam par rtog na /
analyzed: de bdag gis bsad pa legs so zhes sad de rnam par rtog na /
translated: and when one wakes up one thinks 'It is good that I killed him,'

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu las de la khyod ci zer zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe /🔽las byas pa gnyis 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la bye brag yod par bstan pa'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu la dris pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu las de la khyod ci zer zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe / las byas pa gnyis 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la bye brag yod par bstan pa'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu la dris pa'o //
translated: The phrase Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what do you say about this? is a question to Śāriputra about the two kinds of karma that are performed when one is not asleep and in a dream.🔽The phrase Venerable Subhūti, karma does not arise without an objective reference, and thought does not occur without an objective reference is a response to Śāriputra's question.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dmigs pa med par las mi skye'o dmigs pa med par sems pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe las byas pa dang / rmi lam na las byas pa la gnyid las sad nas rjes su yi rang ba rnam par rmin pa bye brag yod par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dmigs pa med par las mi skye'o dmigs pa med par sems pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe las byas pa dang / rmi lam na las byas pa la gnyid las sad nas rjes su yi rang ba rnam par rmin pa bye brag yod par bstan pa ste /
translated: It shows that the results of the karma performed when one is not asleep and the karma performed in a dream are different.

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe las byas pa ni dmigs pa'i yul dang bcas pa las legs nyes ci byas pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yang de bzhin du 'byung gi /
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe las byas pa ni dmigs pa'i yul dang bcas pa las legs nyes ci byas pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yang de bzhin du 'byung gi /
translated: The phrase karma performed when one is not asleep is accompanied by an objective reference means that the results of good and bad karma are produced in the same way.

original: rmi lam na las byas pa la gnyid sad pa'i tshe rjes su yi rang ba ni dmigs pa'i yul med pas rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam par smin pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: rmi lam na las byas pa la gnyid sad pa'i tshe rjes su yi rang ba ni dmigs pa'i yul med pas rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam par smin pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: When one has done an action in a dream, and then rejoices at it when one awakes, there is only the maturation of the rejoicing, since the objective referent is absent.

original: rmi lan ma las kyi dngos po gang byas pa'i rnam par smin pa ni med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lan ma las kyi dngos po gang byas pa'i rnam par smin pa ni med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: But there is no maturation of the action that was done in the dream.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti said, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is so!

original: de bas na tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dmigs pa dang bcas par las skyes te /
analyzed: de bas na tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dmigs pa dang bcas par las skyes te /
translated: Therefore, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, action arises with reference,

original: dmigs pa med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ni ma yin no //
translated: not without reference.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thought arises with reference,

original: dmigs pa med par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sh'a ri'i bus rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe byas pa'i las gnyis bye brag yod par bshad pa'i don de bden no zhes rab 'byor gyis rjes su yi rangs nas don de
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sh'a ri'i bus rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe byas pa'i las gnyis bye brag yod par bshad pa'i don de bden no zhes rab 'byor gyis rjes su yi rangs nas don de
translated: Up to “without an objective support” indicates that Subhūti agrees with the meaning of Śāriputra’s explanation that the two karmas performed when not asleep and when not in a dream have a difference.

original: nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
translated: He clarifies that meaning:

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe /
translated: When not asleep,

original: mthong ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i yul dang bcas pas rnam par smin pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i yul dang bcas pas rnam par smin pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
translated: seeing and so on have an objective domain, and so the karmic maturation is like that.

original: rmi lam na mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa de ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam na mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa de ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But seeing and so on in a dream is not like that.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor las thams cad dang / dmigs pa thams cad dben pa'o zhes @189a * //
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor las thams cad dang / dmigs pa thams cad dben pa'o zhes @189a * //
translated: He said, “Venerable Subhūti, the Bhagavān has said that all karmas and all objective supports are void.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na de ji ltar dmigs pa dang bcas par las skyes te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na de ji ltar dmigs pa dang bcas par las skyes te /
translated: How is it that karma arises with an objective support?

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin /
translated: Not without an objective support?

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
translated: The thought arises with reference,🔽not without reference.

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe las byas pa la bye brag yod par bshad pa yang byes pa so so'i skye bo mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe las byas pa la bye brag yod par bshad pa yang byes pa so so'i skye bo mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: The explanation of the difference between karma committed and not committed while dreaming and while not asleep is from the point of view of ordinary, individual disciples who grasp at signs.

original: kun rdzob tu bshad kyi don dam par bshad pa ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bshad kyi don dam par bshad pa ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: In order to show that this is an explanation in terms of the conventional, not in terms of the ultimate, Subhūti is asked.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu mtshan mar byas nas dmigs pa dang bcas par las skyes te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu mtshan mar byas nas dmigs pa dang bcas par las skyes te /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, karma arises with reference, with reference to signs,

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
translated: not without reference.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
translated: The thought arises with reference,🔽not without reference.”

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i las kyi bye brag bshad pa yang byis pa so so'i skye bo dmigs pa can rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i las kyi bye brag bshad pa yang byis pa so so'i skye bo dmigs pa can rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: The phrase not without a referent object indicates that the explanation of the differences in the karma of those who are not awake from sleep or from a dream is given from the perspective of ordinary, childish beings who have referent objects.

original: kun rdzob tu bshad kyi don dam par bye brag yod par bshad pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bshad kyi don dam par bye brag yod par bshad pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not an explanation of the existence of differences in the ultimate.🔽The passage that begins with the words Subhūti, if a bodhisattva great being gives a gift in a dream and ends with the words would that dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening be successful?

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du sbyin pa sbyin zhes bya ba nas des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i bar🔽gyis ni rmi lam na yang las gzhan byas pa ni dmigs pa'i yul med pas /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du sbyin pa sbyin zhes bya ba nas des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rmi lam na yang las gzhan byas pa ni dmigs pa'i yul med pas /
translated: is a question about whether or not a bodhisattva who gives a gift in a dream, etc.,

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na /
translated: would have a ripened result, since the referent object of the karma that is done in a dream does not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyud yongs su dag pa 'ga' zhig gis rmi lam du pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyud yongs su dag pa 'ga' zhig gis rmi lam du pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad de /
translated: Some bodhisattva great being, whose mind-stream is completely pure, practices the six perfections in a dream,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na de la 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ram zhes sh'a ri'i bus dris pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na de la 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ram zhes sh'a ri'i bus dris pa'o //
translated: and dedicates that root of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. Does it have a result?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽ask Maitreya, the bodhisattva great being who is predicted to be the next buddha. He will answer your question.🔽He will give you an answer.

original: 'di la dris shig dang 'di la lan ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'khor de na 'khod pa'i kha cig rab 'byor gyis bshad na yid mi ches kyi byang chub sems dpa' byams pas lan blan te bshad na yid ches shing phan thogs par
analyzed: 'di la dris shig dang 'di la lan ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'khor de na 'khod pa'i kha cig rab 'byor gyis bshad na yid mi ches kyi byang chub sems dpa' byams pas lan blan te bshad na yid ches shing phan thogs par
translated: This passage shows that some in the assembly did not believe what Subhūti explained, but if the bodhisattva Maitreya answered and explained, they would believe it and it would be helpful.

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir byams pa'i yon tan smos nas de 'di na mngon sum du 'dug gi /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir byams pa'i yon tan smos nas de 'di na mngon sum du 'dug gi /
translated: Therefore, after praising Maitreya's good qualities, it says, He is present here in person.

original: 'di la dris shig ces bdag gis lan @189b ma btab par gzhan la btab pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la dris shig ces bdag gis lan @189b ma btab par gzhan la btab pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that he did not answer himself, but referred the question to another.🔽Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya...

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas 'di la dris shig dang / 'di lan ldon par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rab 'byor gyis smras pa'i tshig sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bzlas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas 'di la dris shig dang / 'di lan ldon par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rab 'byor gyis smras pa'i tshig sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bzlas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that Śāriputra repeated Subhūti's words to the bodhisattva Maitreya.

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'di lan ldon nam zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan ldon pa'i mthu med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'di lan ldon nam zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan ldon pa'i mthu med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems
translated: Does the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Maitreya answer?

original: dpa' byams pas don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dpa' byams pas don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
translated: This shows that the bodhisattva Maitreya, based on ultimate truth,

original: rmi lam na pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad cing de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngos pa'i 'bras bu yod dam med dris pa'i lan btab pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam na pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad cing de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngos pa'i 'bras bu yod dam med dris pa'i lan btab pa ste /
translated: The answer to the question whether there is a result of the dedication of the roots of virtue of practicing the six perfections in a dream.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas gang zag dang chos gnyis ka dngos po med do //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas gang zag dang chos gnyis ka dngos po med do //
translated: Since all phenomena are ultimately empty of intrinsic nature, both persons and phenomena are unreal.

original: gang zag gi dngos po med pas byams pa zhes bya ba'i ming la yang lan ldon pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: gang zag gi dngos po med pas byams pa zhes bya ba'i ming la yang lan ldon pa'i mthu med do //
translated: Since the person is unreal, there is no power to respond to the name “Maitreya.”

original: chos la dngos po med pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang / de dag gi stong pa nyid dang / de dag gi de bzhin nyid la yang lan ldon pa'i mthu med na /
analyzed: chos la dngos po med pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang / de dag gi stong pa nyid dang / de dag gi de bzhin nyid la yang lan ldon pa'i mthu med na /
translated: Since phenomena are unreal, there is no power to respond to the five aggregates such as form, to their emptiness, or to their suchness.

original: rmi lam na yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa'i 'bras bu med pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa'i 'bras bu med pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What need is there to mention that there is no result of practicing the six perfections in a dream?

original: bdag gis ni gang lan glon pa dang / gang gis lan glan pa dang / gang la lan glan pa'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i don de nyid mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ni gang lan glon pa dang / gang gis lan glan pa dang / gang la lan glan pa'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i don de nyid mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase I do not see that dharma by which one would be repaid, by which one would repay, or to which one would repay is a summary of the meaning of the above passage.

original: gang lan glon pa zhes byas ba ni lan ldon pa'i mi la bya'o //
analyzed: gang lan glon pa zhes byas ba ni lan ldon pa'i mi la bya'o //
translated: The phrase by which one would be repaid refers to the person who repays.

original: gang gis lan glon pa zhes bya ba ni lan ldon pa'i tshig dang yi ge gang gis lan ldon pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis lan glon pa zhes bya ba ni lan ldon pa'i tshig dang yi ge gang gis lan ldon pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase by which one would repay refers to the words and letters by which one repays.

original: gang gis lan glan pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'am don gang gis lan glan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis lan glan pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'am don gang gis lan glan pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase to which one would repay refers to the thing or object to which one repays.

original: gang la lan glan pa zhes bya ba ni klan ka tshol zhing 'dri ba'i mi gang yin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gang la lan glan pa zhes bya ba ni klan ka tshol zhing 'dri ba'i mi gang yin pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase to which one would repay refers to the person who seeks and asks for repayment.

original: chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na 'di la su zhig ci zhig su la lan ldon par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na 'di la su zhig ci zhig su la lan ldon par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that since all those phenomena are ultimately empty of intrinsic reality, if I do not see them as real, then who will answer what to whom?

original: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang / gang gis lung bstan pa dang / gang la @190a * //
analyzed: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang / gang gis lung bstan pa dang / gang la @190a * //
translated: That which is the prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, that by which it is prophesied, and that to whom it is prophesied,🔽I do not see those phenomena as real.

original: lung bstan pa'i chos de yang bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la 'di bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lung bstan pa'i chos de yang bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la 'di bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: This is because previously Subhūti praised Maitreya the Bodhisattva, saying, This is the prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di la dris shig ces bstod pa de yang don dam par dngos po med par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la dris shig ces bstod pa de yang don dam par dngos po med par bstan pa ste /
translated: Ask him. That is also taught to be ultimately unreal.

original: gang lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni lung ston pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: gang lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni lung ston pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyid la bya'o //
translated: That which is prophesied refers to the Blessed One himself who gives the prophecy.

original: gang gis lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni lung bstan par 'os pa'i rgyu'am yon tan gang gis lung bstan par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni lung bstan par 'os pa'i rgyu'am yon tan gang gis lung bstan par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: “By whom there is a prophecy” refers to the cause or quality that is fit for a prophecy, by which there is a prophecy.

original: gang la lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' byams pa nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: gang la lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' byams pa nyid la bya ste /
translated: “To whom there is a prophecy” refers to the bodhisattva Maitreya himself.

original: de dag kyang don dam par dngos po med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang don dam par dngos po med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And those are also taught to be ultimately unreal.

original: chos de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa'o zhes bya ba ni lan glon pa dang / lung bstan pa la sogs pa'i chos gong du smos pa de dag thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa'o zhes bya ba ni lan glon pa dang / lung bstan pa la sogs pa'i chos gong du smos pa de dag thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: “All those phenomena are nondual and indivisible” refers to all the phenomena mentioned above, such as the questions and the prophecies, which are ultimately unreal.

original: stong pa nyid du ro gcig go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ro gcig go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They are taught to be of one taste in emptiness.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāradvatīputra said:

original: chos de dag ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du chos de dag khyod kyis mngon sum du byas sam zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa dmigs pa can rnams mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su me dpa mngon du byed par 'dod pa dag la
analyzed: chos de dag ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du chos de dag khyod kyis mngon sum du byas sam zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa dmigs pa can rnams mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su me dpa mngon du byed par 'dod pa dag la
translated: The line Have you directly experienced these phenomena as they have been explained? refers to the fact that the listeners and so on, who are focused on objects, wish to actualize the two kinds of nirvana.🔽

original: // mngon sum du byar med pa la bstan pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
analyzed: // mngon sum du byar med pa la bstan pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
translated: The question Have you realized those phenomena as they are explained? is asked in order to teach that those who possess the apprehension of the two kinds of nirvana, such as the sravakas, etc., who desire to realize it,🔽cannot realize it.

original: byams pas smras pa chos de dag ji skad bshad pa de ltar chos de dag bdag gis mngon sum du byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: byams pas smras pa chos de dag ji skad bshad pa de ltar chos de dag bdag gis mngon sum du byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: Maitreya said, I have not realized those phenomena as they are explained. This means that ultimately all phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gnyis su med pa de yang kun rdzob tu sgro btags te bshad pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gnyis su med pa de yang kun rdzob tu sgro btags te bshad pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The nondual reality of phenomena is also merely explained and imputed in a conventional sense.

original: don dam par ni mngon du byed pa dang / mngon du bya ba gnyis ka stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas mngon du byas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni mngon du byed pa dang / mngon du bya ba gnyis ka stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas mngon du byas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: I have not realized it teaches that ultimately both the realization and the object of realization are of one taste in emptiness and therefore not realized.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di snyam du gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di snyam du gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra thought thus, up to🔽This is the teaching of non-apprehending practice.🔽By this, up to

original: 'di ni mi dmigs par spyod pa bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' byams pas chos thams cad gnyis su med cing mngon sum du byar med pa'i don zab mo bstan pas sh'a ri'i bu mgu nas byams pa la bstod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi dmigs par spyod pa bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' byams pas chos thams cad gnyis su med cing mngon sum du byar med pa'i don zab mo bstan pas sh'a ri'i bu mgu nas byams pa la bstod pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of non-apprehending practice, Maitreya the Bodhisattva has taught the profound meaning of all dharmas being non-dual and not to be actualized. Śāriputra, being pleased, praised Maitreya.

original: 'di lta bu'i chos zab mo bshad pa ni yun ring po nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad cing /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i chos zab mo bshad pa ni yun ring po nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad cing /
translated: Explaining such a profound dharma is able to be taught by one who has practiced the six perfections for a long time,

original: dmigs pa med pa'i @190b don la goms par byas pa'i shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa bstan par nus kyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i @190b don la goms par byas pa'i shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa bstan par nus kyi /
translated: and has profound wisdom that has become accustomed to the meaning of non-apprehension.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang dmigs pa can gyi shes rab dang ldan pas bstan pa'i spyod yul ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang dmigs pa can gyi shes rab dang ldan pas bstan pa'i spyod yul ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the sphere of those with small roots of virtue and wisdom that apprehends. This is the meaning.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Śāradvatīputra?🔽Have you seen those dharmas by which you are called an arhat?”

original: chos gang gis khyod dgra bcom par brjod pa pa'i chos de dag khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dgra bcom pa dag bdag ni zag pa zad do //🔽bdag gis bya ba byas so //
analyzed: chos gang gis khyod dgra bcom par brjod pa pa'i chos de dag khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dgra bcom pa dag bdag ni zag pa zad do // bdag gis bya ba byas so //
translated: This is said in order to eliminate the conceptualization of the thought of the arhat śrāvakas, “I have exhausted the defilements,

original: khur bor ro //
analyzed: khur bor ro //
translated: I have done what had to be done,🔽I have laid down the burden,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa snyam du sems pa'i rtog pa dmigs pa can bsal ba'i phyir smras pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa snyam du sems pa'i rtog pa dmigs pa can bsal ba'i phyir smras pa'o //
translated: I have attained arhatship.”🔽He said, “No, Lord.”

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom ste /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom ste /
translated: This is because the arhats have conquered the enemies, the afflictions of the three realms,

original: spangs pa tsam la dgra bcom pa zhes tha snyad tsam du gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: spangs pa tsam la dgra bcom pa zhes tha snyad tsam du gdags par zad kyi /
translated: and are merely designated by the mere conventional term “arhat.”

original: yang dag par na dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang ma mchis so zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang ma mchis so zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: In reality, there is no dharma whatsoever called an arhat.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
