translated: The Blessed One said,🔽SharadvatIputra, it is so.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas bdag ni gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du rab
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas bdag ni gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du rab
translated: Up to: I think, 'I will certainly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.'

original: 'byor gyis dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po med par bstan pa de bden te /
analyzed: 'byor gyis dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po med par bstan pa de bden te /
translated: Subhuti taught that the thing called an arhat does not exist. That is true.

original: de bzhin du lung bstan pa zhes bya ba yang don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lung bstan pa zhes bya ba yang don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the thing called a prediction also does not ultimately exist.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang de lta bu'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i 'du shes kyang don dam par med la kun rdzob tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang de lta bu'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i 'du shes kyang don dam par med la kun rdzob tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
translated: A bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom also does not ultimately have such a conception of apprehending signs, but conventionally, he or she fully, completely, and manifestly awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: mi rgya bar yang dogs pa med cing /
analyzed: mi rgya bar yang dogs pa med cing /
translated: A bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom also, in that way, ultimately does not apprehend the notion of apprehending marks, and conventionally, there is no doubt that they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽They will not be frightened by emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyis skrag par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis skrag par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug yong su rdzogs par bgyid cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis don
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug yong su rdzogs par bgyid cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis don
translated: Blessed One, how do bodhisattva-mahāsattvas complete the six perfections and approach omniscience? This is the above question of the Blessed One about the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par lung bstan pa dang / bla na @191a * //🔽med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i chos de ni 'di'o zhes bya bar mi sems shing rnam par mi rtog kyang /
analyzed: dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par lung bstan pa dang / bla na @191a * // med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i chos de ni 'di'o zhes bya bar mi sems shing rnam par mi rtog kyang /
translated: The holy ones have prophesied that all phenomena are empty by nature, and they do not think or conceptualize, “This is the Dharma that I will fully awaken to as unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”🔽They have no doubts or hesitation that they will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they will definitely fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: kun rdzob tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar dogs pa dang / the tshom yang med de gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bshad pa de ltar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par ma byas
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar dogs pa dang / the tshom yang med de gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bshad pa de ltar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par ma byas
translated: Even though they will fully awaken in that way, they have not completed the six perfections.

original: shing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma bsags par mi 'gyur na pha rol tu phyin pa drug ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par bgyi /
analyzed: shing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma bsags par mi 'gyur na pha rol tu phyin pa drug ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par bgyi /
translated: If it is not possible without having accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom, how should the six perfections be completed?

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni ji ltar bsags te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni ji ltar bsags te /
translated: How should the collections of merit and wisdom be accumulated?🔽How should one approach the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur par bgyi zhes kun rdzob tu pha rol tu phyin pa drug ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs zhus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur par bgyi zhes kun rdzob tu pha rol tu phyin pa drug ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs zhus pa'o //
translated: Thus, he asks about the method of completing the six perfections conventionally.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having been thus addressed, said this to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gsum la thug gi bar du kun rdzob tu snying rje chen po la gnas nas pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gsum la thug gi bar du kun rdzob tu snying rje chen po la gnas nas pha rol tu phyin
translated: “Here, Subhūti, when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice the perfection of giving, up to the forty-third chapter, they should abide in great compassion conventionally and complete the six perfections.

original: pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / smon lam rgya chen por bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / smon lam rgya chen por bstan pa ste /
translated: the six perfections, the purification of the buddha-field, the means of developing living beings, and the great vow.

original: de dag gi don kyang rang log tu zad do //
analyzed: de dag gi don kyang rang log tu zad do //
translated: The meaning of these is self-evident.

original: de nas 'khor der gang g'a'i lha mo zhes bya ba'i bud med cig 'dus te 'dug par gyur pa de stan las langs te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas 'khor der gang g'a'i lha mo zhes bya ba'i bud med cig 'dus te 'dug par gyur pa de stan las langs te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, a woman named Ganga Devi, who was in the assembly, rose from her seat, and so on up to

original: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi la thug gi bar du lha mo'i ming gang g'a zhes bya ba lung bstan pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi la thug gi bar du lha mo'i ming gang g'a zhes bya ba lung bstan pa bshad pa ste /
translated: the forty-fourth chapter, which explains the prediction of the name of the goddess Ganga.

original: de ltar lung bstan pa yang bud med kyis smon lam rgya chen po btab pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed na skyes pa dang 'dra bar 'phags pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar lung bstan pa yang bud med kyis smon lam rgya chen po btab pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed na skyes pa dang 'dra bar 'phags pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The prediction is given in order to show that if a woman generates the roots of virtue by making a great vow, she will attain the noble stages just like a man.

original: tshig rnams ni rang log tu zad do //
analyzed: tshig rnams ni rang log tu zad do //
translated: The words are self-evident.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la gnas nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba @191b la sogs pa bshad pa /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la gnas nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba @191b la sogs pa bshad pa /
translated: The above explains how, by abiding in the three doors of perfect liberation, one brings sentient beings to full maturity and purifies a buddha field.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la gnas nas mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la gnas nas mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed de /
translated: Shravakas and pratyekabuddhas, by abiding in the three doors of perfect liberation, actualize nirvana.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la sogs pa mi nus pa dag kyang yod na /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la sogs pa mi nus pa dag kyang yod na /
translated: But there are those who are unable to bring sentient beings to full maturity and purify a buddha field.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur bar thabs mkhas pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la yang gnas la mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du mi byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur bar thabs mkhas pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la yang gnas la mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du mi byed cing /
translated: So, without that happening, by skillful means, they abide in the three doors of perfect liberation but do not actualize nirvana.

original: sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bar ji ltar bgyi zhes zhus pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bar ji ltar bgyi zhes zhus pa ste /
translated: How should I practice to bring about the perfect benefit of sentient beings?

original: de la ji ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par bgyi zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gis ji ltar shes par bya ba zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par bgyi zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gis ji ltar shes par bya ba zhus pa'o //
translated: Here, How should I thoroughly familiarize myself with emptiness? is asking how to understand through insight.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas ji ltar goms par bya zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas ji ltar goms par bya zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: How should I enter into the meditative absorption of emptiness? is asking how to cultivate śamatha.

original: mdor na zhi gnas lhag mthong gnyis zung du 'brel par ji ltar bsgom zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na zhi gnas lhag mthong gnyis zung du 'brel par ji ltar bsgom zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: In brief, it is asking how to cultivate the union of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: stong pa nyid bsgom pa ji ltar zhus pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom pa ji ltar zhus pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it was asked how to cultivate emptiness, it should be applied up to the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs stong zhes bya bar brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba nas gzugs med pa'i khams stong zhes brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rab
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs stong zhes bya bar brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba nas gzugs med pa'i khams stong zhes brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rab
translated: Subhūti, here, bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom should investigate form as empty, and so on up to the formless realm should be investigated as empty.

original: 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: This is the reply to Subhūti's question.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag ni gang zag la bdag med pa nyi tshe rtogs pas mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag rnams stong par rtog gi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag ni gang zag la bdag med pa nyi tshe rtogs pas mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag rnams stong par rtog gi /
translated: Since śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas only realize the selflessness of persons, they realize the emptiness of the selves imputed by tīrthikas.

original: chos la bdag med pa ma rtogs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams stong par rtogs te /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa ma rtogs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams stong par rtogs te /
translated: Since they do not realize the selflessness of phenomena, they realize phenomena such as form to be empty.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams dang / khams gsum yang stong zhes bya bar lhag mthong gis brtag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams dang / khams gsum yang stong zhes bya bar lhag mthong gis brtag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should investigate with insight, thinking, “The dharmas, up to and including the eighteen dharmas unique to a Buddha, such as the powers, and the three realms, are empty.”

original: de yang ci nas kyang de ltar brtags na sems g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi sems ting nge 'dzin du mnyam par gzhag ste bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de sems mi g-yeng ba dang ldan pas chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag @192a * //
analyzed: de yang ci nas kyang de ltar brtags na sems g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi sems ting nge 'dzin du mnyam par gzhag ste bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to // de sems mi g-yeng ba dang ldan pas chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag @192a * //
translated: And one should investigate in such a way that the mind does not become distracted. This means that one should cultivate the mind of śamatha, resting in equipoise in samādhi.

original: mthong gnyis zung du 'brel na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag dngos po yod par mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mthong gnyis zung du 'brel na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag dngos po yod par mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since the mind is not distracted, one does not see those dharmas as real. This teaches that when śamatha and vipaśyanā are united, one does not see those dharmas, such as form, as real things.

original: chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad la dngos por mi lta na zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mi byed🔽do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad la dngos por mi lta na zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that if he does not view any conditioned or unconditioned dharma as a real thing, he does not actualize the nirvāṇa that is a one-sided peace.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la bslabs pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la bslabs pas /
translated: It is because the bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the emptiness of the intrinsic identity of all phenomena.🔽He does not exclude any dharma.

original: chos gang la yang rigs chad par mi byed de zhes bya ba ni chos gang yang rjes su ma mthong bas mngon du mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par snga nas bslabs shing rtogs pas 'di ni mngon du byed do //
analyzed: chos gang la yang rigs chad par mi byed de zhes bya ba ni chos gang yang rjes su ma mthong bas mngon du mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste / byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par snga nas bslabs shing rtogs pas 'di ni mngon du byed do //
translated: This teaches the reason why he does not actualize any dharma, since he does not see any dharma.

original: 'di ni mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva has previously trained in and realized that all phenomena are empty of their own marks, he does not think, “This is to be actualized, this is not to be actualized.”

original: 'di ni mngon du byed pa'i rgyu'o zhes mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon du byed pa'i rgyu'o zhes mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: This is the cause for actualization.

original: mngon du bya ba dang / mngon du byed pa rnams so sor rigs su bcad de yod par mi lta'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba dang / mngon du byed pa rnams so sor rigs su bcad de yod par mi lta'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, he does not see the actualizer, the actualized, and the actualization as distinct realities.

original: don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir gang mngon du byed pa dang / gang mngon du bya ba dang / gang gis mngon du bya ba'i chos de dag thams cad kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir gang mngon du byed pa dang / gang mngon du bya ba dang / gang gis mngon du bya ba'i chos de dag thams cad kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to clarify that very meaning, he says: He does not see any dharma at all which is the actualizer, the actualized, or that by which there is actualization.

original: gang mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mngon du byed pa po la bya'o //
analyzed: gang mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mngon du byed pa po la bya'o //
translated: The actualizer is the bodhisattva who is the agent of actualization.

original: gang mngon du bya ba zhes bya ba ni mngon du bya ba'i dngos po mya ngan las 'das pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gang mngon du bya ba zhes bya ba ni mngon du bya ba'i dngos po mya ngan las 'das pa la bya'o //
translated: The actualized is the object of actualization, i.e., nirvana.

original: gang gis mngon du bya ba ni mngon du byed pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis mngon du bya ba ni mngon du byed pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: That by which there is actualization is the knowledge by means of which there is actualization.

original: chos de dag thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gang yang rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gang yang rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because all those phenomena are empty of their own mark, he does not see anything at all.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti says,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong pa'i chos rnams mngon du mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa de la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong pa'i chos rnams mngon du mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa de la /
translated: The Lord has said, “The bodhisattva mahāsattva should not realize the empty phenomena.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong pa nyid la gnas pa stong pa nyid mngon du mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad stong pa nyid du yang rtogs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong pa nyid la gnas pa stong pa nyid mngon du mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad stong pa nyid du yang rtogs la /
translated: In that case, O Lord, how does the bodhisattva mahāsattva, abiding in emptiness, not realize emptiness?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar stong pa nyid mngon sum du yang mi bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir @192b zhus pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar stong pa nyid mngon sum du yang mi bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir @192b zhus pa ste /
translated: This is asked in order to open up the opportunity to teach the method by which the bodhisattva, although realizing all phenomena as emptiness, should not realize emptiness in the manner of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: stong pa nyid la gnas na stong pa nyid mngon du mi byar mi rung ngam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas na stong pa nyid mngon du mi byar mi rung ngam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “If one abides in emptiness, is it not unsuitable to manifest emptiness?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la rab tu rtog ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la rab tu rtog ste /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas contemplate emptiness endowed with all supreme aspects,

original: mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni stong pa nyid la gnas kyang stong pa nyid mngon du mi byed pa'i thabs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni stong pa nyid la gnas kyang stong pa nyid mngon du mi byed pa'i thabs bstan pa ste /
translated: but do not manifest it. This and so forth teach the method of abiding in emptiness without manifesting emptiness.

original: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi stong pa ltar nyi tshe ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi stong pa ltar nyi tshe ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: As for emptiness endowed with all supreme aspects, it is not limited like the emptiness of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang zag dang chos gnyis ka rnam pa thams cad du stong par rtogs pas mya ngan las 'das pa yang stong par rtogs pa'i phyir mngon du mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos gnyis ka rnam pa thams cad du stong par rtogs pas mya ngan las 'das pa yang stong par rtogs pa'i phyir mngon du mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that because one realizes both persons and phenomena to be empty in all aspects, one does not manifest [nirvāṇa] because one realizes even nirvāṇa to be empty.

original: mngon du bya'o snyam du mi rtog go //
analyzed: mngon du bya'o snyam du mi rtog go //
translated: He does not think, “I will realize it.”

original: mngon du bya ba yin no zhes bya bar mi rtog ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'i sngon rol nas kyang mngon du bya ba don du mi gnyer to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba yin no zhes bya bar mi rtog ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'i sngon rol nas kyang mngon du bya ba don du mi gnyer to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He does not think, “It is to be realized,” meaning that even before entering into meditative concentration, he does not strive to realize it.

original: yongs su 'dris par bya bar rtog cing 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi /
analyzed: yongs su 'dris par bya bar rtog cing 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi /
translated: He thinks, “I will cultivate it,” and he thinks, “This is the time to cultivate it,🔽but this is not the time to realize it.”

original: 'di ni mngon du bya ba'i dus ma yin no zhes bya bar rtog go zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i don bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon du bya ba'i dus ma yin no zhes bya bar rtog go zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i don bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the meaning of “abiding in emptiness.”

original: stong pa nyid la gnas pa yang zhib phyogs gcig par lhung nas stong pa nyid mngon du byed cing gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas pa yang zhib phyogs gcig par lhung nas stong pa nyid mngon du byed cing gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: One who abides in emptiness does not fall into a one-sided extreme and realize and abide in emptiness.

original: lhag mthong gi dbang gis chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par shes shing /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi dbang gis chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par shes shing /
translated: By the power of insight, he knows that all phenomena are empty of intrinsic nature,

original: 'dis pa dang goms par byed la stong pa nyid la gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis pa dang goms par byed la stong pa nyid la gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and he cultivates and abides in emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mnyam par ma gzhag pa nyid du sems dmigs pa la 'dogs te zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi dbang du gyur nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mnyam par ma gzhag pa nyid du sems dmigs pa la 'dogs te zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi dbang du gyur nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, the great being, is one who, without being in meditative equipoise, fixes his mind on the objective support.

original: zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis stong pa nyid mngon du mi byed par lhag mthong gis dmigs par bya ba'i chos rnams la mngon par ma chags par sems 'jog go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis stong pa nyid mngon du mi byed par lhag mthong gis dmigs par bya ba'i chos rnams la mngon par ma chags par sems 'jog go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that, having become absorbed in serenity, he does not actualize emptiness by means of a one-sided meditative concentration on peace, but rather fixes his mind without attachment to the phenomena that are the objects of observation for insight.

original: des bar ma dor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des bar ma dor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: By this, the bodhisattva, the great being, does not fall away from the factors of enlightenment in the interval,🔽and he does not actualize the destruction of the contaminants.

original: zag pa zad pa yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de ltar lhag mthong la gnas pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams las nyams par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de ltar lhag mthong la gnas pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams las nyams par mi 'gyur la /
translated: This means that by abiding in insight in this way, he does not fall away from the factors of enlightenment,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and he does not actualize nirvana.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas @193a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas @193a * //
translated: Why is that?🔽Up to: “This is not the time to actualize it.”

original: 'di ni mngon du bya ba'i dus ma yin no zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nyan thos ltar mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon du bya ba'i dus ma yin no zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nyan thos ltar mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage explains the reason why, unlike the śrāvakas, they do not actualize nirvāṇa.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i ye shes rlabs po che dang ldan pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la spyod cing gnas pa'i tshe chos 'di dag shes par bya ba tsam du zad kyi don dam par dngos po med pas /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i ye shes rlabs po che dang ldan pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la spyod cing gnas pa'i tshe chos 'di dag shes par bya ba tsam du zad kyi don dam par dngos po med pas /
translated: When they practice and abide in the factors of awakening, they possess the great waves of gnosis that is the union of śamatha and vipaśyanā. At that time, they know that these phenomena are merely to be understood but are not to be actualized because ultimately they are not things.

original: mngon du bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they know that.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des 'di ltar 'di ni shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dus so zhes bya ba nas 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon du bya ba'i
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des 'di ltar 'di ni shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dus so zhes bya ba nas 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon du bya ba'i
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom should think, “This is the time for the perfection of knowledge,” up to “This is not the time to manifest the wisdom of a pratyekabuddha.”

original: dus ma yin te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams las yongs su nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dus ma yin te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams las yongs su nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: This explains that one will not regress from the factors of enlightenment as explained above,

original: zag pa zad pa yang mngon du mi byed par bshad pa byang chub kyi phyogs gang dang gang las mi nyams pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i chos gang dang gang mngon du mi byed pa zhib tu rnam par phye ste bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa yang mngon du mi byed par bshad pa byang chub kyi phyogs gang dang gang las mi nyams pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i chos gang dang gang mngon du mi byed pa zhib tu rnam par phye ste bstan pa ste /
translated: and that one will not manifest the Dharma of exhausted defilements. It teaches in detail which factors of enlightenment one will not regress from and which Dharma of exhausted defilements one will not manifest.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la spyod cing 'dris pa dang / goms par byed pa'i chos 'di dag shes par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la spyod cing 'dris pa dang / goms par byed pa'i chos 'di dag shes par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: These dharmas that are to be known are the dharmas of purification, such as the six perfections, that one should practice, become accustomed to, and make much of.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba ma yin par brtag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba ma yin par brtag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: One should not consider that one should attain the result of a śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha.🔽One should consider that this is the time when one should not give up attaining the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i dus so zhes bya bar brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu mngon du byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i dus so zhes bya bar brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu mngon du byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
translated: If one actualizes the result of a śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha, one would give up the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yongs su btang bar 'gyur gyi de ltar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su btang bar 'gyur gyi de ltar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should not do it that way.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par byed cing stong pa nyid kyis rnam par spyod pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par byed cing stong pa nyid kyis rnam par spyod pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They are thoroughly familiar with emptiness and they practice with emptiness.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du mi byed do //
translated: They do not actualize the state of a worthy one.🔽They do not actualize the state of a solitary realizer.

original: rang byang chub mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du stong pa nyid la gnas pa ji ltar stong pa nyid mngon du byed par mi 'gyur zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis zhib tu bshad de /
analyzed: rang byang chub mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du stong pa nyid la gnas pa ji ltar stong pa nyid mngon du byed par mi 'gyur zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis zhib tu bshad de /
translated: This passage explains in detail the reply the Bhagavān gave to Subhūti’s question, “How is it that those who abide in emptiness do not actualize emptiness?”

original: bka' stsal pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches a summary of the meaning of the statement.

original: rnam @193b par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pa'i chos rnams shes rab kyis 'dris shing goms par byed pa nyid la /
analyzed: rnam @193b par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pa'i chos rnams shes rab kyis 'dris shing goms par byed pa nyid la /
translated: It teaches that they are familiar with and practice the dharmas such as the three doors of liberation with wisdom.

original: de dag la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar zag pa med pa'i chos mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar zag pa med pa'i chos mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that they do not actualize the uncontaminated dharmas in the way that the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do, which is called “abiding in them.”

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste skyes bu zhig dpa' la rtsal che la zhes bya ba nas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang mngon du byas pas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste skyes bu zhig dpa' la rtsal che la zhes bya ba nas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang mngon du byas pas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this: a man who is brave and strong, up to he does not manifest the signless meditative stabilization by which he would stand in the śrāvaka or🔽pratyekabuddha grounds.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa chos thams cad stong pa🔽nyid du yang rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa chos thams cad stong pa nyid du yang rtogs par byed la /
translated: This passage explains the example of a bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom and is endowed with skill in means, who realizes all phenomena as emptiness,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du yang mi byed pa'i dpe mi dpa' bo rtsal che zhing thabs mkhas pa las blangs te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du yang mi byed pa'i dpe mi dpa' bo rtsal che zhing thabs mkhas pa las blangs te bstan pa ste /
translated: but does not manifest the nirvāṇa of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: tshig gzhan ni rang log tu zad /
analyzed: tshig gzhan ni rang log tu zad /
translated: The other words are self-evident.

original: sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi po ni rtsal gyis thabs sna tshogs dang / dgra thabs sna tshogs dang / bzo'i spyad sna tshogs dang / 'tsho rtsis su bya ba'i spyad rnam pa sna tshogs la mkhas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi po ni rtsal gyis thabs sna tshogs dang / dgra thabs sna tshogs dang / bzo'i spyad sna tshogs dang / 'tsho rtsis su bya ba'i spyad rnam pa sna tshogs la mkhas pa la bya ste /
translated: The sixty-four arts are the various skills, various military strategies, various crafts and various activities that are practiced for a living.

original: de lta bu'i mi dpa' bo de 'brog dgon pa 'jigs pa chen por phyin pa las /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi dpa' bo de 'brog dgon pa 'jigs pa chen por phyin pa las /
translated: When such a hero goes to a terrifying wilderness,

original: dgra byung yang dpa' zhing rtsal che la thabs mkhas pas pha ma dang bu smad kyang 'jigs pa nas bton te bde bar bkod /🔽bdag nyid la yang dgras mi tshugs shing /
analyzed: dgra byung yang dpa' zhing rtsal che la thabs mkhas pas pha ma dang bu smad kyang 'jigs pa nas bton te bde bar bkod / bdag nyid la yang dgras mi tshugs shing /
translated: even if enemies appear, he is brave, has great skill and is wise in various methods. He rescues his parents and children from danger and establishes them in happiness.🔽He himself is not harmed by enemies

original: dgra la yang gnod par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dgra la yang gnod par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: and he does not harm his enemies.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa yang sems can thams cad la tshad med pa sems nye bar 'jog cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa yang sems can thams cad la tshad med pa sems nye bar 'jog cing /
translated: In the same way, bodhisattvas who have skill in means direct their immeasurable love toward all sentient beings

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas te ;
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas te ;
translated: and they complete the six transcendent perfections.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la gnas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i don la yang 'dris par byed la /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la gnas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i don la yang 'dris par byed la /
translated: Abiding in the three doors of liberation, they familiarize themselves with the meaning of attaining the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de dag la mtshan mar yang mi 'dzin /
analyzed: de dag la mtshan mar yang mi 'dzin /
translated: But they do not grasp at signs.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang mngon du mi byed do zhes bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang mngon du mi byed do zhes bstan pa ste ;
translated: They do not manifest the signless meditative stabilization that would cause them to fall to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels.

original: mi dpa' bo che ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: mi dpa' bo che ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The “great hero” is an example of a bodhisattva who is skilled in means.

original: pha ma dang bu smad ni sems can thams cad kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: pha ma dang bu smad ni sems can thams cad kyi dpe'o //
translated: “Parents and children” are examples of all sentient beings.

original: phyir rgol ba'i dgra mang po ni theg pa chung ngu'i mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dpe'o //🔽grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal dang ljongs ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam bde @194a * //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i dgra mang po ni theg pa chung ngu'i mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dpe'o // grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal dang ljongs ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam bde @194a * //
translated: “Many hostile enemies” are examples of nonvirtuous spiritual friends of the Hīnayāna.🔽“Towns, cities, villages, and regions” are examples of the bodhisattva path that is pleasant and free from the danger of falling to the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: ba nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su lhung ba'i nyen med pa'i dpe yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ba nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su lhung ba'i nyen med pa'i dpe yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand this.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'dab chags bya ni bar snang la rgyu zhing sa la mi ltung ste zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med pa la spyad nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'dab chags bya ni bar snang la rgyu zhing sa la mi ltung ste zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med pa la spyad nas /
translated: Having practiced the boundless qualities of the Buddha,🔽he attains the knowledge of all modes.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'i dpe bya bar snang la
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'i dpe bya bar snang la
translated: This passage, from “Subhuti, it is like this” up to “he attains the knowledge of all modes,” teaches the example of the bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom, who is skilled in means, and who abides in the nondwelling nirvana.

original: rgyu ba las blangs nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu ba las blangs nas bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught by taking the example of a bird that flies through the sky.🔽A bird that flies through the sky does not stay in the middle of the sky,

original: bya bar snang la rgyu ba nam mkha'i dkyil bar snang la yang gnas mi 'cha' la /
analyzed: bya bar snang la rgyu ba nam mkha'i dkyil bar snang la yang gnas mi 'cha' la /
translated: and it does not stay on the ground.

original: byol song gzhan ltar sa 'ba' zhig la yang mi brten pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la spyad pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa mngon du yang mi byed la /
analyzed: byol song gzhan ltar sa 'ba' zhig la yang mi brten pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la spyad pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa mngon du yang mi byed la /
translated: Just as the other animals do not rely on the earth alone, in the same way, the skillful bodhisattvas, by practicing the three doors of perfect liberation, do not actualize the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽And by means of skillful means, although they practice the various bodhisattva activities, they do not remain in saṃsāra like ordinary beings.

original: thabs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa sna tshogs spyod kyang sems can phal ltar 'khor ba na yang mi gnas te de ltar 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka phyogs gcig tu mi gnas pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin🔽no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa sna tshogs spyod kyang sems can phal ltar 'khor ba na yang mi gnas te de ltar 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka phyogs gcig tu mi gnas pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, not remaining in either saṃsāra or nirvāṇa is nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this.🔽A powerful man becomes a master of archery...

original: skyes bu mthu dang ldan pa 'phong rtsal gyi slob dpon du gyur pa zhes bya ba nas nam dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par gyur pa de na /
analyzed: skyes bu mthu dang ldan pa 'phong rtsal gyi slob dpon du gyur pa zhes bya ba nas nam dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par gyur pa de na /
translated: When those roots of virtue have ripened into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' dam pa mngon du byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma grub kyi bar du bdag gi don mi byed pa'i dpe skyes
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' dam pa mngon du byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma grub kyi bar du bdag gi don mi byed pa'i dpe skyes
translated: The passage up to “he realizes the ultimate limit of reality” is the example of the bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom not working for his own benefit until the perfection of the benefit of others is accomplished.

original: bu mthu dang ldan pa 'phong rtsal gyi slob dpon du gyur pa las blangs nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bu mthu dang ldan pa 'phong rtsal gyi slob dpon du gyur pa las blangs nas bstan pa ste /
translated: The example is taken from a powerful man who becomes a master of archery.

original: mda' gnam du 'phangs nas mda' phyi ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas sa la mi lhung bar bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba spyad pa'i shugs drag po sems can gyi don mthar ma phyin gyi bar du mi gtong ba'i dpe yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mda' gnam du 'phangs nas mda' phyi ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas sa la mi lhung bar bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba spyad pa'i shugs drag po sems can gyi don mthar ma phyin gyi bar du mi gtong ba'i dpe yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The example of shooting an arrow into the sky and not letting it fall to the ground by means of a succession of other arrows should be understood as the bodhisattva’s aspiration and the force of his practice of the roots of virtue, which does not let go until the benefit of sentient beings is complete.

original: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos de dag gi chos nyid de ltar yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don rnams mjug bsdus @194b nas
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos de dag gi chos nyid de ltar yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don rnams mjug bsdus @194b nas
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, should thus investigate the dharma-hood of these dharmas.

original: bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching that concludes the meaning explained above.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa'i chos nyid du bshad pa de dag la de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa'i chos nyid du bshad pa de dag la de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that one should train in those dharmas explained as the dharma-hood of the skillful means of the Bodhisattvas.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos nyid 'di la slob pa zhes bya ba nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la slob cing bar mdor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las nyams par mi 'gyur
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos nyid 'di la slob pa zhes bya ba nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la slob cing bar mdor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las nyams par mi 'gyur
translated: He said, Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains in this dharma-hood, from 'trains in the three doors of liberation' up to 'does not fall back from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment'

original: ba ni dka' ba bgyid pa ste /
analyzed: ba ni dka' ba bgyid pa ste /
translated: is doing what is difficult.

original: bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: Blessed One, it is amazing.

original: bde bar gshegs pa shin tu ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa shin tu ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: The passage from Blessed One, it is most wondrous up to Blessed One, it is most wondrous shows that the bodhisattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid zab mo chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba la slob pa rnams stong pas skrag ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid zab mo chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba la slob pa rnams stong pas skrag ste /
translated: who are training in seeing the profound reality of the perfection of wisdom, the emptiness of all phenomena, are frightened by emptiness,

original: sems zhum nas bla na med pa'i byang chub ma thob par bar ma dor nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi lhung bar nus pa ni dka' ba bgyid pa ste /
analyzed: sems zhum nas bla na med pa'i byang chub ma thob par bar ma dor nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi lhung bar nus pa ni dka' ba bgyid pa ste /
translated: and their minds become discouraged, and it is difficult for them to attain unsurpassed enlightenment without falling in the interim to the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rab tu ngo mtshar che'o zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu ngo mtshar che'o zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by they are doing what is difficult.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the bodhisattva mahāsattvas have not abandoned all sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba de dag gi smon lam gyi khyad par ni rnam pa de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad stong par
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba de dag gi smon lam gyi khyad par ni rnam pa de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad stong par
translated: Subhūti, the special prayers of those bodhisattva great beings who have not abandoned all sentient beings will be like that.”

original: rtogs kyang stong pas skrag cing sems zhum ste bar mdor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las nyams nas /
analyzed: rtogs kyang stong pas skrag cing sems zhum ste bar mdor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las nyams nas /
translated: Thus, although bodhisattvas realize that all phenomena are empty, they are afraid of emptiness, their minds become discouraged, and they fall from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in the middle.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung bas dka' ba spyod pa de yang snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung bas dka' ba spyod pa de yang snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ste /
translated: Because they do not fall to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels, they practice austerities.

original: sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma bkod kyi bar du bdag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes smon lam khyad par can du btab pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma bkod kyi bar du bdag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes smon lam khyad par can du btab pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: I will not fully awaken until all sentient beings are established in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang yang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos spyod pa'i sems can dang / bdag tu lta ba'i sems can dang / sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can dang / gang zag dang chos su rnam par rtog pa'i sems can dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang yang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos spyod pa'i sems can dang / bdag tu lta ba'i sems can dang / sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can dang / gang zag dang chos su rnam par rtog pa'i sems can dang /
translated: They do not give up on any sentient beings, but they do not give up on sentient beings who practice non-dharmas, sentient beings who have the view of self, sentient beings whose minds are distorted, sentient beings who conceptualize persons and phenomena,

original: mtshan ma can du spyod pa'i sems can dang / 'jig rten dang @195a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma can du spyod pa'i sems can dang / 'jig rten dang @195a * //
translated: sentient beings who practice with signs, and sentient beings who aspire to mundane and

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la smon pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la smon pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba ste /
translated: supramundane dharmas.

original: de la rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can thams cad ni bdag gis yongs su ma btang ba ste /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can thams cad ni bdag gis yongs su ma btang ba ste /
translated: In this regard, Subhūti, it should be understood that a bodhisattva great being who thinks, “I have not abandoned all sentient beings,

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la gnas pa 'di dag ni bdag gis yongs su dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob kyi bar du ma dor yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed par rig par
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la gnas pa 'di dag ni bdag gis yongs su dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob kyi bar du ma dor yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed par rig par
translated: and I will liberate these who are abiding in non-excellent dharmas,” and who does not actualize the limit of reality without having attained omniscience,

original: bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam pa ma yin pa'i chos spyad pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin mngon par sgrub cing /
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam pa ma yin pa'i chos spyad pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin mngon par sgrub cing /
translated: through not abandoning sentient beings who practice non-excellent dharmas, accomplishes the concentrations of the three doors of liberation.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that, like the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, they do not actualize the limit of reality.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe 'di lta ste nang stong pa nyid dang zhes bya bas thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe 'di lta ste nang stong pa nyid dang zhes bya bas thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva great being practices the emptiness of internal phenomena and so on,

original: 'phel zhing de'i dbang po rnams kyang ches rno bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phel zhing de'i dbang po rnams kyang ches rno bar 'gyur te /
translated: he or she will develop the roots of virtue and his or her faculties will become very sharp.🔽They will not be like those of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta bu ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bdag tu lta ba'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams la spyod cing sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas bdag
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta bu ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bdag tu lta ba'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams la spyod cing sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas bdag
translated: This passage explains how bodhisattvas practice the teachings on emptiness without abandoning sentient beings who have the view of self.

original: dang sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag la sogs pa'i 'du shes pas dmigs pa can du spyod pa yin gyi de dag gi dmigs pa spang ba'i phyir chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: dang sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag la sogs pa'i 'du shes pas dmigs pa can du spyod pa yin gyi de dag gi dmigs pa spang ba'i phyir chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems shing /
translated: They are practicing with reference points, with the notion of a self, a sentient being, a life-force, a person, an individual, and so on. I will teach them the Dharma so that they can abandon such reference points.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams yongs su 'grib par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams yongs su 'grib par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If they do not actualize the very limit of reality, the qualities of complete purification, such as the six transcendent perfections, will not decline.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las khyad par du 'phags par shes rab rno bar 'gyur ro zhes bdag tu lta ba'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang pa phan yon dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las khyad par du 'phags par shes rab rno bar 'gyur ro zhes bdag tu lta ba'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang pa phan yon dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
translated: They will increase in virtue and their wisdom will become sharper, superior to that of the listeners and solitary realizers. In this way, they do not abandon sentient beings who have the view of a self, and this is taught to have benefits.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings

original: sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas phyin ci log bzhi la spyod spyod @195b pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya par sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang pa'i phyir
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas phyin ci log bzhi la spyod spyod @195b pa zhes bya ba nas / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya par sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang pa'i phyir
translated: These sentient beings have been practicing the four errors for a long time.🔽 Up to: They do not actualize the limit of reality until they awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: thabs la mkhas pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that they do not actualize the limit of reality until they complete the purification of skill in means, because they do not abandon sentient beings whose minds have become erroneous.🔽Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being thinks like this: These sentient beings have been practicing the practice of observing things for a long time.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di snyam du sems can 'di dag ni yun rang po nas dmigs pa la spyod spyod pa ste zhes bya ba nas snying rje chen po yongs su ma rdzogs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di snyam du sems can 'di dag ni yun rang po nas dmigs pa la spyod spyod pa ste zhes bya ba nas snying rje chen po yongs su ma rdzogs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du
translated: Up to: “They do not actualize the limit of reality until they complete great compassion.

original: mi byed de /🔽de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gang zag dang chos su rnam par rtog pa'i sems can yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams yongs su ma rdzogs par yang dag
analyzed: mi byed de / de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gang zag dang chos su rnam par rtog pa'i sems can yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams yongs su ma rdzogs par yang dag
translated: No, he does not.🔽At that time, the cultivation of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gates of liberation will be perfected.

original: pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This passage explains that because of not abandoning sentient beings who have the concepts of persons and phenomena, the factors of purification are not perfected, and therefore the limit of reality is not actualized.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di snyam du sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas mtshan ma la spyod spyod pa ste zhes bya ba nas snying rje chen po yongs su ma rdzogs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed de /🔽lde'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mtshan ma can du spyod pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir thabs mkhas pas de de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa yongs su
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas mtshan ma la spyod spyod pa ste zhes bya ba nas snying rje chen po yongs su ma rdzogs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed de / lde'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mtshan ma can du spyod pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir thabs mkhas pas de de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa yongs su
translated: They do not actualize the very limit of reality without completing great compassion.🔽 At that time, the bodhisattva great beings' cultivation of the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations, which are doors of liberation, is completed.

original: ma rdzogs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma rdzogs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This passage explains that because they do not abandon sentient beings who practice with signs, through skill in means they do not actualize the very limit of reality without completing the ten powers of the tathāgatas and so on.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di snyam du sems cad 'di dag ni yun ring po nas smon lam la spyod spyod pa ste zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu @196a * //🔽mngon par sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la smon pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems cad 'di dag ni yun ring po nas smon lam la spyod spyod pa ste zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu @196a * // mngon par sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la smon pa'i sems can rnams yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum
translated: they think, “These sentient beings have been practicing aspirations for a long time, up to🔽they have attained the highest complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, but they do not actualize the limit of reality.”🔽This shows that they complete the cultivation of the three doors of liberation

original: gyi ting nge 'dzin sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa yongs su ma rdzogs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gyi ting nge 'dzin sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa yongs su ma rdzogs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: without abandoning sentient beings who aspire for mundane and supramundane dharmas, and that they do not actualize the limit of reality without completing the ten tathāgata powers and so on.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod pa dang / 'dres par byed cing de lta bu'i ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par ltung ba'am khams gsum pa dang lhan cig gnas med skabs med de de ni gnas ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod pa dang / 'dres par byed cing de lta bu'i ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par ltung ba'am khams gsum pa dang lhan cig gnas med skabs med de de ni gnas ma yin no zhes bya
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of generosity and so on up to practicing the unentangled qualities of the buddhas, mixing with them, and possessing such wisdom vision, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not fall into non-conditioning, do not dwell or have an occasion to dwell together with the three realms. That is not possible.

original: ba'i bar gyis ni gong du bshad pa ltar snying rje chen po dang ldan pas /
analyzed: ba'i bar gyis ni gong du bshad pa ltar snying rje chen po dang ldan pas /
translated: This passage, as explained above, is about possessing great compassion.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba dang / thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa spyod pa ni nam yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par ltung bar🔽yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba dang / thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa spyod pa ni nam yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par ltung bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: The bodhisattvas who do not abandon any sentient being and who, through skill in means, do not actualize the limit of reality while practicing the six perfections and so forth will never fall into the nirvāṇa of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas without engaging in the actions of a buddha.

original: sems can phal ltar 'khor ba na gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can phal ltar 'khor ba na gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They will not remain in saṃsāra like ordinary beings.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di dag la yongs su 'dris par byed pa de ci ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /🔽de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag lung bstan pa yin nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di dag la yongs su 'dris par byed pa de ci ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag lung bstan pa yin nam /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice in this way and familiarize themselves with these factors of awakening, how is it that they do not fall into the extreme of existence?

original: ma yin brtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin brtag pa'i phyir /
translated: This and so forth is taught in order to examine whether or not those bodhisattvas who practice in this way are prophesied.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nang gcig la gcig 'drir gzhug pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nang gcig la gcig 'drir gzhug pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the chapter on the bodhisattvas' mutual questioning.

original: de la de ltar spyod cing byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di dag yongs su 'dris par byed pa de la ji ltar na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la de ltar spyod cing byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di dag yongs su 'dris par byed pa de la ji ltar na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In that way, when he is practicing and familiarizing himself with these dharmas that are aspects of enlightenment, how is it that...

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su 'dris par bya ba de brjod do //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su 'dris par bya ba de brjod do //
translated: Because that is the familiarization of the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: de lung bstan to //
analyzed: de lung bstan to //
translated: That is the prophecy.🔽That is the analysis.

original: de rab tu 'byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la @196b sogs pa'i chos de dag la spyod cing yongs su 'dris par byed pa na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: de rab tu 'byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la @196b sogs pa'i chos de dag la spyod cing yongs su 'dris par byed pa na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi
translated: In that way, when the bodhisattva who is practicing and familiarizing himself with those dharmas beginning with the six perfections,🔽without manifesting emptiness and the limit of reality that would cause him to attain the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha

original: sa thob par 'gyur pa'i stong pa nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa yin zhes dris na /
analyzed: sa thob par 'gyur pa'i stong pa nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa yin zhes dris na /
translated: levels,

original: gal te rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / dngos po med pa yid la 'dris par bya ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: gal te rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / dngos po med pa yid la 'dris par bya ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: If he answers, “The three doors of liberation, the absence of conceptualization, the absence of marks, the absence of volitional factors, non-arising, non-cessation, and the absence of entities are merely to be cultivated in the mind;

original: mngon du bya ba ma yin no zhes lan ldon na de phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun par lan ldon pas de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba ma yin no zhes lan ldon na de phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun par lan ldon pas de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: they are not to be actualized,” then, because he has answered in accordance with the irreversible bodhisattvas, he should be recognized as one who has been prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la de lta bu dris na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la de lta bu dris na /
translated: “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva great being is asked like this,🔽he should answer, ‘Emptiness is not to be fully known.’

original: 'di skad du lung ston cing des stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dis par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non pa ltar bsrabs pa'i sa non pa ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: 'di skad du lung ston cing des stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dis par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non pa ltar bsrabs pa'i sa non pa ma yin no zhes bya
translated: He should answer, ‘The irreversible bodhisattva great beings have not reached the level of thinning, as they have reached the irreversible level.’

original: bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The passage up to “should be known in the middle” teaches that when one is practicing the six perfections and so on,

original: ji ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa yin zhes dris pa na rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dris par mi bya'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa yin zhes dris pa na rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dris par mi bya'o zhes zer na /
translated: if one asks, “How does one not actualize the very limit of reality?” and one says, “One should not familiarize oneself with the three doors of liberation, the absence of attributes, and so on,”

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dris pa'i lan ldon pa dang mi mthun pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa ma yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dris pa'i lan ldon pa dang mi mthun pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa ma yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: then, because one’s response is not in accord with the way that irreversible bodhisattvas respond to questions, one should know that one has not been prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non pa ltar bsrabs pa'i sa non pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi sa'i rim pa la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non pa ltar bsrabs pa'i sa non pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi sa'i rim pa la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i
translated: The passage from “An irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva does not tread the level of thinning” up to “does not tread the level of thinning” teaches that an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva does not tread the level of thinning as an irreversible bodhisattva treads the irreversible level.🔽The level of thinning is a stage of the śrāvaka levels, and is the level of a once-returner.

original: sa la bya /
