analyzed: sa la bya /
translated: It is on the levels.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rim pa la ni sa gnyis pa yan chad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rim pa la ni sa gnyis pa yan chad /
translated: It is on the second and higher levels of the Bodhisattva

original: sa bdun pa man chad la bya ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa man chad la bya ste /
translated: and on the seventh level and below of the Bodhisattva.🔽The irreversible Bodhisattva who has attained the eighth level has abandoned all signs and has become spontaneously accomplished.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad non pa ni mtshan ma thams cad spangs shing lhun gyis grub par gyur pa de ltar lung ma bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis bsrabs pa'i sa yang legs par non par ma gyur to zhes bya🔽ba'i don to //🔽gsol pa bcom ldan 'das gang gis slar mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs mchis sam zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rim pa @197a * //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad non pa ni mtshan ma thams cad spangs shing lhun gyis grub par gyur pa de ltar lung ma bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis bsrabs pa'i sa yang legs par non par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to // gsol pa bcom ldan 'das gang gis slar mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs mchis sam zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rim pa @197a * //
translated: The meaning is that those Bodhisattvas who are not prophesied have not attained the level of thinning.🔽He asks, “Bhagavan, is there a category of those who will not turn back?”

original: ma thob pa las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba ci las brtag ces zhus pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ma thob pa las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba ci las brtag ces zhus pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The meaning of the question is, “From what should one consider those who have not attained the levels of the Bodhisattva to be irreversible?”

original: rab 'byor de ni yod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni yod de /
translated: The Bhagavan replied, “Subhūti, there is.”

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug thos kyang rung ma thos kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug thos kyang rung ma thos kyang rung ste /
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva hears the six perfections or not,🔽he should answer as an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva would.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ci lta ba bzhin du lan glan pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa'i rim pa ma thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang chos zab mo la mos shing /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ci lta ba bzhin du lan glan pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa'i rim pa ma thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang chos zab mo la mos shing /
translated: This shows that even bodhisattvas who have not yet attained the stages, if they have interest in the profound Dharma

original: gzhan gyis dris pa'i lan phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun par lan ldon pa de dag ni phyis phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dris pa'i lan phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun par lan ldon pa de dag ni phyis phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and answer questions from others in a way that accords with irreversible bodhisattvas, they will later become irreversible.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byang chub tu spyod pa ni mang ste /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byang chub tu spyod pa ni mang ste /
translated: He said, “Bhagavān, therefore, there are many who practice for awakening.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su sbyang ba'i sa'am yongs su sbyang ba ma lags pa'i sa la gnas pa bzhin du lan 'debs pa ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba dkon pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su sbyang ba'i sa'am yongs su sbyang ba ma lags pa'i sa la gnas pa bzhin du lan 'debs pa ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba dkon pa ste /
translated: There are very few irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who can answer like that, either on the level of thorough training or on the level of no more thorough training.

original: yongs su sbyang ba'i sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyang ba'i sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bya'o //
translated: The level of thorough training is the level of practice through devoted interest.

original: yongs su sbyang ba'i sa ma yin pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa yang ma thob pa la bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yongs su sbyang ba'i sa ma yin pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa yang ma thob pa la bya'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The level of no more thorough training is when one has not even attained the level of practice through devoted interest.

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhuti, it is just as you have said.🔽 Those who have set out in the Great Vehicle are hard to find, and even among them, those who are irreversible are very few.

original: de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: They are not carried away by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya ba las le'u bzhi bcu lnga pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya ba las le'u bzhi bcu lnga pa'o /
translated: This was the forty-fifth chapter on the irreversible Bodhisattva in the Noble Great Vehicle Sutra of the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.

original: // / zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dkon pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: // / zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dkon pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to “thus it is, Subhuti, thus it is” shows the reason for the rarity of the irreversible bodhisattva.

original: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed cing /
analyzed: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed cing /
translated: Those who have previously generated great roots of virtue

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa de dag gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun par lan ldon zhing /

translated: this is also a sign of irreversibility, and it is a sign that in the buddha-land of that bodhisattva's supreme awakening, the three evil destinies will be completely impossible.

translated: From “If a city were to burn” up to “by those causes and conditions, he should be known as an irreversible bodhisattva great being” is the knowledge of irreversibility from the power of the truth of consecration.🔽

original: par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: From “If a city is burning” up to “by those causes and conditions one should know that one is a bodhisattva great being who is irreversible” teaches the knowledge of irreversibility from the power of the blessing of truth.

original: rmi lam mam gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe yang rung /
analyzed: rmi lam mam gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe yang rung /
translated: Whether in a dream or when not asleep,

translated: But through the bodhisattva’s blessing of truth, that maturation is exhausted, and it is taught that he should be known as irreversible.

analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang mtshan ma gang gis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, through whatever aspects, whatever ways, and whatever marks …

translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has those aspects, those ways, and those marks should be known as irreversible.

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa yin nam ma yin pa bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis brtag par bstan pa'o //
translated: This also teaches that through the blessing of truth, one should investigate whether or not he is irreversible.

analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /

translated: Subhuti: What, O Lord, is the deed of Mara to a Bodhisattva, a great being, when he doubts and hesitates and is uncertain?

Because he has not been taken hold of by a good spiritual friend. He will not be able to train himself in the perfection of wisdom, nor in the perfection of concentration, vigour,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: The perfection of wisdom is without a characteristic, Subhuti. This shows that, since it is like space, it does not exist as the characteristic of any dharma.

translated: This is to ask whether all phenomena are similar to the perfection of wisdom, in order to open up the section on the teaching that all phenomena are naturally isolated and naturally empty.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //

translated: and so on, up to “By whatever defining characteristic the perfection of wisdom exists, by that very defining characteristic all phenomena exist.”

translated: The perfection of wisdom and all phenomena are the same in being void of intrinsic nature and empty of intrinsic nature.

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /

original: rab 'byor de ltar na sems can rnams kyis rnam par byang ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben zhing stong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na sems can rnams kyis rnam par byang ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben zhing stong na /
translated: Up to this point, it is said that if all phenomena are ultimately empty and devoid of intrinsic nature,

original: sems can rnams kyis de ltar ma rtogs te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis de ltar ma rtogs te /
translated: sentient beings do not realize that.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin cing 'khor ba na 'khyams par gyur pa de dag bkri ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yod par sgro btags te bshad pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin cing 'khor ba na 'khyams par gyur pa de dag bkri ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yod par sgro btags te bshad pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: In order to guide those who grasp at signs and wander in saṃsāra, the existence of affliction and purification is merely imputed and explained conventionally.

original: don dam par ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ultimately nothing exists.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni gzugs la mi spyod ces bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar don dam par chos thams cad
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni gzugs la mi spyod ces bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar don dam par chos thams cad
translated: The passage from up to he does not practice in the knowledge of all aspects means that although bodhisattvas realize that ultimately all phenomena are

original: rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs kyang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs kyang /
translated: empty of inherent nature,🔽they do not actualize emptiness.🔽With skillful means, they view the existence of affliction and purification in the relative in order to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: stong pa nyid mngon du mi byed par thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yod par lta ba de ltar spyod pa ni kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams
analyzed: stong pa nyid mngon du mi byed par thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yod par lta ba de ltar spyod pa ni kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams
translated: Those who practice like that practice in the relative in all phenomena such as form,

original: cad la spyod kyang /
analyzed: cad la spyod kyang /
translated: but

original: don dam par de dag la dngos por lta zhing mi spyod do zhes @201a * //
analyzed: don dam par de dag la dngos por lta zhing mi spyod do zhes @201a * //
translated: they do not practice in them by viewing them as entities ultimately.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang spyod pa dang gang gis spyod pa dang / gang la spyod par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ni don dam par chos thams cad la mi spyod pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang spyod pa dang gang gis spyod pa dang / gang la spyod par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ni don dam par chos thams cad la mi spyod pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the reason why ultimately one does not engage in any dharma:

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: because ultimately all dharmas are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: spyod pa po dang / spyad par bya ba dang / spyod pa'i rgyu gang yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa po dang / spyad par bya ba dang / spyod pa'i rgyu gang yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that because of that, the agent, the object of engagement, and the cause of engagement are not observed at all.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi thub pa ste zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa lags so
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi thub pa ste zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa lags so
translated: “ Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices in that way is unconquerable by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, and so on up to: has approached omniscience.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar thabs mkhas pa dang ldan par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis gnod par bya mi nus shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar thabs mkhas pa dang ldan par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis gnod par bya mi nus shing /
translated: He cannot be overpowered by all the worlds.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non la /
translated: He cannot be outshined by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the benefit of being close to omniscience.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor gal te 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang / gling bzhi dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang / gling bzhi dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang /
translated: “Subhūti, if all the beings in Jambudvīpa were to obtain a human body at the same time, and so on, this teaches the benefit of being close to omniscience in terms of Jambudvīpa, the four continents, the trichiliocosm, and the buddha realms in the ten directions.

original: stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dus gcig tu sangs rgyas su gyur pa la /🔽rim gro dang / bkur sti la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dus gcig tu sangs rgyas su gyur pa la / rim gro dang / bkur sti la sogs pa byas te /
translated: and were to be attended and served by the sentient beings of the world systems of the great trichiliocosm,🔽and if the wholesome roots of those who had attended and served them were to be dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / yid la byed pa bsod nams ches bstan pa ste /🔽gzhan la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / yid la byed pa bsod nams ches bstan pa ste / gzhan la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and if someone were to teach this perfection of wisdom to others, and to attend to it mentally, the latter would have merit that is far greater.

original: 'chad pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: “To teach to others, to explain, to expound, to set forth, to analyze, to make clear, to make manifest, to show, to reveal” is to be known as a synonym for “to explain.”

original: rab 'byor gal te 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la /🔽de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi @201b bu mo la la zhig gis /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la / de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi @201b bu mo la la zhig gis /
translated: Subhūti, if all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa were to attain human bodies simultaneously,🔽and🔽if some son or daughter of good lineage were to establish them in the ten virtuous actions,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang gling bzhi dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dus gcig tu mi'i lus su gyur la /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang gling bzhi dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dus gcig tu mi'i lus su gyur la /
translated: and so on, this would establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa, the four continents, the chiliocosm, the dichiliocosm, and the great trichiliocosm simultaneously in human bodies.

original: de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la sogs pa la bkod de /
analyzed: de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la sogs pa la bkod de /
translated: If all of them were established in the ten virtuous actions and so on,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang 'chad pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams chi ba bstan pa'o
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang 'chad pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams chi ba bstan pa'o
translated: The merit of teaching and explaining this perfection of wisdom to others is shown to be greater than the merit of dedicating the roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: // rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam par spyod pa ni zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa'i shes rab kyi mig bskyed par 'dod pas /
analyzed: // rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam par spyod pa ni zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa'i shes rab kyi mig bskyed par 'dod pas /
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who practices like that, with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects, from “practices” up to “wants to produce the unsurpassed eye of wisdom,”🔽should always and continuously stand with attention connected with the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston cing

translated: This passage explains that, as explained above, this perfection of wisdom should be taught to others and

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ba dag ste /
translated: The benefits of engaging in the perfection of wisdom through teaching and so on with attention endowed with the knowledge of all aspects🔽The benefits of engaging in the perfection of

original: de bas na phan yon de dag thob par 'dod pa dang / yul khams kyi bsod snyoms blang ba 'bras bu yod par bya bar 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lam ston pa la sogs pa 'dod pas /
analyzed: de bas na phan yon de dag thob par 'dod pa dang / yul khams kyi bsod snyoms blang ba 'bras bu yod par bya bar 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lam ston pa la sogs pa 'dod pas /
translated: and who wish to show the path to all sentient beings,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gnas par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gnas par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: should always and continuously abide in the mental activity endowed with the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te byang chub @202a * //
analyzed: gal te byang chub @202a * //
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
translated: through the mental activity endowed with the perfection of wisdom,🔽does not engage in discrimination, then he should not open the door to other mental activities.

original: rnam par mi spyod na yang des yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi dbye ba ste zhes bya ba ni brgya la gong du smos pa lta bur shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba yongs su rdzogs par ma🔽nus na yang /
analyzed: rnam par mi spyod na yang des yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi dbye ba ste zhes bya ba ni brgya la gong du smos pa lta bur shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba yongs su rdzogs par ma🔽nus na yang /
translated: If he is unable to fully accomplish the mental activity endowed with the perfection of wisdom as described above,🔽he should not open the door to other mental activities.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba go skabs mi dbye'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba go skabs mi dbye'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: He should not open the way for the attentions of the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.🔽This shows that he should act in such a way that he is never separated from the attention associated with the perfection of wisdom, day or night, and that he should stand firm in effort.

original: des ni ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba nyid kyis nyin mtshan du mi gtong zhing brtson par gnas pa de ltar bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba
analyzed: des ni ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba nyid kyis nyin mtshan du mi gtong zhing brtson par gnas pa de ltar bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba
translated: This is the attention to the perfection of wisdom.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs su mi gtong bar brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs su mi gtong bar brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He should not let it be incomplete, but should make an effort.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che de stong par yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che de stong par yang mi bya ste /
translated: Subhuti: It is as if, Lord, a man who had lost his way in a great forest would rise up and go, and would see a tree laden with fruit.🔽He would go to it, and would eat of the fruit.

original: de ltar na rtag tu bde ba dang yid bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yid la bya ba rtag tu mi gtang ba'i dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rtag tu bde ba dang yid bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yid la bya ba rtag tu mi gtang ba'i dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, one will always have happiness, mental happiness, and much mental happiness.🔽Up to this point, the example of never abandoning the mental attention of the perfection of wisdom is taught.

original: de ltar yid la bya ba de ma btang na rtag tu yid bde ba mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yid la bya ba de ma btang na rtag tu yid bde ba mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, if one does not abandon that mental attention, one will always have much mental happiness.🔽He said, Blessed One, all those mental attentions are devoid of intrinsic nature.🔽And so on. Thus, above it was explained that one is not separated from the mental attention endowed with the perfection of wisdom and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das yid la bgyi ba de dag thams cad kyang rang bzhin dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral lo zhes bshad pa la 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig yid la bya ba de lta bu dngos po yod par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das yid la bgyi ba de dag thams cad kyang rang bzhin dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral lo zhes bshad pa la 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig yid la bya ba de lta bu dngos po yod par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: In the retinue, some conceived of such mental attention as an existent thing. In order to dispel that, Subhūti asked.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti, it is because this perfection of wisdom is empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: de la 'phel ba med do //
analyzed: de la 'phel ba med do //
translated: In it there is no increase,🔽and there is no decrease.”

original: yongs su 'grib pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba yang dngos po yod par rtog pa'i yid la bya ba la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'grib pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba yang dngos po yod par rtog pa'i yid la bya ba la ni mi bya'o //
translated: This passage from “Subhūti, it is because this perfection of wisdom is empty of an intrinsic nature” up to “In it there is no increase, and there is no decrease” teaches that being inseparable from mental attention does not refer to mental attention that conceives of the existence of things.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: It teaches that ultimately all phenomena are empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: sus kyang ma byas la de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas par shes pa nyid yid la byed pa de dang ma bral ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sus kyang ma byas la de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas par shes pa nyid yid la byed pa de dang ma bral ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that being inseparable from mental attention refers to the mental attention that knows that nothing is created by anyone and that all phenomena abide in the nature of reality, the expanse of reality, and so forth.

analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis @202b dben zhing /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags zhes bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya bar rtog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du shes rab kyi pha
translated: From It is emptiness up to That bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as practicing the perfection of wisdom shows the perfection of wisdom that is the cause of the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin no zhes bshad pa la /
translated: From “It is empty of an intrinsic nature” up to “One should know that the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom” explains that the bodhisattva is not separate from the perfection of wisdom.🔽In the midst of the retinue, some conceived of the perfection of wisdom as an existent thing.

original: 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po yod par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i lan bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po yod par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i lan bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: In order to dispel that, Subhūti asked a question, and the Bhagavān gave an answer.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba yang dngos po yod par de yang ma bral ba la ni mi bya'i /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba yang dngos po yod par de yang ma bral ba la ni mi bya'i /

analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /

translated: If one does not conceive of it as increasing or decreasing, as one or two, then one is said to be engaged in the perfection of wisdom and to be dwelling on the irreversible stage.🔽Subhūti said, “Blessed One, is the emptiness, hollowness, falsity, unreality, and essencelessness of the perfection of wisdom engaged in the perfection of wisdom?”

translated: This is said to be the understanding that “that bodhisattva great being is engaged in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: 'khor gyi nang nas 'ga' zhig de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dngos por yod dam snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir zhus pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang nas 'ga' zhig de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dngos por yod dam snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir zhus pa ste /
translated: The question is asked in order to dispel the conception of some in the assembly who think, Are there any bodhisattvas who actually practice like that?

original: stong pa nyid dang / gsog dang / gsob dang / rag ma lus pa dang ; snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / gsog dang / gsob dang / rag ma lus pa dang ; snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs te /
translated: Emptiness, falsity, unreality, unsubstantiality, and essencelessness are synonyms for emptiness.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de la spyod pa gnyis ka rang bzhin stong na /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de la spyod pa gnyis ka rang bzhin stong na /

analyzed: su zhig tsam la spyod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of who practices? is not tenable.

original: gsog dang gsob dang rag ma lus pa dang / snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsog dang gsob dang rag ma lus pa dang / snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: Falsity, unreality, insubstantiality, and essencelessness should be known as synonyms for emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Subhūti, it is not so.

original: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba yang /
translated: The statement practices the perfection of wisdom

original: kun rdzob tu bshad pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bshad pa tsam du zad kyi /

analyzed: don dam par ni spyod pa dang / spyad par bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o // gsol pa bcom @203a * // ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i chos gang yang dmigs su ma mchis sam zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid shes
translated: In the ultimate sense, there is no practice and nothing to be practiced.🔽He said, “Blessed One, is it the case that apart from the perfection of wisdom, no phenomenon whatsoever can be apprehended that practices the perfection of wisdom?”

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin na /
translated: This is asking, “If the perfection of wisdom is empty of the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is not the practice of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mchis sam zhes zhus pa'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, that is not so.”

original: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas chos gzhan gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas chos gzhan gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //

analyzed: med na / ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam zhus pa'o //

translated: If both practice and what is practiced are empty, is it the case that one practices in emptiness-emptiness?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa la bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa la bya ste /

translated: He asks, Blessed One, does emptiness practice apart from emptiness? If practicing like that does not practice emptiness, does emptiness practice some entity other than emptiness?

analyzed: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rigs rgyun mi gcod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ring du mi byed pa dang / snying po byang chub las 'phang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sems can ngan song gsum du bying ba rnams 'don nus par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rigs rgyun mi gcod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ring du mi byed pa dang / snying po byang chub las 'phang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sems can ngan song gsum du bying ba rnams 'don nus par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: they do not interrupt the lineage of the lineage of the knowledge of all aspects, they do not make the Tathagata distant, they do not fall from the essence of enlightenment, they are able to rescue sentient beings who are drowning in the three lower realms,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bslab pa la mi slob pa'i yon tan bsngags pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bslab pa la mi slob pa'i yon tan bsngags pa bstan pa'o //
translated: and they praise the qualities of training in the bodhisattva trainings and not training in the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha trainings.

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi dag kyang 'gro bar bya bar sems te zhes bya ba nas 'di dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab🔽mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi dag kyang 'gro bar bya bar sems te zhes bya ba nas 'di dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Up to: “These are the ones who should be known as the ones who are intent on practicing this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di nyid nan tan du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod cing nan tan du byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di nyid nan tan du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod cing nan tan du byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice and are intent on this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di nyid la 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams kyis rim gror bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rtag tu dgongs pa dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang nad thams cad mi 'byung ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams kyis rim gror bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rtag tu dgongs pa dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang nad thams cad mi 'byung ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: this very [practice] is to be known as the benefit of not being harmed in body and mind, of not giving rise to any suffering or illness, of being constantly attended to by the gods of the desire realm and the form realm, of being constantly contemplated by the tathāgatas, and of being served by the four great kings.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo 'di snyam du gyur te zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang legs pa brjod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthur rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brgya byin gyis de ltar
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo 'di snyam du gyur te zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang legs pa brjod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthur rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brgya byin gyis de ltar
translated: Then the venerable Ananda thought thus, up to the praise of the good qualities and virtues of the perfection of wisdom should be known as the power of the Buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa dang / de la spyod pa'i phan yon bstan pa yang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa dang / de la spyod pa'i phan yon bstan pa yang /
translated: Thus, the teaching of the enumeration of the profundity of the perfection of wisdom, and the teaching of the benefits of practicing it,

original: brgya byin gyis chos bshad na 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis chos bshad na 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: are shown to be the blessing of the Blessed One for the sake of benefiting the beings to be trained by the teaching of the Dharma by Indra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brgya byin de skad smra ba 'khor rnams kyis yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brgya byin de skad smra ba 'khor rnams kyis yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ananda and so on, in order to make the retinue trust the words of Indra, he said It is so.

original: dga' bo gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa dang zhes bya ba nas spu g-yo bar 'gyur ba dang / skar ma ltung ba gtong zhing 'jigs pa skyed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bdud thams cad @206b glags lta bar 'gyur gyis bag yod par byos shig ces bstan pa'o
analyzed: dga' bo gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa dang zhes bya ba nas spu g-yo bar 'gyur ba dang / skar ma ltung ba gtong zhing 'jigs pa skyed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bdud thams cad @206b glags lta bar 'gyur gyis bag yod par byos shig ces bstan pa'o
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya replied, “Blessed One, it would generate a great deal of merit.”🔽The Blessed One said, “Maitreya, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish the sentient beings of all the world spheres in the ten directions, as many as they are, in the result of stream enterer, what do you think, would that son of a good family or that daughter of a good family generate much merit on that basis?”

original: // de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: // de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya replied, “Blessed One, it would generate a great deal of merit.”🔽The Blessed One said, “Maitreya, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish a single sentient being in the result of once-returner, what do you think, would that son of a good family or that daughter of a good family generate much merit on that basis?”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya replied, “Blessed One, it would generate a great deal of merit.”

original: 'di ltar rigs kyi bu 'di gnyis kyis gang brtsams pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs kyi bu 'di gnyis kyis gang brtsams pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ma yin /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Maitreya, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish the sentient beings of all the world spheres in the ten directions, as many as they are, in the result of once-returner, what do you think

original: rigs kyi bu 'di gnyis kyis ni sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam brtsams so zhes bya ba nas dga' zhing spro ba dang tshim zhing yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i skyon rnams bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di gnyis kyis ni sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam brtsams so zhes bya ba nas dga' zhing spro ba dang tshim zhing yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i skyon rnams bstan pa ste /
translated: The two of them have set out on the paths of the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama, up to they will be joyful, elated, satisfied, and experience mental happiness.

original: sngon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dad cing mos par ma byas pa dang / the tshom za ba dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mi ldan pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa yongs su 'dzin cing de'i legs pa brjod pa dang /
analyzed: sngon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dad cing mos par ma byas pa dang / the tshom za ba dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mi ldan pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa yongs su 'dzin cing de'i legs pa brjod pa dang /
translated: They have not previously had faith in and interest in the perfection of wisdom, they have doubts, they do not have a spiritual friend, they take up what is not the holy Dharma and praise it,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di shin tu zab pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di shin tu zab pas /
translated: and they say, 'This perfection of wisdom is very deep,

original: khyod kyis spyad mi nus so zhes gzhan gyi dad pa bzlog pa dang / bdag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa bsnyems shing /
analyzed: khyod kyis spyad mi nus so zhes gzhan gyi dad pa bzlog pa dang / bdag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa bsnyems shing /
translated: you cannot practice it.' They turn others away from faith, and they are arrogant about their own practice of the six perfections,

original: gzhan pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa ma yin no zhes brnyas par byed pa dang / bdag nyid mchog tu sems shing /
analyzed: gzhan pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa ma yin no zhes brnyas par byed pa dang / bdag nyid mchog tu sems shing /
translated: They will disparage others, saying, “I practice the six perfections, but you do not.”🔽They will think themselves superior and become arrogant.

original: rlom sems bskyed pa dang / bdag gi ming dang rus kun gyis brjod pa'i grags pa bsnyems nas /
analyzed: rlom sems bskyed pa dang / bdag gi ming dang rus kun gyis brjod pa'i grags pa bsnyems nas /
translated: They will become conceited by the fame of their name and family,

original: gzhan khyad du gsod de /
analyzed: gzhan khyad du gsod de /
translated: and will despise others.

original: bdag stod cing gzhan la smod pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa /
analyzed: bdag stod cing gzhan la smod pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa /
translated: They will praise themselves and disparage others.🔽They will argue with people who follow the vehicle of the hearers.

original: gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang rtsod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la spyod pa nang 'thab par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang rtsod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la spyod pa nang 'thab par 'gyur na /
translated: When those who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas fight among themselves,

original: bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Māra will find an opportunity.”

original: dga' bo gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' lung ma bstan pa zhes bya ba nas ji srid kyi bskal par go cha bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' phal pas lung bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bsngos shing /
analyzed: dga' bo gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' lung ma bstan pa zhes bya ba nas ji srid kyi bskal par go cha bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' phal pas lung bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bsngos shing /
translated: Moreover, Nanda, if a bodhisattva who has not received a prophecy thinks, I will don the armor for as many eons as there are thoughts of malice and evil intent that I have generated toward a bodhisattva who has received a prophecy,

original: gnod par bsams la byang chub sems dpa' phal pa de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi gtong zhing thob par 'dod na gnod sems dang sdig pa'i sems ji snyed bskyed pa de snyed kyi bskal par dga' ba spyod cing 'bad dgos so zhes🔽bstan pa'o // dga' bos gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sems @207a * //
analyzed: gnod par bsams la byang chub sems dpa' phal pa de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi gtong zhing thob par 'dod na gnod sems dang sdig pa'i sems ji snyed bskyed pa de snyed kyi bskal par dga' ba spyod cing 'bad dgos so zhes bstan pa'o // dga' bos gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sems @207a * //
translated: and if that bodhisattva who has not received a prophecy does not give up the knowledge of all aspects and wishes to attain it, then he must don the armor for as many eons as he has generated thoughts of malice and evil intent, and he must delight in and strive for that for as many eons as he has generated thoughts of malice and evil intent.🔽Nanda said, Blessed One, are there other occurrences for those thoughts that they generate?

original: bskyed pa de dag la 'byung ba gzhan mchis sam /
analyzed: bskyed pa de dag la 'byung ba gzhan mchis sam /
translated: The Blessed One said, Nanda, there are other occurrences for those thoughts that they generate.

original: 'o na de ma lags kyi bskal pa de snyed kho nar go cha bgo 'tshal zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i ngan sems skyes pa bshags shing sbyangs na 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na de ma lags kyi bskal pa de snyed kho nar go cha bgo 'tshal zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i ngan sems skyes pa bshags shing sbyangs na 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: Well then, I will don the armor for just that many eons is the question to open up the detailed explanation of whether or not such a negative thought will arise if confessed and purified.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dga' bo gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams dang zhes bya ba nas de la bdud sdig to can glags lta zhing /
analyzed: dga' bo gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams dang zhes bya ba nas de la bdud sdig to can glags lta zhing /
translated: Nanda, for the person who is a Hearer, from the time of first generating the thought of enlightenment up to the time of attaining the knowledge of a complete buddha, Mara the Wrongdoer, seeking an opportunity and looking for an opportunity, does not find an opportunity.🔽Up to in that case, one should not hold it in the mind and should not bear a grudge.

original: glags tshol bas kyang glags mi rnyed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar 'thabs shing rtsod pa la sogs par 'gyur na zhe la mi 'chang zhing 'khon du mi 'dzin par bya ste /🔽mthol zhing bshags la phyin chad kyang de ltar mi bya bar yid dam bcas te /
analyzed: glags tshol bas kyang glags mi rnyed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar 'thabs shing rtsod pa la sogs par 'gyur na zhe la mi 'chang zhing 'khon du mi 'dzin par bya ste / mthol zhing bshags la phyin chad kyang de ltar mi bya bar yid dam bcas te /
translated: One should confess and disclose it, and should make a vow not to do it again.

original: chod par byas na 'byang bar 'gyur gyi de ltar ma byas na 'byang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chod par byas na 'byang bar 'gyur gyi de ltar ma byas na 'byang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does it in that way, it will be purified. If one does not do it in that way, it will not be purified.

original: yun ring por 'khor ba na 'khor zhing bskal pa mang por brtsal zhing 'bad dgos so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring por 'khor ba na 'khor zhing bskal pa mang por brtsal zhing 'bad dgos so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that one will wander in cyclic existence for a long time and must strive and make effort for many eons.

original: dga' bo gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dag dang 'grogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su grol bar bya ba dag go snyam du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis
analyzed: dga' bo gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dag dang 'grogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su grol bar bya ba dag go snyam du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis
translated: Moreover, Nanda, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should not associate with persons of the Śrāvaka Vehicle, up to he should think, ‘They are liberated from all suffering.’

original: ni nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang gnas par mi bya ba dang / ngan sems mi bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ni nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang gnas par mi bya ba dang / ngan sems mi bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that one should not dwell with those of the Śrāvaka Vehicle and should not have a bad mind.

original: dga' bos gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dag gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba nas de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bslab pa mnyam pa
analyzed: dga' bos gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dag gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba nas de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bslab pa mnyam pa
translated: Nanda said, Blessed One, how should a bodhisattva mahāsattva dwell with persons of the Bodhisattva Vehicle, up to a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in that way is equal in training with the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened ones.

original: yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dang mthun par gnas par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dang mthun par gnas par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage up to yes teaches the abiding in accordance with the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mnyam pa nyid gang la bslab par bgyi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba ni gong du de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa'
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mnyam pa nyid gang la bslab par bgyi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba ni gong du de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa'
translated: said this to the Lord:🔽Lord, what is the sameness of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, in which the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should train?

original: chen po ni bslab pa mnyam pa yin no zhes bstan pa ci ltar bslab pa mnyam pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs zhus pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni bslab pa mnyam pa yin no zhes bstan pa ci ltar bslab pa mnyam pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the question about the reason why the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas are of equal training, as taught above with the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who trains thus is of equal training.

original: @207b bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @207b bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid
analyzed: rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid
translated: “Subhūti, inner emptiness is the sameness of bodhisattva great beings,” and so on, up to “Subhūti, the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is the sameness of bodhisattva great beings.”

original: do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad don dam par stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang sbyar te /
analyzed: do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad don dam par stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang sbyar te /
translated: This is the application to all phenomena being ultimately the eighteen emptinesses.

original: stong pa nyid du slob par mtshungs pa'i phyir bslab pa mnyam pa yin no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du slob par mtshungs pa'i phyir bslab pa mnyam pa yin no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: It is said that the training is the same because the training in emptiness is the same.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: “Form is empty of form,” and so on, up to “the knowledge of all aspects is empty of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Subhūti, this is the sameness of bodhisattva great beings.”

original: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad stong pa bco brgyad la slob par mnyam na chos gang
analyzed: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad stong pa bco brgyad la slob par mnyam na chos gang
translated: With this passage, it is shown that if they are the same in training in the eighteen kinds of emptiness of all phenomena,

original: dang gang stong par bslabs na /
analyzed: dang gang stong par bslabs na /
translated: then in training in the emptiness of which phenomena

original: bslab pa mtshungs shing mnyam ste /
analyzed: bslab pa mtshungs shing mnyam ste /

analyzed: de las gzhan pa yod pa dang / med pa gnyi gar yang bstan du med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it cannot be shown to be either existent or nonexistent.

original: chos gang shin tu dben pa de ni mchis pa 'am ma mchis par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang / med pa gnyi gar bstan du med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /

translated: The meaning of “that which is utterly isolated is neither existent nor nonexistent” is the explanation of the reason that it cannot be shown to be either existent or nonexistent.

original: don dam par chos thams cad yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral te /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, all phenomena are free from the two extremes of existence and nonexistence.

analyzed: shin tu dben pa'i phyir yod pa dang med par gdags shing bstan du med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because they are utterly isolated, they cannot be shown or indicated as either existent or nonexistent.

original: chos gang dben pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar mtha' gnyis dang bral zhing dben pa de mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: The meaning of “that which is isolated does not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening” is the explanation that what is isolated in that way does not fully awaken.

original: ma mchis pa'i chos kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes bya ba ni shin tu dben pa'i don de nyid dngos po med par bstan pa ste /

translated: A nonexistent dharma does not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽This shows that very disengagement itself is nonexistent.

original: dngos po med pa ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyar yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyar yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a nonexistent does not fully awaken.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gang nyon mongs par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gang nyon mongs par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i chos @212a * //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i chos @212a * //
translated: Bhagavān, it is because all dharmas that would be afflicted🔽or purified do not exist and are not existent.

original: thams cad ni ma mchis shing yongs su ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni ma mchis shing yongs su ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why a nonexistent does not fully awaken.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams spangs shing /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams spangs shing /
translated: Full awakening is the abandonment of dharmas belonging to the side of afflictions and the realization of dharmas belonging to the side of purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa las 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa las 'gyur na /
translated: If the factors of purification were to arise from cultivation,

original: chos de dag thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: then all those factors would be ultimately unreal,

original: spang bar bya ba dang bsgom par bya ba gnyis ka med pas /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba dang bsgom par bya ba gnyis ka med pas /
translated: and since there would be neither something to be abandoned nor something to be cultivated,

original: mngon par 'tshang rgyar yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'tshang rgyar yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: there would be no attainment of manifest complete buddhahood.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu dben pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu dben pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Blessed One, it is because the perfection of wisdom is utterly isolated,🔽and so on up to: the knowledge of all aspects is utterly isolated.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shin tu dben pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar gong du chos thams cad shin tu dben zhing dngos po med par mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shin tu dben pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar gong du chos thams cad shin tu dben zhing dngos po med par mdor bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having briefly taught above that all phenomena are utterly isolated and unreal,

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad re re nas smos te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad re re nas smos te /
translated: then subsequently, from the perfection of wisdom up to the knowledge of all aspects, all the factors of purification are mentioned one by one.

original: shin tu dben zhing dngos po med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu dben zhing dngos po med par bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it is extremely isolated and non-existent.

original: chos gang shin tu dben pa de ni bsgom par bgyi ba yang ma lags /
analyzed: chos gang shin tu dben pa de ni bsgom par bgyi ba yang ma lags /
translated: That which is extremely isolated is not something to be cultivated,🔽and is also not something to be cultivated in a specific way.

original: rnam par bsgom par bgyi ba yang ma lags te zhes bya ba ni de ltar shin tu dben zhing dngos po med pa la ni bsgom zhing bsgrub par bya ba yang med /
analyzed: rnam par bsgom par bgyi ba yang ma lags te zhes bya ba ni de ltar shin tu dben zhing dngos po med pa la ni bsgom zhing bsgrub par bya ba yang med /
translated: This teaches that in that way, in what is extremely isolated and non-existent, there is nothing to cultivate and accomplish,

original: gzhig cing spang bar bya ba yang med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhig cing spang bar bya ba yang med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: and there is nothing to destroy and abandon.

original: rnam par bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni sun dbyung ba'am gzhig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni sun dbyung ba'am gzhig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Cultivating in a specific way means to criticize or destroy.

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu dben pa'i slad du /
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu dben pa'i slad du /
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is extremely isolated,🔽no phenomenon is established.

original: chos gang yang sgrub pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar go bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang yang sgrub pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar go bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches in order to make clear the meaning that was explained above.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu dben pa lags na zhes bya ba nas ji ltar dben pas dben pa 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar chos thams cad shin tu dben zhing /🔽rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu dben pa lags na zhes bya ba nas ji ltar dben pas dben pa 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar chos thams cad shin tu dben zhing / rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: “If the perfection of wisdom is extremely isolated” up to “how will an extremely isolated one attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment?” demonstrates that, since all phenomena are extremely isolated and empty of any intrinsic essence,🔽the perfection of wisdom, which is the cause for attaining manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med de shin tu dben pas gang yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med de shin tu dben pas gang yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and unsurpassed enlightenment itself are ultimately non-entities and extremely isolated, so that there is nothing whatsoever that attains manifestly perfect buddhahood.

original: @212b bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @212b bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor legs so legs so zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shin tu dben pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so legs so zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shin tu dben pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

original: rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i don 'khor rnams kyis bstan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir legs so zhes bstod nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i don 'khor rnams kyis bstan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir legs so zhes bstod nas /
