original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad shin tu dben pa dpen no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad shin tu dben pa dpen no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: He said, “All dharmas of purification, such as the perfection of wisdom, are extremely isolated, isolated!”

original: rab 'byor ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa dang zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu dben pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa dang zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu dben pa de bzhin du /
translated: Subhuti, just as the perfection of wisdom is isolated, and so on up to “just as the knowledge of all aspects is extremely isolated,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang shin tu dben pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang shin tu dben pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: just so, unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is extremely isolated.”

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: All dharmas of purification, such as the perfection of wisdom, are ultimately unreal things.

original: shin tu dben pa de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang dngos po med de /
analyzed: shin tu dben pa de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang dngos po med de /
translated: In the same way, the full awakening to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood is also a non-entity.

original: shin tu dben pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu dben pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because of being utterly isolated, there is no full awakening to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood at all.

original: rab 'byor gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu dben par ma gyur na zhes bya ba nas de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu dben par ma gyur na zhes bya ba nas de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Subhūti, if the perfection of wisdom were not utterly isolated, then it would not be the case that it would lead to the full awakening of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: shin tu dben pa'i don bshad pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu dben pa'i don bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the meaning of “utterly isolated.”

original: shin tu dben pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs shing /🔽'khor gsum yongs su dag pa la bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu dben pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs shing / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa la bya ste /
translated: “Utterly isolated” means that it is free from apprehendeds and apprehenders,🔽and it is the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: de ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyad na /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyad na /
translated: Thus, if one practices with the complete purity of the three spheres,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi ming thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi ming thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The names of the phenomena of purification, from the six perfections up to the knowledge of all aspects, are obtained.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma spangs te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma spangs te /
translated: But if subject and object are not abandoned,

original: shin tu dben par ma gyur cing 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i ming thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu dben par ma gyur cing 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i ming thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa pa'o //
translated: and they do not become completely isolated, and the three spheres are not completely pure, the names of the six perfections and so on are not obtained.

original: rab 'byor de bas na ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu dben pa dang zhes bya ba nas ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu dben pa de ltar /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma brten par yang bla na med pa yang dag par @213a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu dben pa dang zhes bya ba nas ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu dben pa de ltar / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma brten par yang bla na med pa yang dag par @213a * //
translated: Subhūti, therefore, just as the perfection of wisdom is completely isolated, up to just as the knowledge of all aspects is completely isolated,🔽in the same way, without relying on the perfection of wisdom, one does not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: enlightenment.

original: de ltar don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med de /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med de /
translated: Thus, ultimately all phenomena are not entities.

original: shin tu dben yang kun rdzob tu shin tu dben pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma brten par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shin tu dben yang kun rdzob tu shin tu dben pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma brten par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Although they are utterly isolated, without depending on the perfection of wisdom, which is utterly isolated in the ultimate, one will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de la brten na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: But if one does depend on it, one will fully awaken by the method of dependent origination.

original: dben pas dben pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dngos po med pas dben te /
analyzed: dben pas dben pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dngos po med pas dben te /
translated: It is taught that “isolation does not fully awaken to isolation” because in the ultimate, the perfection of wisdom is also isolated, being not an entity.

original: de bas na dngos po med pas dngos po med pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pas dngos po med pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that “non-entity does not establish non-entity.”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang yang rgya ba nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang yang rgya ba nas /
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽but without depending on the perfection of wisdom, they do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma brten par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi ga dngos po med de dben pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya yang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma brten par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi ga dngos po med de dben pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya yang /
translated: This is to say, in that way, ultimately both cause and effect are not things, and because they are void, they do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis /
translated: But conventionally, in the manner of dependent origination,

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: they do not not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas /
translated: And that is by depending on the perfection of wisdom.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni don zab mo la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni don zab mo la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: He said, “Lord, bodhisattva great beings practice the profound meaning.”

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Ultimately, all phenomena are empty of intrinsic nature,

original: shin tu dben pas sgrub par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gnyi ga dngos po med pas /
analyzed: shin tu dben pas sgrub par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gnyi ga dngos po med pas /
translated: and since they are utterly isolated, the perfection of wisdom that brings about accomplishment and the perfect complete enlightenment that is to be accomplished are both non-entities.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya la /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya la /
translated: Therefore, one does not fully awaken to complete buddhahood.

original: kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis ;
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis ;
translated: Conventionally, however, by the way of dependent origination,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas /
translated: one relies on the perfection of wisdom🔽and one does fully awaken to complete buddhahood.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'gyur ba'i don zab mo dmigs pa can rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba de lta bu la spyod pa'i phyir don zab mo la spyod pa'o zhes rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'gyur ba'i don zab mo dmigs pa can rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba de lta bu la spyod pa'i phyir don zab mo la spyod pa'o zhes rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'o //
translated: Thus, because one practices that which is difficult for those with reference points to realize, the profound meaning, Subhūti said, “One practices the profound meaning.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @213b pa ;🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @213b pa ; rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is just so.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: Subhūti said, “It is so.”

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar don zab mo la spyod cing /🔽'di lta ste nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar don zab mo la spyod cing / 'di lta ste nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Subhūti, it is difficult for bodhisattva great beings to practice the profound meaning in that way🔽and not actualize that meaning, which would be the level of the śrāvakas🔽or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.”

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gyur ba'i don de mngon du mi byed pa ni dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi don zab mo yang bsgoms la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gyur ba'i don de mngon du mi byed pa ni dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi don zab mo yang bsgoms la /
translated: This passage explains that although they meditate on the profound meaning of emptiness,

original: thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed kyi /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed kyi /
translated: through skillful means they attain the unsurpassed, complete, and perfect enlightenment of a buddha on the conventional level.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid mngon du mi byed pa de lta bu dmigs pa can rnams kyis mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid mngon du mi byed pa de lta bu dmigs pa can rnams kyis mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: It is impossible for those who have reference points to not actualize emptiness, which would be the attainment of the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that this is difficult to do.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, according to my understanding of what the Blessed One has said,

original: dka' ba cung zad kyang mi bgyid na /
analyzed: dka' ba cung zad kyang mi bgyid na /
translated: they do not do anything difficult at all.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dka' ba bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa las mngon du mi bya ba ni dka' yang srid kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dka' ba bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa las mngon du mi bya ba ni dka' yang srid kyi /
translated: It is possible that it is difficult not to manifest something that exists.

original: dngos po med pa la mngon du byar yang med de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la mngon du byar yang med de /
translated: But it is not possible to manifest something that does not exist.

original: de ltar dngos po med cing mngon du byar med pa la /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med cing mngon du byar med pa la /
translated: Thus, with regard to something that does not exist and cannot be manifested,🔽what is difficult about not manifesting it?

original: mngon du mi byed pa lta dka' yang ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon du mi byed pa lta dka' yang ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gang mngon du bgyi ba'i don de yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gang mngon du bgyi ba'i don de yang mi dmigs /
translated: Blessed One, it is because that object which is to be manifested is not apprehended,

original: gang gis mngon du bgyi ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mi dmigs pa /
analyzed: gang gis mngon du bgyi ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mi dmigs pa /
translated: and that perfection of wisdom by which it is to be manifested is also not apprehended.

original: gang mngon du bgyi ba'i chos de yang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni mngon du bya ba'i don stong pa nyid dang / mngon du byed pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon du byed pa'i gang zag kyang don dam par dmigs su med pa'i phyir mngon du mi bya ba ni dka'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang mngon du bgyi ba'i chos de yang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni mngon du bya ba'i don stong pa nyid dang / mngon du byed pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon du byed pa'i gang zag kyang don dam par dmigs su med pa'i phyir mngon du mi bya ba ni dka'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that it is difficult to realize that which is to be realized, namely, emptiness, the cause of realization, namely, the perfection of wisdom, and the person who realizes, because ultimately they are not apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mi dmigs na gang mngon du bgyis pas /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar 'gyur ba'i don mngon du bgyi ba de lta bu yang gang zhig mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mi dmigs na gang mngon du bgyis pas / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar 'gyur ba'i don mngon du bgyi ba de lta bu yang gang zhig mchis /
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are not apprehended, what is that object which,🔽when realized, one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gang zhig gis mngon du bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gang zhig gis mngon du bgyi /
translated: What is that perfection of wisdom which is to be realized?

original: chos mngon du bgyi ba de lta bu gang zhig gis zhes bya ba'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ba'i @214a * //
analyzed: chos mngon du bgyi ba de lta bu gang zhig gis zhes bya ba'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ba'i @214a * //
translated: What is that Dharma which is to be realized, by means of which the Bodhisattva would fall into the levels of the Disciples and the Solitary Sages?

original: stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig mngon du byar med cing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig mngon du byar med cing /
translated: Not only is emptiness alone not to be realized,

original: mi dmigs par ma zad kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i don de lta bu yang gang yang dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs par ma zad kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i don de lta bu yang gang yang dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: but also that very aim of perfect enlightenment, unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, is not to be apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, this is the practice of non-apprehension.🔽The Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices thus attains the absence of darkness regarding all phenomena.

original: de la spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la mun pa ma mchis pa thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos gang mngon du mi byed cing /
analyzed: de la spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la mun pa ma mchis pa thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos gang mngon du mi byed cing /
translated: Thus, when one practices by not realizing any phenomena

original: mi dmigs par spyod na /
analyzed: mi dmigs par spyod na /
translated: and not apprehending them,

original: dmigs pa las gyur pa'i sgrib pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa las gyur pa'i sgrib pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: all obscurations that arise from apprehension are purified.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de skad du bstan pa las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'dzum zhes bya ba nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don gang gi slad du brjod pa'i don de bgyid
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de skad du bstan pa las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'dzum zhes bya ba nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don gang gi slad du brjod pa'i don de bgyid
translated: Blessed One, if the minds of bodhisattva great beings do not become disheartened when taught in this way, then, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom also does what it says it will do.🔽Even though it does what it says it will do, the perfection of wisdom is nonconceptual.

original: kyang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de lta bu'i don zab mo bstan pa la /
analyzed: kyang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de lta bu'i don zab mo bstan pa la /
translated: This passage shows that if, when taught such profound meaning,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar stong pas 'jigs shing skrag par ma gyur na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar stong pas 'jigs shing skrag par ma gyur na /
translated: they do not become frightened and terrified by emptiness like the hearers and solitary realizers,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i yon tan bstan pa dang / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rlom sems mi skye ba dang / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i yon tan bstan pa dang / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rlom sems mi skye ba dang / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: it demonstrates the qualities of practicing the perfection of wisdom, how the conceit of bodhisattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom in that way does not arise, and how, when they practice the perfection of wisdom in that way,

original: bdag gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni ring du gyur par bya /
analyzed: bdag gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni ring du gyur par bya /
translated: and I will approach omniscience.”🔽The passage from “Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the venerable Su­bhūti” to “The elder Su­bhūti replied, ‘Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, all phenomena are non-conceptual’” explains how the bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom and the non-conceptual perfection of wisdom are like a dream.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nye bar gyur par bya'o snyam du sems pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa dpe dang bcas par bstan pa ste /🔽tshig gnyer ni rang log tu zad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nye bar gyur par bya'o snyam du sems pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa dpe dang bcas par bstan pa ste / tshig gnyer ni rang log tu zad do //
translated: The two lines “The elder Su­bhūti replied, ‘Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, all phenomena are non-conceptual’” are a summary line.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor gyis smras pa tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu chos thams cad ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor gyis smras pa tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu chos thams cad ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of wisdom?🔽What is the bodhisattva great beings’ non-conceptual wisdom?🔽What is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of wisdom?

original: rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa de bzhin du /
translated: What is the bodhisattva great beings’ non-conceptual wisdom?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams la @214b thug gi bar du /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams la @214b thug gi bar du /
translated: The five perfections and so on, up to and including the knowledge of all things and the compounded and uncompounded elements,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: are all of one taste in emptiness.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te de ltar chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa yin na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te de ltar chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa yin na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, if all phenomena are nonconceptual,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su brjod pa yang ci las gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar gong du chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog par bstan pa las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su brjod pa yang ci las gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar gong du chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog par bstan pa las /
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all things, then how is it that you say, ‘Venerable Subhūti, please teach this assembly the Dharma discourse on the perfection of wisdom’?🔽” In this way, the questioner, Śāriputra, having heard the above teaching on the nonconceptuality of all phenomena,

original: 'khor gyi nang na kha cig de ltar chos thams cad stong par ro gcig na /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang na kha cig de ltar chos thams cad stong par ro gcig na /
translated: some members of the assembly thought, “If all phenomena are of one taste in emptiness,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas /
translated: then saṃsāra and nirvāṇa are also of one taste in emptiness.

original: ci yang bya mi dgos so snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o ;
analyzed: ci yang bya mi dgos so snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o ;
translated: Śāriputra asks in order to dispel the idea that nothing need be done.

original: / rab 'byor gyis smras pa tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas rnam par mi rtog pa las sangs rgyas su brjod do //
analyzed: / rab 'byor gyis smras pa tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas rnam par mi rtog pa las sangs rgyas su brjod do //
translated: Subhūti says, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, from nonconceptuality, it is said, ‘buddha,’

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las byang chub tu brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las byang chub tu brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: from nonconceptuality, it is said, ‘awakening.’🔽”

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: This shows that ultimately all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: rnam par mi rtog kyang kun rdzob tu las legs nyes ci byas pa'i 'bras bu skyed sdug med pa ma yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog kyang kun rdzob tu las legs nyes ci byas pa'i 'bras bu skyed sdug med pa ma yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Even though they are nonconceptual, it is not the case that they do not produce the results of good and bad actions conventionally.

original: sems can so so'i skye bo yang dag par ma mthong zhing /
analyzed: sems can so so'i skye bo yang dag par ma mthong zhing /
translated: Ordinary beings, who do not see reality,

original: phyin ci log tu rtog cing dpyod pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i las spyad pas /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtog cing dpyod pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i las spyad pas /
translated: engage in actions that are the cause of saṃsāra,

original: 'bras bu yang 'khor ba nyid du rnam par smin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang 'khor ba nyid du rnam par smin te /
translated: and the result of those actions ripens as saṃsāra itself.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i nang du skye /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i nang du skye /
translated: They are born in the five realms.

original: sems can gang blo phyin ci log tu ma gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gang blo phyin ci log tu ma gyur te /
translated: Those sentient beings whose minds are not distorted,

original: 'khor ba'i chos rnams la ma chags shing /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos rnams la ma chags shing /
translated: who are not attached to the phenomena of cyclic existence,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa rnams ni 'khor ba las thar te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa rnams ni 'khor ba las thar te /
translated: and who are nonconceptual are liberated from cyclic existence

original: 'phags pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and attain the grounds of the noble ones.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, in the past🔽as many tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas as there are

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed byung ba zhes bya ba nas rnam par mi rtog pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed byung ba zhes bya ba nas rnam par mi rtog pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas /
translated: have practiced the nonconceptual perfection of wisdom

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: and fully awakened to all phenomena, which are nonconceptual.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa bsgoms pa las 'phags pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa bsgoms pa las 'phags pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage explains the reason why attaining the grounds of the noble ones comes from cultivating nonconceptuality.🔽The blessed buddhas of the three times have abandoned conceptuality

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa spangs pa la /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa spangs pa la /
translated: and

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa brtsan par bya ste /🔽rnam par mi rtog @215a * //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa brtsan par bya ste / rnam par mi rtog @215a * //
translated: In order to fully awaken to buddhahood, one should rely on the non-conceptual suchness of all phenomena.

original: pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par mi rtog par spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par mi rtog par spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: One should practice non-conceptually in the perfection of non-conceptual wisdom.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa las le'u bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa las le'u bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the thirty-eighth chapter on the perfection of wisdom in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
translated: Then the Venerable Śāradvatīputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i don gong du bshad pa sh'a ri'i bus
analyzed: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i don gong du bshad pa sh'a ri'i bus
translated: Oh, Venerable Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom practices the essence. This explains the meaning of non-conceptuality as explained above. Śāriputra

original: rtogs na / de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i don la spyod pa ni spyod pa'i mchog dam pa snying por gyur pa la spyod do zhes bstod pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs na / de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i don la spyod pa ni spyod pa'i mchog dam pa snying por gyur pa la spyod do zhes bstod pa'o //
translated: If one understands, then one practices in the essence of the supreme, holy practice of the meaning of non-conceptuality.🔽Thus it is praised.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Subhūti said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni snying po med pa la'o zhes bya ba ni gong du snying po la spyod do zhes bshad
analyzed: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni snying po med pa la'o zhes bya ba ni gong du snying po la spyod do zhes bshad
translated: “Ah, venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom practices in the insubstantial.”

original: pa la 'khor gyi nang na kha cig snying por gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po yod dam snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa la 'khor gyi nang na kha cig snying por gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po yod dam snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: This is said in order to dispel the thought of some in the assembly who wonder, “Is there such a substantial essence as has been explained above?”

original: snying po med pa la spyod pa'o zhes smras te /
analyzed: snying po med pa la spyod pa'o zhes smras te /
translated: “He practices in the insubstantial.”

original: snying po zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa'i nang nas mchog la bya /
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa'i nang nas mchog la bya /
translated: The term “essence” refers to the best of all existent things.

original: snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “essenceless”

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med la bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med la bya ste /
translated: refers to the fact that ultimately all phenomena are empty of intrinsic nature and are non-things.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po med pa la spyod pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po med pa la spyod pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that bodhisattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom practice in the absence of essence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is essenceless.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni snying po med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni snying po med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Up to: the knowledge of all aspects is essenceless.

original: snying po med pa la spyod pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: snying po med pa la spyod pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason for practicing in the absence of essence.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po med pa ste /
translated: The phenomena from the six perfections up to omniscience are ultimately non-entities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang chos de dag la spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang chos de dag la spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: And the bodhisattvas also practice those phenomena.🔽Therefore, they practice without a core.

original: snying po med pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying po med pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @215b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @215b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
translated: Because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend or see even the absence of a core.🔽How could they possibly apprehend a core?

original: snying po la dmigs pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa la drug la sogs pa don dam par dngos po med pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa' don grub par bya ba de dag la yang mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: snying po la dmigs pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa la drug la sogs pa don dam par dngos po med pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa' don grub par bya ba de dag la yang mi dmigs shing /
translated: This is the non-apprehension of the phenomena from the six perfections up to omniscience, which are ultimately non-entities, and the non-apprehension of the bodhisattvas who accomplish the goal.

original: dngos por mi lta na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don snying po can du dmigs pa lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: dngos por mi lta na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don snying po can du dmigs pa lta ga la yod de /
translated: If one does not view things as real, how could one observe a non-existent thing as having an essence?

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni snying po med pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni snying po med pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom practices in the absence of an essence.🔽Then, a great many sons of gods from the desire realm and the form realm had this thought...

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu shin tu mang po dag 'di snyam du gyur te zhes bya ba nas chos kyi mnyam pa nyid 'di mngon du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar chos thams
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu shin tu mang po dag 'di snyam du gyur te zhes bya ba nas chos kyi mnyam pa nyid 'di mngon du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar chos thams
translated: ...those who do not actualize this sameness of phenomena are worthy of homage.

original: cad snying po med par rtogs kyang /
analyzed: cad snying po med par rtogs kyang /
translated: Thus, although one realizes that all phenomena are essenceless,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa mi gtong zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa mi gtong zhing /
translated: one does not abandon generating the mind for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa zab mo dmigs su med pa la spyod kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid mngon du mi byed pa de lta bu dkon pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa zab mo dmigs su med pa la spyod kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid mngon du mi byed pa de lta bu dkon pas /
translated: Although they practice the profound perfection of wisdom, which is not an object, they do not actualize the śrāvakas’ and pratyekabuddhas’ reality of the perfect endpoint and emptiness.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since such is rare, those bodhisattvas who practice in that way are worthy of homage.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas gang yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya ba'i sems can de dag shin tu mi dmigs pa ni de dag la de bas dka' ste zhes
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas gang yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya ba'i sems can de dag shin tu mi dmigs pa ni de dag la de bas dka' ste zhes
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti addressed those divine princes, saying, “It is not difficult to actualize the reality of the perfect endpoint and emptiness,

original: bya ba'i bar gyis ni /🔽dmigs su med pa'i chos la spyod la /
analyzed: bya ba'i bar gyis ni / dmigs su med pa'i chos la spyod la /
translated: which is not an object,🔽and to practice the profound perfection of wisdom, which is not an object,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa de tsam du mi dka' de bas kyang sems can mang po'i don bya bar yi dam bcas la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa de tsam du mi dka' de bas kyang sems can mang po'i don bya bar yi dam bcas la /
translated: and not to actualize the śrāvakas’ and pratyekabuddhas’ reality of the perfect endpoint and emptiness.

original: sems can de dag mi dmigs pa ni rab tu dka' ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag mi dmigs pa ni rab tu dka' ste /
translated: It is very difficult to not apprehend those sentient beings.

original: de ltar spyod pa ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, one who practices in that way is worthy of homage.🔽The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices in that way has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, thinking, “I will tame all sentient beings.”

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad gdul bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sems can mang po'i don du go🔽cha yang bgos la /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad gdul bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sems can mang po'i don du go cha yang bgos la /
translated: He has put on the armor for the sake of many sentient beings,

original: sems can yang mi dmigs pa de ni bdag gi @216a * //
analyzed: sems can yang mi dmigs pa de ni bdag gi @216a * //
translated: and he does not apprehend those sentient beings.

original: don 'ba' zhig byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don 'ba' zhig byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: He is not just working for his own benefit.

original: sems can gyi don gtso bor byed la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don gtso bor byed la /
translated: He is working primarily for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: de yang mi dmigs pas de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pas de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and he does not apprehend them. Thus, one who practices in that way has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gang sems can 'dul bar sems pa ni nam mkha' 'dul bar sems pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba nas nam mkha' gsog pa'i phyir sems can gsog tu lta ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang sems can 'dul bar sems pa ni nam mkha' 'dul bar sems pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba nas nam mkha' gsog pa'i phyir sems can gsog tu lta ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why sentient beings are not observed.

original: don dam pa'i sems can dngos po med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i sems can dngos po med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
translated: Since ultimate sentient beings are not things, they are like space.

original: sems can 'dul ba ni nam mkha' 'dul ba dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba ni nam mkha' 'dul ba dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Training sentient beings is like training space.

original: dben pa dang stong pa nyid dang / snying po med pa dang / gsog ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dben pa dang stong pa nyid dang / snying po med pa dang / gsog ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: Isolation, emptiness, corelessness, and accumulation are to be known as synonyms for non-thing.

original: lha'i bu dag rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag rnam grangs des na /
translated: Gods, by this one of many explanations,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can med pa rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni dka' ba ste zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la dngos po yod pa'i bya ba byed pa ni thabs mi mkhas par bya bar🔽dka'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gang sems can rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni nam mkha' dang brtsad par 'dod pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems can dngos po med pa'i dpe nam mkha' las blangs te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can med pa rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni dka' ba ste zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la dngos po yod pa'i bya ba byed pa ni thabs mi mkhas par bya bar dka'o zhes bya ba'i don to // gang sems can rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni nam mkha' dang brtsad par 'dod pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems can dngos po med pa'i dpe nam mkha' las blangs te bstan pa ste /
translated: This means that it is difficult for the unskilled to perform an action that has an existent entity as its object when the object is nonexistent.🔽Those who don the armor for the sake of sentient beings are desirous of arguing with space.🔽This teaches that the example of space is taken up and taught for the purpose of taming nonexistent sentient beings.

original: sems can dngos po med pa 'dul ba'i don du go cha gyon pa ni nam mkha' 'dul du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dngos po med pa 'dul ba'i don du go cha gyon pa ni nam mkha' 'dul du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Those who don the armor for the purpose of taming nonexistent sentient beings are desirous of taming space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha de yang bgos la sems can gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams

analyzed: 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig thob par bya ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / thob par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dngos po yod dam snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid la ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan gang yang mi dmigs na /

analyzed: khyod kyis zhus pa rnams bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //

analyzed: de ni gnas med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni //

translated: Up to this point, it shows the reason why the bodhisattva's practice is superior to the practice of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

translated: Thus, when the Blessed One’s bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom, who is superior to the practice of hearers and solitary buddhas, was heard by the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three and the one hundred and sixty monks who were in that retinue, the gods made great offerings.

original: dge slong rnams kyis kyang mchod pa chen po byas nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis kyang mchod pa chen po byas nas /

analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa las khyad par du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa dam pa la spyod par gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa dang lung bstan pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The monks made the aspiration, “May we practice the holy practice of the perfection of wisdom, which is superior to the practice of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.”🔽The Buddha explained the prophecy.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de zhes bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de zhes bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod par 'dod pas /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, knowing my thoughts, said to me, “Subhūti, you should train in the Tathāgata’s way of life.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to engage in the Tathāgata’s way of life should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: dge stong brgya drug cu po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dad pa skyes nas /
analyzed: dge stong brgya drug cu po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dad pa skyes nas /
translated: The six hundred monks who were practicing the perfection of wisdom gave rise to faith.

original: smon lam btab pa yang 'di ltar lung bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: smon lam btab pa yang 'di ltar lung bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: If we connect the prophecy with the aspiration they made,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni de ltar mthu che zhing bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas de la spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni de ltar mthu che zhing bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas de la spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since one who practices the perfection of wisdom has such great power and will completely fulfill one’s wishes, one should practice it.

original: dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “ Nanda, a son of noble family or daughter of noble family who has the perfection of wisdom…”

original: dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ni /
analyzed: dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ni /
translated: “ Nanda, that son of noble family or daughter of noble family

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: should be known as one who has served the victors of the past, who has planted the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i gshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i gshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: and who has been taken hold of by a spiritual friend.”

original: tshe rabs snga ma la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad cing dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs spyad pa las /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad cing dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs spyad pa las /
translated: This passage shows that in previous lives one has practiced the perfection of wisdom and various roots of virtue.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: One will practice this perfection of wisdom,

original: gzhan gyis de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: but others will not.

original: dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lta yang mi slu ste /
analyzed: dga' bo rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lta yang mi slu ste /
translated: Nanda, a son or daughter of good lineage who has planted wholesome roots with the Tathāgatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas, will not be deceived.

original: nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pas shin tu rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pas shin tu rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Even if they become śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas, they should understand this very thoroughly by practicing the knowledge of path aspects.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang skyed kyang theg pa gsum gyi 'bras bu thob pa ltar gdon mi za bar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang skyed kyang theg pa gsum gyi 'bras bu thob pa ltar gdon mi za bar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Even if they plant wholesome roots, they will certainly attain the fruits of the three vehicles.

original: 'on kyang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin shin tu rtogs par bya ste /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob @222a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin shin tu rtogs par bya ste / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob @222a * //
translated: However, they should understand the nature of phenomena very thoroughly.

original: par bya ba'i bar ma dor nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: par bya ba'i bar ma dor nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They should not fall to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels in the interval before they attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: don de nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir shin tu rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir shin tu rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs
translated: In order to explain that meaning clearly, it says, “The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have a thorough realization and who practice the perfection of generosity” and so on, up to “who practice the knowledge of all aspects are not śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.”🔽🔽

original: rgyas su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rgyas su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: In order to explain that meaning clearly, it is shown by the passage beginning with “The bodhisattva great beings who have a thorough understanding of the perfection of generosity” and ending with “will not become śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.”

original: dga' bo de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad de zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: dga' bo de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad de zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: “Therefore, Nanda, I entrust this profound perfection of wisdom to you” and so on up to “you will approach omniscience” shows that the perfection of wisdom

original: mdo sde gzhan thams cad pas mchog yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang 'dra ba la sogs pa'i yon tan smos nas nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir gtad cing gtams pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan thams cad pas mchog yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang 'dra ba la sogs pa'i yon tan smos nas nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir gtad cing gtams pa bstan pa'o //
translated: is superior to all other sūtras and, having mentioned its qualities such as being like the Tathāgata himself, it teaches the entrustment and the entrusting in order to prevent its decline.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Nanda, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of the Blessed Buddhas arises from the perfection of wisdom.

original: dga' bo de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: dga' bo de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Nanda, therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and who wishes to train in the six perfections should train in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa dang / mchod cing rim gro bya ba dang / yongs su mi gtong ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa dang / mchod cing rim gro bya ba dang / yongs su mi gtong ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage explains the reasons for training in the perfection of wisdom, making offerings and service, and not abandoning it.

original: 'das pa dang ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa rnams kyi byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslab cing yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa rnams kyi byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslab cing yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes
translated: Because the enlightenment of the Blessed Buddhas of the past, future, and present who dwell in the ten directions has come forth from this perfection of wisdom, this perfection of wisdom should be trained in and not given up.

original: bstan pa'o ; / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa'o ; / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' bo 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ma ste skyed par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya ba'i gtan🔽tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dga' bo 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ma ste skyed par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: “ Nanda, it is like this: the perfection of wisdom is the mother of the bodhisattva great beings, the producer.” This teaches the reason for training in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas dang @222b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so so'i sa brnyes pa yang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang @222b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so so'i sa brnyes pa yang /
translated: The attainment of the individual grounds by the buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te brnyes shing 'di'i rgyus bla na med pa'i byang chub brnyes pa'i phyir 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te brnyes shing 'di'i rgyus bla na med pa'i byang chub brnyes pa'i phyir 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: One should train in this perfection of wisdom, because one attains the unsurpassed enlightenment through the cause of relying on this perfection of wisdom and attaining it.

original: dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa de dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa de dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Nanda, all those bodhisattva mahasattvas who train in the six perfections will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: dga' bo de bas na khyod la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag yang dang yang du yongs su gtad do //
analyzed: dga' bo de bas na khyod la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag yang dang yang du yongs su gtad do //
translated: Therefore, Nanda, I entrust these six perfections to you again and again,🔽 up to I commend them to you.

original: rjes su gtad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su gtad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught to clarify the meaning explained above.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams skyed par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams skyed par byed pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, since this perfection of wisdom gives rise to the bodhisattvas,

original: mi bslab tu mi rung gi nyams par mi 'gyur bar yun ring du gnas shing /
analyzed: mi bslab tu mi rung gi nyams par mi 'gyur bar yun ring du gnas shing /
translated: It is not suitable to not train, but it is not a downfall to not be able to maintain it for a long time without degeneration.

original: rgya cher spel ba'i phyir khyod la gtad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgya cher spel ba'i phyir khyod la gtad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: I entrust it to you so that it will not be lost, but will remain for a long time and spread widely.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod do zhes bya ba nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod do zhes bya ba nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Nanda, the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha has entrusted this Dharma treasure to you, and so on up to:🔽he will pass into parinirvāṇa.🔽He has passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: He will pass into parinirvāṇa.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / de dag gi 'khor nyan thos rnams dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i rgyus so so'i go 'phang thob cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / de dag gi 'khor nyan thos rnams dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i rgyus so so'i go 'phang thob cing /
translated: In this way, the Blessed Buddhas of the three times, together with their retinues of hearers, have attained their respective states through this perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di la brten te chos ston to zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la brten te chos ston to zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: and they teach the Dharma in dependence on it.

original: dga' bo gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams la /
analyzed: dga' bo gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams la /
translated: Nanda, if you were to teach

original: nyan thos kyi sa las brtsams te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las brtsams te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the śrāvaka vehicle to individuals of the śrāvaka vehicle,

original: nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: you would have performed the activity of a śrāvaka.

original: theg pa chung ngu'i chos bstan pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dgra bcom par gyur par byas pa pas /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i chos bstan pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dgra bcom par gyur par byas pa pas /
translated: By teaching the Dharma of the Lesser Vehicle, you would have made all the sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm into arhats.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di tshig 'ga' tsam zhing bstan pa phan yon che ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di tshig 'ga' tsam zhing bstan pa phan yon che ba bstan pa'o //
translated: Compared to that, if you were to teach just a few words of this profound perfection of wisdom to a bodhisattva, the benefit would be greater.🔽Nanda, what do you think?

original: dga' bo de ji snyam du sems chos bstan pa snga ma des zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dga' bo de ji snyam du sems chos bstan pa snga ma des zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The earlier teaching of the Dharma...

original: des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo thams @223a * //
analyzed: des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo thams @223a * //
translated: all the sons and daughters of good family of the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zil gyis non par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dus gcig tu dgra bcom par gyur te /
analyzed: cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zil gyis non par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dus gcig tu dgra bcom par gyur te /
translated: a moment, a second, or a mere instant is greater than the merit of all the sentient beings of a billion world systems becoming arhats

original: sbyin pa byin pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa dang / bsgom pa byas pa'i bsod nams pas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chung ngu na nyi ma 'ga'am nyi ma phyed dam /🔽snga dro 'ga'am chu tshod 'ga'am /🔽skad cig gam yud tsam mam /🔽thang cig tsam bshad pa bsod nams che ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa dang / bsgom pa byas pa'i bsod nams pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chung ngu na nyi ma 'ga'am nyi ma phyed dam / snga dro 'ga'am chu tshod 'ga'am / skad cig gam yud tsam mam / thang cig tsam bshad pa bsod nams che ba bstan pa'o //
translated: and giving gifts, guarding ethical discipline, and cultivating meditative concentration.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is because they want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening themselves.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams pa'i gnas med de de ni gnas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams pa'i gnas med de de ni gnas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: There is no possibility of falling away from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa bsod nams che ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa bsod nams che ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the great merit of explaining this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa ni bdag dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa byed la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa ni bdag dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa byed la /
translated: Explaining the perfection of wisdom accomplishes the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las nyams par 'gyur ba mi srid do zhes bstan pa'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas dga' bo chos thams cad ni shes pa med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las nyams par 'gyur ba mi srid do zhes bstan pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas dga' bo chos thams cad ni shes pa med pa /
translated: It teaches that it is impossible to fall away from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽When this perfection of wisdom is being explained,

original: mthong ba med pa /
analyzed: mthong ba med pa /
translated: all phenomena are without consciousness, without seeing,

original: bya ba la mthu med pa sha stag ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: bya ba la mthu med pa sha stag ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: and without power in action.

original: chos thams cad la dngos po yod par mi lta ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dngos po yod par mi lta ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This teaches that all phenomena should not be viewed as having substance.

original: rdzu 'phrul mdzad pa phyis bltar med pa'i dpes chos thams cad kyang dngos po bltar med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mdzad pa phyis bltar med pa'i dpes chos thams cad kyang dngos po bltar med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The example of the magical creation of a miracle, which cannot be seen later, teaches that all phenomena are also things that cannot be seen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Nanda, all phenomena are like space, without activity, without agent, and without grasping.

analyzed: dga' bo chos thams cad ni nam mkha' ltar byed pa med pas byed pa med cing 'dzin pa med pa'o zhes bya ba nas snying po med pa'i phyir tshor ba med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dngos po med cing byed pa med pa dpe dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to “because they are without essence, they are without feeling,” this teaches with an example that they are without entity and without activity.

analyzed: dper na nam mkha' dang sgyu ma'i skyes bu dngos po med cing sems med pas ci yang mi byed pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par sgrub pas so sor gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: don dam par de ltar dngos po med pas byed pa @223b po med kyi /
translated: Ultimately, since they are like that, without entity, they are without agent.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu snang ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bsgrub pa la brten pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the appearance in the conventional is merely based on the establishment by causes and conditions.

analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ste zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: the one who is approved by the buddhas, the one praised by the buddhas.

analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing slob pa ni /
translated: This teaches that if one realizes all phenomena to be unreal, then practicing and training in the perfection of wisdom

analyzed: dmigs pa can gyi spyod pa thams cad pas khyad par du 'phags pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: is superior to all the practices of those with reference points.

original: de la gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams stong gsum gyi stong pa chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di phyag g-yas pas gyen du bteg cing zhes bya ba nas mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams stong gsum gyi stong pa chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di phyag g-yas pas gyen du bteg cing zhes bya ba nas mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Standing in that, the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, with their right hand raise up this billion-world-galactic universe, and so on up to:

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i mthu dang yon tan che ba bstan pa'o // dga' bo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshad gzung ba'am /
translated: Thus, the greatness of the power and the virtues of the practice of the perfection of wisdom is shown.

original: mtha' btsal bar 'dod pa ni nam mkha' tshad gzung ba dang / mtha' btsal bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mtha' btsal bar 'dod pa ni nam mkha' tshad gzung ba dang / mtha' btsal bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Nanda, whoever wants to grasp the measure of, or seek the end of, the practice of the perfection of wisdom, is just like someone who wants to grasp the measure of, or seek the end of, space.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par bya bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' zad par bya bar sems su zad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar yon tan chen po dang ldan pas
translated: The passage from “Ānanda, one who thinks that the perfection of wisdom is to be exhausted is one who thinks that space is to be exhausted” indicates that the perfection of wisdom has such great qualities.

analyzed: / kun rdzob tu yon tan tshad med cing zad mi shes pa dang / zad par mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “The knowledge of all aspects is not exhausted, is not being exhausted, and will not be exhausted”🔽indicates that the perfection of wisdom is not exhausted.

original: chos de dag la ni skye ba yang med na /
analyzed: chos de dag la ni skye ba yang med na /
translated: The passage from “Those phenomena have no arising,

translated: so how could they be exhausted?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig dngos po med de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig dngos po med de /
translated: indicates that the perfection of wisdom alone is not a thing.

original: tshad gzung du med cing mi zad par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: tshad gzung du med cing mi zad par ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only that it is immeasurable and inexhaustible,🔽but also that

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin de dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: All phenomena, from the perfection of meditative stabilization up to omniscience, are also like that nature.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ljags kyi @224a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ljags kyi @224a * //
translated: Then the Bhagavān extended his tongue

original: dbang po bkram ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dbang po bkram ste zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: dga' bo khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs gang bzung bas /

original: chos thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs bstan pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs bstan pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yon tan mang po bshad pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yon tan mang po bshad pa /

analyzed: 'khor rnams kyis yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make the retinue believe,🔽the Bhagavān extended his tongue
