analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sho ba mi gsungs pa'i rtags su ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste bstan nam /
translated: and said, “Nanda, this is the dhāraṇī of the perfection of wisdom that you should uphold.🔽This is the teaching of the dhāraṇī of the perfection of wisdom by which all phenomena are upheld.”

original: ngas bstan pa bzhin du yid ches par gyis la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dge slong dang ; dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor bzhi po rnams la rgya cher ston cig ces bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: ngas bstan pa bzhin du yid ches par gyis la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dge slong dang ; dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor bzhi po rnams la rgya cher ston cig ces bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: As I have taught, have confidence and extensively teach this profound perfection of wisdom to the four retinues of fully ordained monks, fully ordained nuns, laymen, and laywomen.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las le'u lnga bcu pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las le'u lnga bcu pa'o /

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du gyur te zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi pas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to Bhagavan, the perfection of wisdom is not made.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na /
translated: As explained above,

analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang zab la /

analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de ltar zab na /

analyzed: de dag ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba zhus pa ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi pas pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo dngos po med pa ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i thabs zhu ba'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir smras pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi pas pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo dngos po med pa ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i thabs zhu ba'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir smras pa'o //
translated: This is said in order to raise the discussion about the method of accomplishing the profound perfection of wisdom, which is non-existent.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' mi zad pa'i phyir /
translated: Subhūti, because space is inexhaustible,🔽the perfection of wisdom is inexhaustible.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par dngos po med de /

analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i phyir mi zad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //

analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is like space.

original: dngos po med na ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par bya zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med na ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par bya zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: If there are no entities, how can one perfect anything?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor gzugs mi zad pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor gzugs mi zad pas /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon @224b par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /🔽rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi zad pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon @224b par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas / rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi zad pas /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be actualized because form is inexhaustible.🔽Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be actualized because the knowledge of all aspects is inexhaustible.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: This teaches that all phenomena such as form and so forth are ultimately non-entities,

original: mi zad par shes pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa mngon par bsgrubs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi zad par shes pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa mngon par bsgrubs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and that the realization of the non-conceptual perfection of wisdom is the knowledge that they are inexhaustible.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
translated: Subhūti, furthermore, the perfection of wisdom should be actualized because form is inexhaustible like space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The bodhisattva great being should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
translated: Subhūti, since the knowledge of all aspects is inexhaustible like space,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: the bodhisattva great being should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi zad pa nam mkha'i dpes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi zad pa nam mkha'i dpes bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage from “The bodhisattva great being should accomplish the perfection of wisdom” to “Subhūti, since the knowledge of all aspects is inexhaustible like space” teaches that form and so on are inexhaustible through the example of space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dngos po med pas zad par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dngos po med pas zad par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space is not exhausted because it is not a thing,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang don dam par nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dngos po med pas zad mi shes par rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang don dam par nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dngos po med pas zad mi shes par rtogs par byas nas /
translated: in the same way, all phenomena such as form and so on are to be realized as being inexhaustible because they are not things, like space in the ultimate.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Having realized this, the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom will be perfected.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang ma rig pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang ma rig pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, since ignorance is inexhaustible like space,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor rga shi dang / myang ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par brtag pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: rab 'byor rga shi dang / myang ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par brtag pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: Subhūti, since aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and disturbance are inexhaustible like space,🔽the bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pa mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage from “Furthermore, Subhūti, since ignorance is inexhaustible like space” up to “Subhūti, since aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and disturbance are inexhaustible like space, the bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom” teaches the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom through the analysis of the twelve factors of dependent arising.

original: de yang kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis lugs dang lugs ma yin par rnam par bltas nas /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis lugs dang lugs ma yin par rnam par bltas nas /
translated: Moreover, having observed the twelve members of dependent origination in terms of the forward and reverse orders on the covering level,

original: don dam par de dag kyang nam mkha' ltar dngos po med de zad mi shes par rtogs @225a * //
analyzed: don dam par de dag kyang nam mkha' ltar dngos po med de zad mi shes par rtogs @225a * //
translated: one should realize that ultimately they are like space, without substance, and inexhaustible.

original: par byas nas /
analyzed: par byas nas /
translated: Having done that,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: one will complete the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhuti, that is how the bodhisattva mahasattva should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: gong du gzugs la sogs pa mi zad pas /
analyzed: gong du gzugs la sogs pa mi zad pas /
translated: This is saying that, as previously explained, by the inexhaustibility of form and so on,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa nam mkha' las dpe blangs te zad mi shes pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa nam mkha' las dpe blangs te zad mi shes pas /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is accomplished, and by the inexhaustibility of form and so on, which is illustrated by the example of space,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par brtags pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par brtags pa'i sgo nas /

translated: Subhūti, in this way, when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas view dependent origination, they do not see any dharma arising without a cause. This is as stated above.

analyzed: chos thams cad la phyin ci log tu lta bar mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spang bar bya ba la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas /

translated: All phenomena, from the knowledge of all aspects such as the perfection of wisdom, up to the abandonment of all residual impression connections, are ultimately empty of intrinsic reality.

original: blta bar bya ba'i dngos por yang med la /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba'i dngos por yang med la /

analyzed: chos de dag thams cad la phyin ci log tu mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rang rang gi stan pa la 'dug mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

original: gang gi phyir de gzung zhing phyir zlog pa'i glags mi rnyed gting mi rnyed do zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar zad mi shes par rtogs shing /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par @227a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gzung zhing phyir zlog pa'i glags mi rnyed gting mi rnyed do zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar zad mi shes par rtogs shing / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par @227a * //
translated: The phrase “because they cannot find an opportunity to seize it and turn it back” means that, in this way, one realizes that all phenomena are like space and inexhaustible.

analyzed: bdud 'ba' zhig gis mi tshugs shing bar chad bya mi nus par ma zad kyi /

translated: Therefore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who wishes to quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should practice the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la goms shing dbang du gyur pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi 'jigs shing /
translated: The samādhi called “the lion’s play” is when, through being accustomed to and mastering the meditative concentrations and meditative absorptions, one is fearless in the face of adverse factors and,

original: bag mi tsha bar lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa dang / thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bag mi tsha bar lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa dang / thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa la bya'o //
translated: without hesitation, enters into meditative absorption in accordance with the forward order, in accordance with the reverse order, and in a skipping manner.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:🔽“Blessed One, how should a bodhisattva great being train in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, how long has the bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses such skillful means

original: yun ring po ji srid cig nas yang dag par zhugs pa lags zhes bya ba nas /🔽yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i tshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du pha rol tu phyin pa gcig spyad pa'i zhar la /
analyzed: yun ring po ji srid cig nas yang dag par zhugs pa lags zhes bya ba nas / yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i tshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du pha rol tu phyin pa gcig spyad pa'i zhar la /
translated: set out on the path?🔽Up to: There is no perfection of wisdom that he has not completed.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug car yongs su rdzogs par byed nus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dkon pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug car yongs su rdzogs par byed nus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dkon pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows how rare it is for a bodhisattva to be able to complete all six perfections as a by-product of practicing one perfection, as explained above.

original: yun ring po nas byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: yun ring po nas byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: For a long time he has generated the mind of enlightenment.

original: bskal pa grangs mang por byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas pas /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs mang por byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas pas /
translated: They will have such skill in means, having practiced the bodhisattva deeds for many eons, having served many buddhas, and having completed all the deeds of the six perfections.

original: thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dag dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dag dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, those bodhisattva great beings who have such skill in means are amazing.”
